Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MejyPoo
Reviews.Content: Just a typical new York hotel, large rooms, comfy beds, bathroom very dated. However it was clean and slap bang in the middle of attractions, not far from times square or central park.

Reviews.Title: “windy”
Reviews.Author: allenexeter
Reviews.Content: Never been in such a drafty room as this on the 17th floor.Bit of a gale blows through from the "sealed" balcony door,and a small limbo dancer could have entered our room under the front door.It was very cold the 1st night we stayed, and the heater? made a lot of noise for not a lot of heat,Only had 1 bedside light and 1 bedside table, 1 each side would be good, the internet on TV wasnt available .On the plus side the breakfast was good, the room was clean and location is good.Would I stay here again,probably, only in a lower floor room..

Reviews.Title: “Great stop over and location.”
Reviews.Author: BLHickson
Reviews.Content: Good room. Clean, cheap, very helpful front desk personnel. Would definitely stay again. The location can't be beat, 1 1/2 blocks from subway to take you anywhere. Get a room away from renovation noises, another guest complained about it in the elevator but we had no noise what so ever. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Big room, cheap for NY City”
Reviews.Author: stamfordnortheastgal
Reviews.Content: Wanted to be close to the Theatre District, so this filled the bill! Usually the rooms in NYC are small for the price that you are paying....so if you want larger, and in this area, then this is the place to be. Yes...the plumbing in the hotel is something to be desired! Very loud flushes and crazy loud banging of door!! The bathroom is very small and the FLUSH from the toilets will almost suck you in! WOW!! The splash it creates is CRAZY!! Also, the bathroom tiles on the floor are sooooooooooooo very slippery! The Trip was with "the girls" and all of us almost went down due to the slippery tiles! This was true in shoes, socks or bare feet! Very dangerous! We also HATED the handicap shower....UGH!! That said...it was in a GREAT location with very accessible restaurants and bars in a very close walking distance. Try Bello and the Eatery...blocks away on 9th! We stayed in the South tower....less noise than North Tower. I am not sure we were in a newly renovated room....sure didn't seem like it!! But...we weren't in NYC to stay in a hotel room for long periods of time!!

Reviews.Title: “Great base in an unbelievable City!”
Reviews.Author: Michaela_1987
Reviews.Content: Best holiday... great base to stay. No noise, no fuss.. rooms are all pretty small in NYC but these were fine, great shower, nice big TV loads of channels, the reception staff were really pleasant and helpful if you needed them! Really comfy bed after a day walking around the big apple was just what we needes! About 10 min walk from Times Square but there is loads to do and see on the way and it was perfect setting to our NYC break! 5 nights - really affordable would definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Girl's trip”
Reviews.Author: KNGD
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the holiday in with a girlfriend for 5 nights, the staff was very friendly and helpfull the hotel room was very big (we were on the 7th floor). A bit old but very comfy the biggest issue we had was the plumbing that was very noisy we could here it through the walls. we recived a paper every morning and the room was clean and organized when we got back in the evening. Great location as well vey close to the subway with the A train arriving direct from JFK. Close to central park and a few stops from Time sq. Just remember that you are paying for the holiday inn and not the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: Christina H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in February 2012 and thought it was awful. In the hallway on the seventh floor the wallpaper was falling off the wall and had been taped back on with masking tape. The wallpaper under the sink in our bathroom had peeled off and there was serious mold there. The room was only moderately clean. I spoke with the hotel staff who did offer us a new room, but we where there for only two days (Thank God!). Regarding the hallway, I told several staff but no one seemed to care to much. Food was edible, but not much more. I WOULD NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with hotel but no AC made my stay slightly uncomfortable.”
Reviews.Author: RubyWick
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one week. I chose it because of its location and because of the price. I doubt you could find a better priced hotel in the area. If you want to spend an extra 100 then you could probably stay at another hotel in Manhattan but this hotel is fairly priced and not overpriced like the other 3 star hotels in the area. I asked for a newly renovated room when I checked in. I also checked in at 6 in the morning so I am very grateful to the clerk who checked me in early with no hesitation. I was staying on 10 floor. The room seemed to have new bedding and curtains. The carpet did not look new but it was not dirty. The bathroom was small but very clean. There was some rust on the toilet but nothing to complain about. Remember that this is an old property in New York city. Because of all the bed big reviews I took the time to inspect the room before settling in. I ripped the bedding apart and moved furniture and looked behind picture frames. I came up with nothing. Not even a dead cockroach. It was very clean! When staying in a hotel in midtown I only have two requests. No bed bugs and the rooms needs to be clean. You can't expect much else for the price. 150 a night in New York will buy you a high class room in a Motel 8. That's how far 150 goes in the area. Know what you are buying before you complain. That being said I am disappointed that I wasn't told at check in that the AC was not working. I called down later that night and the desk clerk told me they didn't turn on the AC until April. Which is fine. If that's how they run their hotel I have no problem with that but I would have appreciated being told at check in. They quickly offered an electric fan for the room. I asked for two and they brought the fans quickly. The fans helped a lot and because it was not hot outside I didn't really need AC. This would be a big issue in the summer time. I would suggest calling to make sure the property has AC. My only other complaint is that the smoke from the room upstairs came down into our room from the bathroom vents. I'm not smoker so it did bother me. I was not in the room very often so I did not complain. I would stay at this property again. The rooms are not the best but they are the best that I could afford. There are plenty of cheap hotels in NYC if you are willing to commute. Overall, they have nice clean rooms. Great housekeeping staff. Friendly front desk. Great location. Great prices. Could use some updates but I felt like I got what I paid for. If you have an extra 100 a night to spend then spend it! There are nicer properties. Either way. It's NYC. Enjoy your time and save your money for the city!

Reviews.Title: “Nice area”
Reviews.Author: davisj1501
Reviews.Content: Not a Holiday Inn EXpress so no free Breakfast.. but i like this location and plenty of places to eat. the hotel is very big, very nice bar area to enjoy a drink, I had a nice room with a nice view from my window and clean bed, Bathroom is a very old style with the toilet right at the door when you go in, some tiles a little loose that i reported. which i reported and offered to move me to another room which i decline since i like the one i was in. a lot of residential buildings across the street and a Starbucks a block up so lots of pretty woman walking bye :) sorry got off track. very nice hotel on my list as a choice during my Layovers in New York City

Reviews.Title: “Several issues”
Reviews.Author: shonmiami
Reviews.Content: We arrived to check in to be told the system was down and we had to wait 15 minutes in the lobby and a couch that was stained more than something the Goodwill would sell. We finally went to our rom to find it had not been updated in what looked like it had not been updated since the 90's other than the bedding. It is in the 70's this week in NYC and the AC does not work in any of the rooms in the hotel. When we asked why they said, "we don't turn it on until April" We asked if we could switch to a part of the building that might be cooler they said that, "All the rooms are warm right now". I wondered if this was maybe normal in hotels this time of year so I called three hotels close by, the Westin, the Sheratin and a Comfort Inn and all three said their AC is on and working in their rooms. We booked through Hotwire and they said they would call the hotel and complain for us but that they would not let us out of our 6 day reservation to switch to another hotel. They then said the front desk of the hotel said they would bring us a fan. Finally, we found as we went to bed and woke up we can hear every bowel movement, brushing of teeth and conversation of the room next door. This hotel does not deserve a 3 star rating or meet Holiday Inn's new standards.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Suprise - Great Last Minute Rate”
Reviews.Author: Architype84
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay in midtown on very short notice. This place was great for the price. The location was a nice change from the usual Times Square type hotels that I usually stay at. Felt more like a place for a local to stay instead of a tourist. Outragious drink prices at the lobby bar, no views, but other than that I found nothing to complain about. Very clean, courteous staff (but a little overworked at times). I will definitely stay here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location, Clean, Good Price, Dated”
Reviews.Author: traveld9
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times on business. This hotel is being renovated in stages (carpeting, TV, etc). During my last stay (week of March 5, 2012), the carpeting had been recently replaced on my floor. This renovation made a big difference. This room appointments (desk, chairs, etc.) are dated. The TV in my last two rooms had picture tube, not flat screen. However, the rooms are clean. The wireless Internet worked. The staff is pleasant, professional, and responsive. The price is better than most hotels in this area, and near a large number of great restaurants on 9th Ave.

Reviews.Title: “New York City Fun”
Reviews.Author: vacalover22
Reviews.Content: Agree with vacationer102. Really good location. Older accommodations but clean. We would definitely stay again. Staff was very friendly and felt safe the whole time. Walked to most areas. Loved the location to Central Park and loved spending time exploring there.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is awful!”
Reviews.Author: tisiddk
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why this hotel gets such good reviews. My experience was extremely unpleasant. The front desk person that checked me in was rude and condescending, My room stunk of cigarette smoke, there was no air conditioning, the wireless network rarely worked, and the place was dirty. I stayed in B Tower which hasn't been renovated, (at least I don't think it has) and maybe A Tower would have been better. Some of the staff were friendly and helpful, (the man that stored baggage was wonderful) but most of the staff tended to look right through you. The bartender in the afternoon was surly and rude. I will NEVER stay here again even though the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: vacationer102
Reviews.Content: Room in Tower A. Convenient to subway, Whole Foods, Central Park; not a bad walk to broadway/ts. Bathroom recently renovated/very clean; TV great; bed-queen -- ok; no view; I'd stay here again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Pam B
Reviews.Content: Before leaving I read some reviews about the hotel and was worried...but when I arrived I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was clean the staff were helpful and the atmosphere was good. I stayed in a twin double room and for a NY hotel room it was very spacious. The room was clean and the bathroom was small but nice. Times Square is about 10-15 minutes walk and the nearest subway is about a 5 minute walk. Dont be put off by the bad reviews, at the end of the day this isnt a luxury hotel, its a Holiday Inn. I would defo stay here again. I've stayed on Times Square before and the rooms were tiny, so this hotel is in my top 5. TIPS: get a room above floor 10. If you want to get to this hotel from JFK airport for less than 8dollars do the following: from JFK get the air train to Howard Beach Station(cost 5dollars) then you need to get the A train to 59th street (cost 2.25 dollars) and then from there you can walk 2 blocks. The whole journey takes about 1.15 hours. SIMPLE!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Charlie03045
Reviews.Content: We drove there from NH on the way to the Bahamas. It's a nice hotel, about $160 a night. There is Valet parking availuable at the hotel for $27 a night. The hotel is right off the parkway, and is in a good area of the city. The rooms are clean, and the bed was comfortable. Fourteen floors, it had plenty of rooms. All in all; a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location and rate”
Reviews.Author: Kendirgi
Reviews.Content: The location is great, at a good price. We paid 155$/night for two double beds, parking include. The rooms are fine, they are not brand new but they're ok. Would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly brilliant”
Reviews.Author: SuperDaisy
Reviews.Content: The only thing stopping me giving the Holiday Inn Midtown 5/5 is the fact they recommended that we take a Go Airlink NYC Shuttle from JFK to Manhattan - I took their word for it without checking any more review sites for information on the Go Airlink NYC Shuttle's awful service. If staying here, or anywhere else in Manhattan, take a taxi, it's so worth the extra money. Anyway, the hotel was great. We booked it as part of a flight/hotel deal, based on it being pretty low price and having free Wifi. We thought we were going to have really budget accommodation and were pleasantly surprised. The room was pretty big, the TV was ok and all bathroom facilities were great. The hotel had all the different facilities you could need, and let us store our luggage for free for a few hours between checkout and when we had to leave Manhattan. The staff were friendly and the location was brilliant - we'd never been to NYC before and found ourselves in walking distance of most things, and very close to subway stations to get us to the rest. Highly recommended. Oh, but we were in the room next to the lift, which was a big noisy. We were so tired from sightseeing that it wasn't an issue but if you go for business then request somewhere further from the lift!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Big rooms, Great location”
Reviews.Author: agontuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 12 days in two different rooms (because we went outside NYC for 3 days in between), King and Queen, in both South and North tower. It was a pleasant experience. Rooms are big, beds are very comfy. Obviously the King room was better, big and spacious with a huge bed. It was in south tower, 8th floor but the internet speed was way low. But in the North tower on the 17th floor, speed was good. It was a queen room, smaller yet a very comfortable bed. I read in the reviews that the south tower was better, since renovated and less noisy. But our room in North tower was equally better and not noisy at all. perhaps because it was on the top floor. Now the drawbacks, there is no refrigerator in the room which could be a problem in summer if you have child and wants to use it for baby food and milk. For drinks there are vending machines and ice dispenser on every alternate floor, so cold drinks can be taken cared for. There is a deli (Roosevelt Gourmet Deli) around the corner (towards Hudson river) for great hot breakfast. Starbucks and Morton Williams (supermarket, also has a buffet meal for 6.99 per pound, we had dinner take outs there, great food) and pharmacy is within 5 minutes walking distance. Also Flame restaurant we tried for dinner, great one. Columbus Circle subway station (and Central Park) is the nearest, also with 7 minutes walk, another one 57th subway station, within 8-9 minutes. We had nice afternoon strolls with the baby in Central Park, Hudson river and at night took the broadway towards time square, had little breaks and coffee, snacks in between. It was a great great experience. All because of the amazing location of the hotel, very central yet away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: dr_jjj
Reviews.Content: Hotel was at a perfect location. We (senior citizens) walked to Carnegie Hall, Lincoln Center, Times Square and the theater. Breakfast at the Gotham Cafe in the hotel was good and large. Physical fitness center in the hotel had many different types of exercise equipment which we used. There were two large drawbacks. The room was chilly the entire time we were there. Even speaking to the hotel engineer did no good. However, we were supplied with two blankets to keep the chill off us at night. The other drawback was the bathtub with only one rim on the side. We had to hang onto the side bar to get in and out of the tub. Otherwise it was a nice hotel. I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably-priced find in Midtown West”
Reviews.Author: Kathy_R-NJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well-located. It is close enough to the theaters – most are a few blocks away to about 15 away. It is also far enough from all the hustle and bustle. You can actually walk around this neighborhood without being stuck in the middle of a mob of people. The area was very safe. It had a little more of a residential feel. The hotel was fine. There was a sign that my side of the hotel was going to be renovated soon. The bed was comfy although not as firm as I would have liked. The room was on the large side for a 3-star in NY. The bathroom was spacious and had a tub/shower combo. This was one of the cleanest hotels that I have ever stayed in. There wasn’t even dust in the corners! The one negative was the noise. Next to my room was the maids’ area and next to that were the elevators. There was some banging noise that was annoying when I was awake. However, I was able to sleep without being disturbed. The other guests were another story. There were a lot of noisy people staying here. I don’t know if this was random or if this is the normal clientele. One thing to be aware of, at least in my room, is that the bathroom floor is slippery. When I walked with socks I was sliding. I’m not sure why, maybe they polished the tile?? The room included an iron/ironing board & a hair dryer. There’s a cute bar in the lobby. If I got a great price again I would probably stay here although it would not be my first choice. The hotel was great but the noise would keep me from returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nervous after reading reviews, but had NO issues at all”
Reviews.Author: LBIAliss13
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews before coming here I was nervous about mice and bed bugs. We had booked the room and couldnt cancel so my expectations were real low, but i was pleasantly surprised! The rooms are spacious and very clean. Our bathroom was clean but in need of some cosmetic repairs. A bit stuffy and warm at first the AC was able to be turned on to cool the room off. Had drinks at the lobby bar and the bartender bought us a shot. Overall thenlocatn was great. Friendly stsff! And NO MICE OR BED BUGS

Reviews.Title: “Staff was wonderful and helpful...”
Reviews.Author: tattoo55
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and the windows open! A big plus in my book. When my teen age daughter came down with the flu (spoiling much of our NYC planned fun) the staff was wonderful, suggesting the best drug stores locally for different things, bringing up extra comforters (as her fever had her shivering) and one of the maids suggested a doctor who was nearby, which thankfully, we didnt' need. The staff turned what could have been a horrendous few days into a merely awful ones. I would heartily recommend! The one day she was well enough we walked everywhere! Close enough to the theater district to pick up tickets at TKTS, tons of great small storefront restaurants of every ethnicity on each block.But far enough away to not be bright and noisy late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: caribeocean
Reviews.Content: Location is not bad, 1.5 blocks from subway station, 5 - 10 mins by cab to Manhattan cruise port, easy to access to times square/grand central. I only stay total 6 hours at this hotel, so I didn't use any facilities. Friendly staffs. I paid less than 100USD, Only thing, I think there are bedbug. I have few bite my leg and arm, so I don't know if I want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: RoyalSilk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located in Midtown. We found it very comfortable although it gives the impression of being run by the Russian mafia! Almost all the staff seem to be Russian or eastern European which seems a little odd for a mainstream Holiday Inn in the heart of New York. The rooms were clean, although the bathrooms were becoming delapidated, with some paper peeling and rough edges around the tiling. There are also some very quirky signs posted around the hotel which look like they were done by an art student on a old Applemac. Quick tip - change these and it could make a difference to the appearance of refinement. Overall though, for a 3-star hotel, we felt it was fine and the fact the rooms were clean and confortable and the staff courteous meant it met our needs for the price and was good value for a Midtown hotel. If you're looking for an up to date hotel, don't choose this one. Otherwise, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: choijw
Reviews.Content: cheapest hotel i could find in manhattan for a business trip at last minute. excellent value for money (~100$/night). clean rooms with decent/acceptable (free) wifi. large rooms! recently remodeled room. convenient transportation links. markets nearby. cleaners respected "do not disturb" sign... excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a prime NYC location”
Reviews.Author: NanjingBob
Reviews.Content: Overall, Ii would have given the property a 3, rather than a 4. However, relative to the price paid, it is a real steal for midtown Manhattan. I read other reviews indicating that only one the south tower had been refurbished. However, that seems not to be the case. Our room was roomy and although not fancy, it was not run down. If you qualify for a discount rate, this can be a real bargain; at least in my case, it was the best deal I have found in Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Average Property”
Reviews.Author: rajeshtnair
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Midtown failed to live up. While it scores on the locaiton map, the quality of the rooms and food is just not upto the mark. The rooms are small, not really clean and have chipped walls. The bathrooms were also not very clean. I ordered room service couple of times..took a lot of for the food to be delivered and the quality of the food was not good. The staff was fairly courteous though the concierge manager kept vanishing from time to time. I recommend this hotel only for its location and room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms! Good Service! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: TripNL
Reviews.Content: We were so happy to see the large room sizes, it felt that were in a presidential suite! lol! The room was large and bright and clean (unlike many Times Square hotels where the rooms look out onto other buildings making the rooms dull). Like many NYC hotels, this one had free wifi and the staff were accommodating and accessible - even during the busy NYC Marathon (which we had no idea was happening when we booked our trip!). I love the less hectic pace of the area (I have no desire to be at or near Times Square any more) and the subway makes it so easy to get around Manhattan. This is the hotel that I will be staying at for my future sojourns to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Soctraveler
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a conference at John Jay College and stay here as it was the recommend conference hotel. The location is perfect within walking distance to Columbus Circle train station. My room was spacious and quiet. The room was a standard Holiday Inn style, no fancy pillows, bathroom counter tops, or flat screen T.V. Just a nice place to sleep and recoup from exploring the city or attending a conference. I will definitely consider staying again if traveling to the city. Tip: I had a good experience eating breakfast at Balilo's W 57th St (between 11th Ave & West St), cheap and quick breakfast to start the day and only two blocks away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: Someone in my party had bedbugs in their bed on the first night of our stay. Management did not seem surprised and only offered to move them to another room, not the Holiday Inn down the street. Free breakfast was nice, free wifi was an added bonus, location was good, but there are bedbugs, so be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & within walking distance to Times Square,Empire State etc”
Reviews.Author: ShaneandShirl
Reviews.Content: Accomodation in New York is quite expensive, so if it's just somewhere to lay your head for the night at a more realistic price, then this is the place to go. Admittedly, there are no safes or fridges in the rooms, but Starbucks is nearby. It is within walking distance to all the main attractions like Times Square, Empire State, Broadway etc and there are some fantastic restaurant choices around the corner in the infamous Hells Kitchen. The Tour Guide Co-ordinator in the lobby was not helpful at all and actually told us to go away and come back tomorrow as he was busy. So do your own homework before you go (just in case)so you have an idea of where you want to go and what you want to see. They had maps of the city & brochures for all the attractions, so we helped ourselves and made our own way around (which was really quite surprisingly easy). Overall- I would recommend this hotel as "tired but comfortable" with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Some basic expectations not met”
Reviews.Author: ruvb
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that the price and location of this particular Holiday Inn were fairly good. However, there were some basics that simply weren't met. Room cleanliness is probably the number 1 concern - while our room had no bedbugs and the sheets themselves were fairly clean, everything else in our recently refurbished room (including all walls and handles) needed a thorough scrubbing. While some things did not look too dirty, when extra towels were delivered and I accidentally hit the wall with one, it was covered in black dirt. Similarly, when we moved the dresser to plug in a phone charger, there was dirt and garbage behind it. The bathroom also was not as clean as it should have been upon arrival (but got a little better the next two days). The bathroom also had an awkward layout, and as the sink and counter are in a separate are there was no place to put anything needed for shower time (might not be an issue for a couple or family, but could be awkward for groups of friends). The service at the hotel was mixed. Our check-in and check-out were easy, and front staff and housekeeping were generally ready to help when needed. However, the concierge wanted to charge us an obscene amount of $ to make a local call to quickly ask a question of a venue we were attending later and would not even use his computer to look something up as we were leaving for the day. This was surprising as we have never encountered something like that in any of our travels. Not sure if I would stay again, but this is an acceptable choice for a short trip and 2 or less people per room (having 4 made it harder!).

Reviews.Title: “good location but found a mice in the room”
Reviews.Author: robertcyl
Reviews.Content: how can i say.... I already read previous comments so I had a very low expectation before check in. I bid this hotel at relatively reason price so the room is in reasonable size and offers magnificent NYC city view as we were put in at higher floor. However, I bump in a mice right after I settled kid to sleep. It was small mice coming out from TV stand and started running around after we saw each other eye to eye. I called up hotel and the staffs, four of them, came quickly and put us in another room with lower floor. With the surprises seeing a mice and didn't want to disturb kids sleep, we didn't complain too much. The staffs came in our room without an apology, seems this is common in this hotel or in NYC. But only offered helping moving the luggages. For this hotel, I have to give credit for its location. There is no refrigerator in the room so don't bring any snacks in the room, which might attract the unexpected guest(s).

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value for a pretty good room and great location”
Reviews.Author: hollholl
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed one night in this hotel for a business trip. The location was perfect (just one block away from where our meeting was held, and very close to Columbus Circle). My room had up-to-date furnishings so it had probably been renovated recently. It was quite spacious although the bathroom was small. The bed was comfortable. I had requested a quiet room when I made my reservation, and was happy to be put in a room at the end of the hall, far from the elevators. Even so, I could hear clearly anything going on in the hallway. Luckily none of my neighbors turned out to be noisy night-owls so I had no problem sleeping. The cafe where breakfast is served doesn't have a lot of ambience, but the service was fast and the food was fine. The room rate was amazingly low for being in such a great location in NYC, making this hotel a fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but in need of a refurb”
Reviews.Author: aroadhog
Reviews.Content: nicely located near Central Park, very helpful staff sadly this hotel is in need of a good refurbishment

Reviews.Title: “Getting Better”
Reviews.Author: ECCharleston
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located, only about two blocks (long ones) from most subway stations, and close to a wide variety of restaurants and delis. Staff was friendly and helpful -- a plumbing problem was fixed very quickly, and missing amenities were quickly replaced. Our one complaint was that you cannot get the PBS channel on the hotel TV, quite surprising for any major hotel not to have this access. After repeated questions to the duty manager, I was finally told that the hotel is upgrading to flat-screen TVs and to a 48 channel program which will include PBS -- so things are getting better! Our room was good-sized, and the internet connection worked fine -- we will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: Justine M
Reviews.Content: The hotel room feels like home, but there was a small bathroom. The shower was hard to manipulate, and there was no minibar. Though I'm not sure about other rooms, my experience was just fine. The pillows are hurt my neck, but the bed is very soft and bounce-able. The best shows for me shows in about the time of midnight. But the room is very clean. And the heater is good for chilly nights.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: lpool9
Reviews.Content: Nothing to write home about. Seemed clean enough. Definitely no frills. Staff weren't overly friendly when I requested a forgotten toiletry, nor were they helpful explaining how to connect to the wireless Internet. Probably wouldn't return; just stayed here on business.

Reviews.Title: “noisiest hotel i have ever stayed in !!!”
Reviews.Author: susan c
Reviews.Content: All the doors banged shut, the plumbing was very noisey , the walls were paper thin and the noise could be heard from many floors. Good location large rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for New York visit”
Reviews.Author: pitpat55
Reviews.Content: I do like Holiday Inn, having stayed in a few and never disappointed, and 57th St was no exception. In fact, it's appeal was enhanced by the fact that Central Park, 5th Avenue and Times Square are only a walk away - in fact the whole area around is filled with places to see! The rooms are Holiday Inn standard - clean, well presented and very comfortable beds. The staff at 57th St were very helpful with lots of smiles, which always makes such a difference to the whole experience. Will definitely stay there again on our next visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for the money..not elegant at all but comfortably meets need”
Reviews.Author: wanderer69_9
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for two nights while in city for taping of tv show at columbus circle..very convenient to that area as well as times square and theater which are generally ten blocks away...the staff was friendly and helpful at front desk, bell service,restaurant and housekeeping...this is an older hotel at which i stayed years ago...it is not the mandarin oriental so adjust your expectations but it is a good stay for the money...the room (733 south tower) was large and clean..the tv is the old type and needs updating badly..bathroom was clean with usual amenities..i am priority club member and was given continental brkfst each day and coupon for free drink in lounge as well as easy late check out...these benefits were a pleasant surprise...was told the hotel had been renovated two years ago but could use some sprucing up again...things look worn but not outrageously so....i wouild stay here again and feel safe in doing so...subway stop is block and half away towards 8th ave...

Reviews.Title: “fairly impressed”
Reviews.Author: maximart
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for four nights as an add-on to the end of our 11 day cruise and have to say we were very happy to be going there instead of going home. Having said that we suffered some of the same problems reported in the other reviews (curtains not fully closing, noisy coke machine in corridor, poor decor, old tv etc) but to be honest we did'nt care,we were in New York and excited! The location of the hotel is great, close to the theater district, central park and only 10 mins walk from the underground (to travel we got metrocards which we kept topping up but it's sometimes cheaper and easier to get 7 day unlimited passes) The only meal we had in the restaurant was breakfast but it was very good and actually cheaper than the diner across the road. Loved the bar and also the shop All in all a good budget hotel and would definately book again

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: TheChadi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on 57th and 9th, very close to Central Park and within walking distance from Time Square. The lobby itself is below average and you do happen to have a lot of staff available there. The rooms are extremely outdated and in desperate need of a complete makeover. The internet is free in this hotel but that is a very bad idea. There are times where the network gets so overloaded that nothing works at all. Either restrict free internet to priority club members and paying customers or upgrade your connections. Or at least, offer another connection that is fast and reliable for the priority club members and/or paying customers. Not being able to load google for an hour during the night every night before everyone goes to bed is not really an internet connection. Noise in the corridors and the proximity of an ice machine to the room was very bothersome. That is specially because the doors and walls are not noise proof. The lack of a fridge in the room was also not good. It would be nice to have a minibar or at least an empty fridge to stock items in it during the stay. The cupboard in the room is just a disaster. The TV is almost ancient, did not know that those TVs still exist. Some of the staff members are helpful and nice to deal with, the others are just simply rude. The feeling I got was that the place was run by a mafia rather than just employees. Had to reserve a car for my friend to catch his flight since we were advised by the concierge at the time that we need to do that to avoid traffic (on a Sunday!!!) and because we wouldn't find a cab at that time. After agreeing to the time, my friend and I waited in the lobby and made sure the staff there knew we were waiting for the reserved hotel car to pick him up. We were there 10 minutes prior to the supposed arrival time and nothing showed up 20 minutes after the agreed upon time. Went outside and got hold of the first cab within under 5 seconds, and my friend was in the airport in under 20 minutes for half the fare the hotel wanted to charge us for. There was a bit of an unprofessional reaction from the staff in the hotel to that claiming that the car is coming, nearby and that what we did was wrong. The way this was communicated was very bad, in a thuggish way and left me with a very bad impression. Again, the staff member who was upset most was throwing words in his native language not knowing that other people may understand other languages. I let this slide because if this is the mafia the hotel management has hired to run the show for them, I can only imagine what kind of a mafia sits on top. I will by filing an official complaint about this with IHG head office soon about this incident. Simply epic fail!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: TLeC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Midtown on 57th street for my birthday weekend. This hotel is in a location where you are close to everything! We went to a broadway show and ate at Frankie and Johnnies, which was only a 5 min cab ride. The next day we took the train down to the meatpacking industry and then over to the 9/11 memorial, and it was only 5-10 minutes. The hotel itself is a normal Holiday Inn. By no means is it top notch, but for a budget hotel it was fine. They redid the lobby and bar area recently which looks very nice. We would stay at this hotel again without a second thought : )

Reviews.Title: “Nice Lobby, but Rooms a Little Outdated”
Reviews.Author: mikekris
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location. It's close to Time's Square and even closer to Central Park. There are lot's of options for meals, snacks, and drinks closeby. The lobby at the hotel was very clean and modern. There's also a nice looking bar in the lobby that I didn't attend as I was there with my wife and kids. Also off the lobby was a bag storage room. We left our bags there on our day of check out for a couple hours before we left town. The staff was friendly. The room wasn't so modern compared to the lobby, but it was very spacious. The walls of the hallway and room were marked and the carpet was very old. A fresh and clean carpet can go a long way. Another pain in the butt was the bathtub/shower drain. Water had a hard time getting down. Overall, not a bad 3-star hotel. I've stayed in worse. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Average...some good, some not so much”
Reviews.Author: tdda
Reviews.Content: The good - location and price. Really can't be beat. Assuming you don't get sick and have to spend a ton of time in your room this place is fine. The not so - The room itself is pretty "meh." I think if I or my girlfriend were picky it could have been an issue. The tv didn't really work right, plus it was like 200 years old. The "queen size" bed was the smallest queen I've ever seen. I think in any city other than NYC it's called a twin. The real issue, though, was the curtains; you couldn't pull them all the way shut and our room would get unbelievably bright. I mean, this is an easy fix - get curtains that pull together. The white ones they have on the windows are fine for privacy at night but actually make the room brighter in the morning sun. If you are out late enjoying Manhattan get ready to wake up at the crack of dawn. That said, I would still recommend this place for what it is. Though not worthy of four stars, it is acceptable and the location is simply unbeatable at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to stay close to central park and times square”
Reviews.Author: sydneygirl2750
Reviews.Content: great place to stay for the money although interior of rooms dated, but i guess thats nyc. close to central park and times square, subway stations also close. only disappointment was no fridge only ice bucket also lifts extremely slow. but room was clean and location spot on. I would stay again. We did do the breakfast one morning but was not worth the money just walk down to starbucks !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accomodations, Priced Right”
Reviews.Author: Mambo305
Reviews.Content: Super friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms. Good location, but train station is a few blocks away. Many cafes, restaurants, pizza joints, pharmacy, and supermarket all within walking distance. The hotel offers free internet (which i'm using to write this review!), something most hotels in NYC offer for a fee. The only disappointment is that there was no fridge in the room.

Reviews.Title: “location is all about it”
Reviews.Author: yerbamate
Reviews.Content: stayed for 7 nights on the 6 floor in a room facing the 56th street.i asked for a room away from the elevator,just to avoid the noise,but i couldn't avoid the street noise .when i asked the receptionist diane,she said in a unfriendly way that has no rooms available:"maybe later".the other receptionist sent me to talk to the manager ,like this was a really great deal of business to talk about and nobody else could solve it. so,i've had 7 sleepless nights.the connecting door gave me the chance to hear at every 4 am ,that week,the moaning of my neighbours.all the time the flushing toillets could be heard as well from the other rooms. the room was old ,not very well appointed ,and in need for deep cleaning. the washing sink was outside the bathroom and the closet was opposite to it.not much space for storage and the closet's door would get stuck most of the time. no fridge in the room or minibar. if you need to do yourself the laundry you find a convenient laudromat on the 9th avenue between the 52nd and 51st street,wich is more convenient than sending the laundry with in the hotel. around are hundreds of restaurants which serve breakfast,brunch,lunch and dinner,plus a lot of take aways the only things i liked about this property were the location,the bartender ben and the housekeepers.i would like to go back to this place if i have the assurance that i get a room facing the court,not the streets which, i guess, would be quieter

Reviews.Title: “Expected a little more”
Reviews.Author: Tanya A
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 1/13/2012-1/15/2012 for a very good price, but that should have been my clue that this hotel wasn't up to even other Holiday Inn standards. We were awakened around 3am by the sound of a rodent either scratching or trying to chew thru the wall. Needless to say not much sleep was had that night. First thing in AM I noticed a small hole in wall by the radiator and paint chips, etc on floor, which weren't there before ( I would have noticed). So this is where "he" was! I went down and asked for our room to be changed which was done, but just knowing that a rodent was in one room and could possibly be in the new room, made for an uncomfortable stay. And they didn't even apologize for our inconvenience or seem sympathetic to our horror. LOL

Reviews.Title: “Expect Holiday Inn standards, not the Ritz - great value in an otherwise expensive location”
Reviews.Author: Laurajoshb
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms, comfortable beds, extremely affordable ($70 for king room) when all other options are super expensive, warm, well serviced - lovely housekeeping staff. Coffee pot in room, close to great food options both restaurant & take away, not as super touristy but close to tourist attractions & subway. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints...great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: TravelByTips
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited NYC for the weekend with plans to see a Broadway show, visit the 9/11 Memorial and see friends. This hotel worked out great for the price and location. The lobby was renovated less than a year ago and looked great. Although our room was a bit dated, it was clean and decent size. The walls were thin so if you are a light sleeper, that would be the only thing to consider. The staff was great and even comped us a couple drinks for my wife's birthday! Definitely recommend it for the casual tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Ok accommo but rooms will nor get cleaned.”
Reviews.Author: Weezer22
Reviews.Content: Yocasta was manager when we stayed. She refused to guarantee room cleaning after waiting 11am-8.30pm. If you pay inadvance this hotel is not interested in any room service. Do not pay in advance so that you do nor get nasty surprises.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: kalenacole
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days. The hotel wasn't that bad. It is older and for some reason there are holes in the hallway ceiling. It looks like they're doing some kind of pipe work?! No idea, but it's wierd. My room was clean, but I did notice peeling wallpaper and some stains on the walls. Wireless internet was free, but it took me 4 days to get it to work! The neighborhood seemed good and there are plenty of stores within walking distance, in fact, I walked to Times Square at 10 PM by myself one night and felt safe. What I didn't like is that this hotel doesn't offer in-room safes or refrigerators. I had to carry my computer with me everywhere and me and my co-workers ended up locking our laptops in our bosses room at The Hilton. The Holiday Inn also won't let you eat outside food in the lobby bar even if you buy a drink. Whatever! If you stay here, just don't expect state of the art anything. It's a simple hotel. I can't say you get what you pay for, because New York hotels are all over priced. Still, it's decent and the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Unauthorized hotel charges - watch closely...”
Reviews.Author: Bermiegal
Reviews.Content: In these days of digital money transfers, it's ever so important to check your balances and know your charges. A recent check out from the Holiday Inn Midtown on 57th Street NYC saw us leave with a clean bill - no incidentals apart from one local phone call billed at US$5.68. So why would the Holiday Inn take funds from my card three days after departure from the country for incidentals NEVER used? Why should the card be processed after check out and FULL payment for accommodation? Isn't that what check out is far? Talking to the Customer Relations Accounting personnel is costing me money in overseas calls. Ensure that any money on hold is released. This hotel didn't hold the US$602.58 for incidentals as stated, somebody actually manually sent the transfer through and pulled the money from my account using my card details. Getting the money credited back to the account is like pulling teeth. Somebody's playing a scam but it will be revealed.

Reviews.Title: “Needs upgrade”
Reviews.Author: capmity
Reviews.Content: Location is not bad if all you want is to be close to theater district. Concierge service is great and knowledgeable. Food service left a lot to be desired. Rooms need upgrade. Would stay again but think other hotels in area would have more to offer. Front desk gave me a bottle of water at check in that I left sitting on deck, did anyone offer another, no.

Reviews.Title: “usually a cheaper alternative than others near Columbus Circle”
Reviews.Author: lonereignger
Reviews.Content: This is a 50's style Holiday Inn. twin towers, pool on the roof, larger rooms than most NYC hotels. The front desk staff are helpful. It is a couple blocks west of Columbus Circle, but usually available for a lot less than you would pay for smaller rooms closer to the action. The subway is convenient heading downtown or uptown to the museums. Close to Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and an Average Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Angie S
Reviews.Content: It is a very old Holiday Inn. Takes like two minutes to flush the toilet. Staff at front desk not helpful and seemed annoyed with my platinum priority card status. Other guest next to me was offered free breakfast with her priority card. Ice machine on floor above did not work. We had a package delivered and went down to pick it up five minutes later and it took fifteen minutes to find the package. Seems to me that there is a lack of communication among staff. Great location and good price. Despite a few problems, it is not a bad hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit to this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geoff3009
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to this hotel in the last 6 years. During this time there has been no visible evidence of updating their rooms. This time we stayed in the North Tower which seems to be more dated then the south tower. Having said this the rooms were clean with older type TV's but there is a notice that they are replacing them. All the staff were very helpful and quick to assist with any issues. The restaurant in the Hotel is very good for breakfast and opens at 6:30am if you have an early flight out. The location is ideal for us as it is not in the middle of Times Square but only a 10-15 minute walk to get there. It is a block and a half away from Central Park. There is a bus stop outside and at least 3 subway stations within 5 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in New York City!”
Reviews.Author: mariejason
Reviews.Content: I like most people had no idea where the best place to stay is in NYC. Coming from overseas we had no idea. On a budget and very overwhelmed by so many hotels the Holiday Inn was everything we wanted - a comfy bed, great service, close to subway and great value! If you just need some where to lay your head after a big day sight seeing this place is the go!

Reviews.Title: “There we were thinking our experience would be different from all those poor reviews!”
Reviews.Author: wallyworld1954
Reviews.Content: After reading all the poor reviews on this property I assumed that much of the problem was due to renovation efforts. I was going to cancel, but instead called the hotel directly, explained that I am a Priority Club Platinum member and requested a renovated room which I was assured of. Upon arrival when I asked if there was an upgrade available for Platinum members I was told that all the rooms were the same. No problem - I then just asked for the best available room. the room he gave us was right at the elevator. It had at least a 1" gap all around the door and not even a threshold so the noise from the elevator bells and people congregating while waiting just came right through into our room. The room was ok, but was set up for only 2 people (my reservation was for 3). When I tried to call the desk to ask for more towels guess what - no working phone. We left to walk to Central Park which was just a few blocks (maybe 3) and stopped by the front desk to tell them about the towels and phone. This time I had the Priority Club representative. I told her about the two issues then also about our room placement and asked if that was the "best". She responded that it was in fact the "worst". (clearly the guy who checked us in was just being a jerk) She didn't offer to switch us so I just said "well, gee thanks a lot for giving us the worst room" and left. When we returned planning to shower and hit the beds it was close to midnight and we were all sopping wet as it had been pouring rain. They had not delivered the extra towels and the phone still didn't work so I had to go back down to the main lobby to again request towels. Also, our heater wouldn't turn off which we didn't know until we got back. We had turned it down before leaving and it was even hotter than before when we got returned. Since I wasn't making another trip to the lobby to report it we opened the window as much as possible and had a restless night. Overall a bad experience. Oh and the perk for being Platinum at this property is a free muffin or coffee in the restaurant for me only meaning the other two would have to pay. this is just a way to put paying customers in their restaurant. What a joke! We walked down the street to a great little cafe so I can't speak about the food at this property. It's really a shame that they don't do a better job with customer service here as the location is really quite nice. I think I will be moving the bulk of my stays to Starwood or Mariott poperties where they really do value their members with elite status, which after all is earned staying with them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good value”
Reviews.Author: MexKaz
Reviews.Content: Being in New york, Is a very reasonably prices hotel with pool. Good location, and good service. Look feels old, but you do not want to stay in the hotel too much time in NY. The only problem I had was with the Hotel transportation service. They have a Kiosk for you to buy tickets that is not managed by the hotel and it is totally confusing. I got a service, they charged me 4 times what I would pay outside, driver did not showed up, hotel rejected responsibility and were not helpful, and it took me 1 month to get my money back.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be brought into the 22 centuary”
Reviews.Author: kevmyster32
Reviews.Content: the facilities at the hotel were very dated, i.e. even though the internet was free it wasnt high speed like stated, and the tv in the room was very old school, in fact it wouldnt work in the uk. apart from that it was decent room although it'd have been nice to have the peace of mind of a safe in the room instead of having to lock everything in our suit cases.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here...MOLD!!”
Reviews.Author: 12Travelfamily12
Reviews.Content: I knew this wouldn't be a palace but it's a Holiday Inn so I knew there would be some standards. Wrong!!! The first room they gave us had a severe mold problem in the bathroom. It was everywhere! I told the girl at the front desk that both my children were allergic to mold and this would not work. She seemed surprised like she had never heard this before. I then showed her pics I took on my phone and after a mortified look, she gave me a key to go inspect another room. I knew what I would find but I agreed to go look. The second room was "better" but it was very obvious that someone had just painted over all of the mold and mildew. Plus the room came with a whole other list of problems. So I went back to the desk and asked to speak with a supervior. When she came out she was already aware of the problem but didn't bother speaking to me. No apologies or anything. She proceeded to speak about the issue right in front of me like I wasn't there even though the desk girl had went and got her out of the back to speak with me. She said to the desk girl, "give her something in the B tower. That should be fine". She said it like she knew the A tower has problems. I went to the room in the A tower and sure enough all the mold on the ceiling had been painted over sparkling new BUT there were mold spores growing on the tiles, the woodwork the vents, the baseboards! Never again! I will never trust this brand again. I cannot believe HI stands behind this hotel! It should be shut down ASAP!!

Reviews.Title: “Check out YOTEL before staying at Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Roger L
Reviews.Content: A hotel that passed it's prime over 20 years ago...they don't care if you stay there or not..no personal service. Location is good otherwise wasting your money. Needed to stay an extra night in NYC, they had rooms available but would not honor rate of $170...wanted to jump it to $345. Changed hotels and discovered YOTEL on 10th Street...loved it! The best thing the Holiday Inn could do was not welcome me and now me and anyone who listens has a new place to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Basically boring!”
Reviews.Author: adocca
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location and for that reason only I would return. Before arriving in New York everyone said how great the service would be and that the hotel would help us with any queries we had, apparently not here!! Staff in the foyer actively avoided eye contact with guests by huddling around each other in deep conversation. Whilst we waited in a twenty minute cue to speak to a member of concierge about booking our transport to the airport other members of staff stood ideally by with no intention of helping either their colleague or the guests. This appeared to be the norm. The woman in the shop was also rude, I walked in to have a look for some gifts and was told that food and drink were not allowed in the store; I have a cupcake in my hand which was in a sealed box, when I told her I had no intention of openning of eatinf it in the store she pointedly reminded me that there was a sign outside (obviously a jobs worth taking her job a little too far!). The lift smelt of cigarette smoke and was more than a littlle grubby! The only saving graces her was the cleanliness of the room and location.

Reviews.Title: “Found this to be a good find!”
Reviews.Author: Eckington
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was horrified by some of the comments about the hotel after I bought the room on Priceline. Because the statements were so vehement about the negative aspects of the hotel I only reserved one night of a necessary three. Well, once I got to the hotel...checking in early in the day because I took a red-eye from the west coast...I found everything including the staff to be pretty damn skippy! The room was perfectly fine - there are some blemishes here and there but nothing major - and I had plenty of room to work in and spread clothes around to fit the number of occasions where I had to appear. Things are clean and neat and work properly, so I'm happy. Yes there are families with kids, and lots of tourists from other lands, but this is New York! What do you expect? Reasonably quiet except in the morning when people and housekeeping staff all seem to come together to chat outside my door. Maid service is respectful of my schedule and needs - all in all...it was great! I have extended my stay to the full three nights. The front desk staff helped enormously and all was done in super fast time. ..and at a rate that makes me blush. Appreciate the bar, and the restaurant though I haven't tried the restaurant yet. Great martinis (huge) and not $15 a piece which is the going rate elsewhere in the neighborhood. The location is fab for the work and play I am here for. I am travelling solo and have no concerns with walking across 57th St. on my own fairly late into the evening. Will be back with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: penniless
Reviews.Content: There is not alot wrong with this hotel. Yes, it could do with a bit of a face lift, but overall, for the price you pay, the location and comfort/clenaliness of the rooms are adequate.If you prefer to spend most of your time sight seeing and want a safe, clean and convenient location at a price which means you can spend more on nice restuarants and trips within new york, etc., then this hotel fits the bill perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably good overall”
Reviews.Author: Sw02jco
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel to be very clean, although the maids ignored the Do Not Disturb's and tried to come in every morning! Found the desk staff and bell staff quite rude overall and was not impressed with them. I queued for a few minutes to get to the front and then be told bya snooty desk woman 'we are closed now'. Not great customer service. The nighttime staff were friendlier. Great location, dont get subways to Times Square, taxi's are actually cheaper if there are two or more of you! Room was reasonable - only one side had a bed-side table though, but chair was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Only good if you need car parking”
Reviews.Author: MsBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: Good points: This Holiday Inn is in midtown, on the West side, very convenient if you have a car and are driving in from Rt.9/Henry Hudson Parkway, along the Hudson River. The hotel offers a very reasonable deal for room+parking. If you are a Priority Club member, you may get two coupons that you can use for drinks or for a light breakfast in the pleasant dining room. Bad points: The hotel rooms and infrastructure (especially A/C and elevators) are really old and run-down. The linens and beds are okay, but otherwise the room is not great. This hotel has lots of bus tour and international visitors, so it gets very busy! The restaurant is so-so but the staff are friendly. There are not many restaurants very nearby, so be prepared to walk a few blocks--not great if you are a woman traveler alone at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: jasoncanada101
Reviews.Content: The double beds are to small to fit two people, so i recommend you get queen beds. What makes this hotel great is affordability and the location is what makes the difference. For example Columbus circle is about 2 blocks away, times square i believe was a 15 min walk away of i can recall. I was disappointed with the washrooms which were very small and comparable bad to other holiday inns Ive stayed in, sometimes u can hear noises of flushes from other rooms, there were no compartments to put toiletries, the washroom itself was a small box of a few meters apart. The service as well is poor, staffs dont smile or greet, there was a huge checkout line at 11:00am where only two staffs were working, took us at least 45 mins to leave and get our parked cars. Well other than the disappointment its as great place to stay for the price and the location, and most of the time your in new york to go out not always sleep in, this is a good hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Haydee G
Reviews.Content: Close to all places to go - Clean rooms, nice restaurant. Went with daughters, had great service all around. Will return

Reviews.Title: “christmas 2011”
Reviews.Author: Lynda M
Reviews.Content: we just got back from a 6 day stay at this hotel and have only good things 2 say,staff were lovely rooms were clean,yes a little wear and tare but at the prices your paying what do you want??would defiantly recommend it...close 2 all the hustle and bustle and only a 15 min stroll from times square,central park is on the door step...loved it !!

Reviews.Title: “never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jadecallisto
Reviews.Content: Due to a canceled flight staff were advised that we would be checking in late. On arrival we found that our booking had been "lost". We got given a voucher for a complimentary muffin and juice and told to come back. We went and redeemed our vouchers and got given the items in takeaway form. We had no choice other than to sit in the lobby and eat it. We were rudely told by a staff member that there was no eating in the lobby! Not really our choice since we didn't have a room nor were we offered a table in the restaurant to eat at! On going back to reception they still couldn't find our booking and promised they were looking into it. They insisted that we pay for the first nights accommodation even though our stay was already paid for. They insisted this would be immediately refunded once the booking had been sorted, we didn't really have a choice at this point so had to agree. We went up to our room and let me say this is the WORST Holiday Inn I have ever seen. The room stank of stale urine, the carpets, linen, walls were dirty. There was a hole in the roof. The bathroom was filthy. The toilet didn't flush, the phone didn't work. We asked for maintenance to come up and have a look but they couldn't fix any of the problems. So we went back to reception to request to be moved. The staff were rude and unfriendly and that goes for the duty manager as well. They gave us another room which was no better in my opinion, but as by this point we had already wasted half a day of our holiday we gave up and went out for the day. The following morning we woke to find an unopened block of chocolate had been nibbled at by some form of rodent. We went back down to reception again. We told them the problem and the reply was "so, i suppose you want another room" complete with an eye roll. We got moved again and offered free breakfast for 2 days and insisted on a fridge free of charge (they charge $10 per day for a fridge which is ridiculous!) Our 3rd room, whilst bigger was just as awful. Dirty carpets, walls and linen, and a hole in the roof. The bathroom was clean but small. They ask you to recycle your towels which we were more than happy to do but the only rail they provide to hang your towels on sits over the top of the bench. So not really enough room to hang a full sized bath towel! So that left us really no choice other than to receive new towels every day as there was no way to dry them. We never ordered room service but from what I could see the service wasn't great at all. We would see dirty dishes still sitting in the hall over 24 hours later! No wonder they have a rodent problem! Upon checking my friends credit card statement she found that she had been charged over $700 by Holiday Inn! We asked 3 different staff members what there "incidental" charges were. One person said $50, another said $300 and the duty manager in response to telling her about the charges rudely told us that there incidental charges are $100 per day for every day of your stay! Well if this is in fact the case staff should be telling patrons upon check in as this is a lot of money! The amounts charged on her credit card were neither of the amounts stated to us above but were different amounts every day .... it seemed to us as though they were recharging us for the room even though it was already paid for! We said the money needed to be refunded immediately as we still had another week of traveling. Her reply simply was that it could take weeks! We were not impressed by this point. My friend had to fill in more paperwork and provide them ID, bank details etc just so she could get her own money back which they should never have taken in the first place! The money eventually got refunded after a few days. Their hospitality promise is that if any part of your stay does not meet your expectations then that particular aspect would be refunded. We continually tried to get in contact with the manager via email and phone and we never ever received a response. We eventually, on return to Australia, had to go through the priority club website who then got in contact with them. This took several different tries before they eventually responded to us! Not exactly a very good way to run a business! Eventually they agreed to refund half of our stay but by the time you take out fees etc it did not even cover 2 nights accommodation! Considering the amount we paid to stay there we were not happy. I have advised our travel agent not to recommend this hotel to anyone. I have also warned family, friends and acquaintances traveling to new york not to stay here. We were disgusted at the treatment we received from staff and the state of the accommodation. There were signs everywhere stating they were renovating but I certainly never saw any sign of this. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. It just gives Holiday Inn a bad name which is unfair for all the other Holiday Inn hotels that have great accommodation and service. Also internet available but very slow and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BigTravellingFamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my teenage daughter basically because it had a pool and I'd heard a lot about how hot it is in NY. It was only the second hotel I'd stayed at in the US so still learning about what to expect. Room was actually nice , we loved the pillows with little labels on them to tell you if they were firm or soft. There was no fridge only an ice bucket and ice was available outside the room. No kettle which seems to be the usual for US but not good for us tea drinkers! The bathroom is OK needed to call to get the toilet fixed as soon as we got there but it was attended to promptly with no further problems. Room service good & well priced. Simple take away breakfast from the restaurant was good. Staff in the lobby didn't seem too enthusiastic at being asked questions. Would stay there again due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be looking to stay again...”
Reviews.Author: Chrisla2082
Reviews.Content: I'm not one to be pressed for the "high amenities" found in hotels, but I wouldn't qualify this hotel as much more than a place to sleep. While it does have a bar and a high-priced restaurant on its inners, the most important part - the rooms, leave much to be desired. I booked this hotel through a bid on Priceline so the price was excellent for the stay, however I'd have been willing to pay a "few dollars" more for better quality. The hotel is in an excellent location just a few blocks from Central Park South, but that's the best I can say. Though I must add, that unfortunately, this is one of a group of hotels that says..."you paid the Priceline price, therefore you will receive Priceline service. Upon arrival, I was checked in by Yudith who was totally unwelcoming. We didn't receive as much as a hello...just a demand for name and ID followed up with a request for a credit card for extra services. Upon signing necessary paperwork I noticed that I was assigned to a queen bed smoking room. (I did read prior reviews saying that the smoking room is a normal assignment for Priceline guests.) I asked for a non-smoking room because I have severe allergies and cannot stand the smell of smoke. Yudith promptly responded that she had no ability to change us to a non-smoking room. I explained my understanding of Priceline's bedding warning, but was hoping that they may be able to accomodate me. Yudith again replied that there was nothing she could do until later in my stay, but something decided to make her look again and she changed the rooms. I can understand non-availability as I've worked for hotels, but say that don't place the lie on Priceline. However, as this is the second time I've had this level of service connected to a Priceline room, I'm reconsidering patronizing them if this is what their partners will give. The hotel did have signs saying that they were completing rennovations, but I failed to see any evidence of that on the elevator with chipped paint on the door, a failure to operate upon pushing the floor button and severe shaking and creaking once it finally began to move. The hallway we were assigned to was lined with dirty, and bleach-faded carpeting. The room itself was small, had a "brown" stained comforter on the very uncomfortable bed, and of course, the vent in the bathroom filled the room with- you guessed it- a terrible stench of smoke. When we requested "sets" of towels we were simply brought towels...no washcloths, hand towels, etc. The bathroom was also small and had the exposed rusted pipes of a public bathroom. The replacement comforter was wrinkled and dingy. The curtains/shades in the room are also sheer and do not close completely which gave the people in the adjacent building an embarassing view of things that should remain private. Summarily, I would not wish to stay here again, and I don't reccomend you do either. Perhaps my experience would have been better if I'd been placed in a renovated room, but as a Priceline guest, i'm sure that outcome would have been an impossibility.

Reviews.Title: “+location, +room size, -elevators, -priceline”
Reviews.Author: travel2much2
Reviews.Content: You'd be hard pressed to get a better location (2 blocks to columbus circle subway) and a quieter stay on this residential street near the action, restaurants and bars. Priceline considers this 3 stars and I'd agree. However, when attempting to reserve 2 doubles (vs 1 king) non smoking i had to laugh when they offered me a smoking king room at check in. That's what I'll now call the Priceline screw, reinforced by Holiday Inn booking staff. For a $155 bid per nite I can't complain, but what the heck. After repeated complaints I was given a non smoking, but no double beds surfaced and I declined their suggestion of paying an add'l $25 per nite for a rollaway. Free wifi too weak except in lobbby. Free bag storage on check out day is a bonus. Clean room, but worn and dated and a bit musty. The windows could be cracked open for some fresh air, which was nice and did help. Permanent sign in hallway asking for patience while they upgrade, probably been posted for months. Overall, this place will not disappoint, just keep your expectations "average." p.s. In the morning, go push the elevator button before you brush your teeth and dress, maybe it will arrive by the time you come back.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating & bathroom awful”
Reviews.Author: Maggie K
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for my daughter & myself through our travel agent, who recommended it as they obviously get corporate rates. Travelled to NY on 30th November. First impressions were not too bad, helpful staff and lobby area looked very festive.I had specifically asked for a re-furbished room as I had read several reviews prior to travelling. On entering the room the first thing that hit us was the musty smell. On checking the bathroom I was shocked. There was mould all along the bath/shower and you hardly had room to swing the proverbial cat,and no storage space at all for toiletries etc.. Also,there is a small area just o/s the bathroom where the wardrobe is which looks like a little dressing area but there was no light so it was useless. I complained to the reception staff who confirmed that this was a re-furbished room'''''''''. I asked to be moved which they did and the 2nd room was slightly better in as much as it didnt smell,however the bathroom was just as bad,but slightly bigger with a vanity unit along the side.. The problem appears to be lack of ventilation in the bathroom,there is no fan so therefore it never really dries out after use and the mirror gets so steamed up you can't see.On a plus note, the hairdyer was good,the beds were clean & comfy & the coffee machine was a nice touch.Also there is free WiFi connection.The restaurant is adequate and does serve a good breakfast,however there are a few diners nearby so you are not stuck for choice. This hotel is really dated and looks tired & in serious need of a full refurb. The lift was hit & miss, if you were lucky and not busy it would take you to the ground floor fairly quickly, however we always seemed to go up before we could go down and stopped at every floor which is really frustrating.If you are looking for a cheap place to stay, fairly central and not too worried about the standard of your accomodation then this is fine, but I would'nt stay here again, there are other hotels that give much better value for money, and have much better bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Trip to NEW York”
Reviews.Author: Frank B
Reviews.Content: We were two couples for the Christmas Show at Radio City. We were greeted by a cordial desk clerk.Who registered us promptly. The rooms were large clean neat and orderly. The price was a little high but,we attributed this to the Season. The Hotel is a great location to Radio City and Central Park ,Rock Center and many more. We ate breakfast at the restaurant. I dare you to finish that breakfast ! A great breakfast at a fair price. The bar area was a great place to unwind at the end of the day. The only problem we had was getting down the elevator in the morning. The hotel was very full and the elevator cars are small. We had to wait for 6 cycles before we got on. I guess everybody was leaving at the same time. On our final day we checked out with 7 hours to burn. The concierge stored our bags for FREE . Then when we returned ,the bellman found us a great car to the airport. Large and comfortable and no more than a cab. A good experience for all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: HomeyBowmanville_ont
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in New York and we were a little leary of getting ripped off. We had 2 families with 2 large GM Sierra's heading through Manhatten. Our hotel was easy to find and we were able to park right at the hotel. A little tip, get everything you need out of your vehicle because you are probably not going to see it for a couple of days. The cost for parking for 48 hrs was $75.00 which I find to be affordable for our location. The hotel was a little dated but clean and service was second to none. We arrived a few hours early and the bellhop arranged to get us one room to store our bags so we could go to Central Park. This hotel was close to many famous sights and very close to Broadway. A bonus on a hot summer day was the pool on the roof. We met a lot of locals up there and also chatted with one of the owners. It was a quick trip but one my girls will never forget!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AshVirginia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Holiday Inn for two days this month. Our principal reason was its proximity to the Roosevelt Hospital, We liked the hotel although it needs to be upgraded, such as it still has the big CRT TVs. We were however surprised by the large room we got. It was very comfortable by New York standards and clean. The lobby is large and has a good size bar. We did not use it. The restaurant in the lobby is large. It is not fancy but adequate. It is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. It was always full. There are plenty of choices on 9th avenue within walking distance. The hotel has two buildings (towers). One has rooms with odd numbers and the other has all even numbers. We were in the rear tower that was very quiet. No street noise. If you are driving, pull your car in the adjoining garage. We made a mistake of pulling our car in front of the hotel on the street which can be crowded. On the whole our stay was comfortable and people were friendly. We did not feel cramped. We may stay there again because of the price and the proximity to subways and restaurants. We booked our room through RoomsPlus and did not get a discount such as AAA or AARP. We could have booked directly with the hotel to get the discount.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Cristi67
Reviews.Content: We only paid $87 for a single night's stay and with that in mind I think we got a very good value for a midtown NYC double room. We stay in the city several times a year and have stayed at a very wide range of locations. The location gives you pretty good access to most of midtown. The parking valet was easy to access and at $27 for 24 hours was reasonable. Front desk service was ok, not particularly friendly but not rude either. The hotel is a bit "tired" but overall was clean. Exiting the elevator there was a putrid, sweet orange smelling chemical, maybe carpet cleaning or extermination? Once we got past that the room was ok. Definitely a good sized room for NYC. Older television, paper cups nothing fancy. WIFI was free and was ok, a little slow.
