One problem we had was lack of outlets. We had only one outlet at the desk and had to unplug the clock to access another. I would agree that noise is a factor here but not horrible. We were able to have pretty good pizza delivered after midnight at a reasonable price. We did not try the restaurant during our stay. Breakfast is not included and the coffee in the room is pretty sparse. There aren't many good coffee shops close by either. We stored our luggage for the day after checkout and the bell hops were friendly. Though it seemed odd for NYC that the bell hops were no where to be seen when we dropped the keys with the valet and didn't offer to assist up to the room. I've gotten much better service at the Hampton Inn. Overall, not a bad stay but if you are going to pay $300 you can find much better.

Reviews.Title: “Probably not again.”
Reviews.Author: Ken L
Reviews.Content: When we travel we don't spend a fortune on hotels because we don't spend much time in the room. It's a place to shower and sleep. I guess we expected a little more for $300 per night but, it is NYC. We often choose Holiday Inn because you know you're getting a decent, clean, consistent product, usually. We were here 4 nights. It was noisy in the hotel . You can hear everything going on the rooms next to you. I know the building is old but the noise was surprising. The same room service food trays were on the floor in the hall three of the days. Pretty disgusting. This explained why we had mice in our room. They did move us to a different room and gave us $100. The mice have discriminating taste...they got into the Godiva chocolates. The hotel is in a great location; close to subway, restaurants, shopping, Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, decent sized rooms - it is just a shame that the restaurant was so bad!”
Reviews.Author: CaTyLondon
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel, really a pleasant surprise. The rooms were big, the beds comfy, and the place was spotless. The crib provided for my son was excellent too. Above all the location was terrific, we could walk most places and there was a subway just a block away . The only reason this review is not rated higher is quite simply because of the restaurant. We brought the kids down for an evening meal and we both shared some appetisers - the room was lit like an interrogation room, the service was sloppy, and the food - quite simply - was atrocious. We were bitten badly also when we ordered room service - we ordered simply and were told we would be waiting 30 mins - after one hour we called, and after we placed numerous calls (with the restaurant team leaving us on hold indefinitely on one occasion), I walked (hungry and irate) down to reception. It was only when I spoke to the hotel manager and she personally went to the restaurant that the food appeared (2 hours after the initial 30 minutes we were told - apparently they were "busy"). Credit to the manager, the food was not on the bill, but even when it arrived, it was horrible. When travelling with 2 small children, the ideal would be to have a hotel restaurant and room service that is satisfactory (and it's lucrative for the hotel too) but although I look forward to our next stay in this Holiday Inn, I will be eating breakfast, lunch and dinner elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Smoking rooms for Non-smokers”
Reviews.Author: DocExplore
Reviews.Content: I stayed here w my family for a weekend. I did reservations for 2 non-smoking rooms and when we arrived they had no non smoking rooms available. It was very late and we were exhausted so we had no choice but to take smoking rooms. The smell inside the rooms wasnt that bad, however the smell in the hallways and the noise were ridiculous. Both nights I had to call the front desk to complaint about other guest making very loud noises. They did take care of the guests right away. Probably my review reflects my overall experience which wasn't very good, but not necessarily the hotel itself. I'm sure if we would've gotten the right rooms my overall experience could've been better. Great location by the way!

Reviews.Title: “Location still wins”
Reviews.Author: JohnGMorpeth
Reviews.Content: Second visit of the year to this hotel and although I agree that it could do with refurbishment,didn't see any signs of it happenning despite notices saying it was. Our room, on 4th floor this time, was clean and well maintained and a good size. Would have preferred a room on a higher floor but otherwise no complaints except the in-room free internet connection didn't work and I doubt if it ever does as there are computers near reception,chargeable,which do. The location was great, as before,walking didn't seem as far this time, subway from Columbus Circle easy and safe during the day anyway. Breakfast in the hotel is ok but can be too much and not cheap. Moonrock cafe, 5 minutes down street was better. Kennedys and D.J. Reynolds good restaurants even closer. Hotels staff friendly and helpful. Expect if refburishment happens prices will go up, good value for price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel well situated and good price for New York”
Reviews.Author: Gill L
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a 4 night stay at this hotel, following my booking in July I called hotel to make sure we had twin beds and also my concerns surrounding the unwanted guests that people were talking about I was told that the hotel was currently under refurbishment, I therefore requested that we could have one of these rooms. I still worried up until the week before we were going and was going to change to a different hotel however, I had booked this hotel for the price and the location and decided to take a chance as all we were expecting was a clean room and bathroom. On arrival we were pleasantly suprised,as the lobby was clean and not much different to one of the Holiday Inns I had stayed in London. On check in when I asked if we had twin beds non smoking I was told there was nothing available, I explained that I had booked this hotel six months ago and had made all these requests then, we were told that there was a twin available but it was in a smoking room I asked if there would be one available the following day so we could change , I was then told I could have a room in the non smoking and they would bring in another bed, we decided to give it a chance, when we arrived on the sixth floor it did look shabby however I have seen much worse. On entering the room we couldn't believe our eyes it was huge, spotlessly clean and the furniture was clearly brand new , the bed was a king within 10 mins the camp bed was brought up which was huge and more comfortable than the King, it was obviously recently refurbished. On our way out we stopped in the lobby for the safe key and we tipped the guy who brought the bed and the receptionist who s name was Kelsang, and we would like to thank him very much as he was helpful and polite at all times. I am a very fussy person and always pull back the bed sheets to inspect and then the toilet and shower comes next they were spotless.too We must have stayed in a different hotel to the rest of the people who have written on this site as yes the hotel is a little worn in places but there are signs telling you the hotel is under refurbishment and will be replacing carpets in the corridors etc. All the staff were helpful , pleasant and approachable, we ate breakfast in the dining room twice, again the food was lovely, the service friendly and spotlessly clean. Once again thank you to the staff at the hotel especially Kelsang , who also gave us tokens for complementary breakfasts for two days. We had a fab time in New York and were not disappointed by the hotel at all ,we got good value for what we paid for and we will def return and recommend this hotel to anyone who wants cleanliness comfort and good location,

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn experience”
Reviews.Author: Shane035
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the Holiday Inn last month, i was a bit apprehensive about staying there after reading the reviews and my first experience with the staff upon arrival did not help, not one porter bothered to venture outside to assist with our luggage but they quickly had their hands out for a tip once we were inside the lobby (not happening), we were assigned our room and directed to the elevator and off we went. upon entering our room i was surprised to find it so clean (after reading all the bad reviews) I had a good look around and couldn’t find any of the problems I had been reading about, by this time it was almost midnight and we were quite hungry, we soon found out that the holiday inn doesn't do room service but were put on to a deli that will deliver pretty much 24/7, i wouldn't recommend using the deli they recommend, the hamburger was cold, soggy and very bland, the chips were huge chunks of potato which were very under cooked, i advise either going to bed hungry or venturing out, as we later discovered that there was an absolutely awesome pizza shop just up the road. Even though we were on the fourteenth floor, the road noise was quite annoying; 57th street seems to come to life from 11pm onwards, double glazing isn’t that expensive now days. Apart from the above, we really enjoyed our stay in New York; the Holiday Inn is a nice walking distance from Times Square, which we walked to daily and sometimes twice daily. If you are looking at doing tours or need information on a tour, DONT bother asking the dude at the tours counter in the motel as he is just rude and arrogant, the two times we tried to purchase a tour from him, he said that he was too busy (we were the only ones at the counter both times) my advice if you want a tour, speak to one of the many Graylines people positioned on just about every corner in NY, or go into the Graylines office, they have tours for everywhere and are pretty reasonable price wise. Like I said, we really enjoyed our time there, New York is an amazing city and it was the first time that we had been snowed on (freak snow storm 29 Oct 11) which was fun for about 10 minutes then it just bugged me being so cold and wet. But was still awesome to be a part of. I would happily stay at the Holiday Inn again mainly due to its location and if the staff there are the rudest people I meet whilst in NY then I can live with that.

Reviews.Title: “OK to stay”
Reviews.Author: ronandsam
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Holiday Inn midtown in early December 2011 for a one night stay. Hotel location is ok, the building was very busy yet check in was fast. As a platinum priority member I received a free breakfast and a bottle of water which was nice. The hotel feels old and so are the rooms. The washroom was tiny, so small in fact that one had trouble sitting on the toilet basin without touching the wall/toilet paper handle. These days for <$300 it is hard to find anything half decent in NY so overall i would say the hotel did its job. There are ~18 floors which are serviced by 2 elevators. Do not expect to rush anywhere are they are always full, tend to stop in every floor, and just too small/limited for the number of floors/room that are being serviced. I also used the gym which was very good. It was a full gym which lots of people and equipment which I like (nothing more uninspiring to come to a gym that has 2 machines and you are the only one there...). Breakfast was OK, wasn't terrible but far from "good". Overall, a decent hotel for a decent price in NY (I'm scheduled to stay at a Four Seasons in Bangkok for less than this price....). Not sure if I would stay there again....

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs, Mold, and Expensive "oh my"”
Reviews.Author: Jared J
Reviews.Content: We were here last weekend for a friend's wedding. Our first room had bed bugs...lovely, right? So we got a new room The second room had black mold on the walls and ceilings and had an abrasive mildew smell. The third room was fine, but the bathroom in every room is incredibly small and they gave us two towels for four people. Also, maybe just a personal note but the staff were convinced we had more people in our room than we did and threatened to call the cops on me for going back to my room after going outside for a minute. Overall, I expected better for $350 a night

Reviews.Title: “If you book through priceline you'll get a smoking room”
Reviews.Author: Alexandru81
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed that after booking through priceline I was told by Vlady at the check-in desk that my room is a smoking room and didn't offer to change it. It was really bad - the entire 2nd floor is smoking, so I ended up turning on the air conditioner in winter, in order to be able to breath inside my room. The location is OK, the price is not really reasonable whatsoever for the quality offered. Cleanliness - OKish.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and needs updated but overall no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Emma100
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from an amazing few days in NY. I had booked the Holiday Inn Midtown through an unnamed hotel bidding site so when I read the reviews on here about the HI I was very apprehensive. I have a huge phobia of rodents so some of these reviews came as a shock and made me panic. We also had our 2 year old daughter with us and I didn't want her sleeping on a bug infested bed. When we got to the hotel I asked for a room quite high up and the only room they could give us was 1532 which is the room I was most paranoid about after the review on here. I immediately asked if I could swap to another room and it didn't matter which floor so we were given room 530. I immediately inspected the entire room and mattresses and found absolutely no sign of bed bugs, rodents etc. The room was very tired and in need of an update but it was also very clean. Our three nights there were good, room and towels changed daily and when a plug started smoking when I used the hair dryer, maintenance was sent up immediately with a new dryer and they were prepared to change plug socket too if it continued to smoke. Staff were all very helpful, no complaints. We ordered soup for our toddler one night and it was very nice. All I can say is that hotel does need a refurb but there is a notice on wall saying they are doing this in next 6 months, there was no date on this so it could have been there a while. If you can get a cheap rate then this hotel is good but I wouldn't pay a lot for it due to the quality of decor. Fantastic location though!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: maddiemoochoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn for 4 nights in late November. I too was a little worried about this hotel after reading other reviews but was pleasantly surprised! Rooms were a great size (agree with previous review that bathroom was extremely small). Hotel was in a great location, walking distance to many tourist locations. Walked a lot of New York late at night and always felt very safe. Rooms also had free Wi Fi which was a big plus. My only complaint was that the room did not have a safe. There were safe deposit boxes available at Reception but found this inconvenient, and they were extremely small. We had a laptop and it did not fit, box held only passports and minimal paperwork.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: WannaGoSoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a 4 day weekend in December with another couple. The hotel was clean, service was good, they have a restaurant (didn't try it), a lobby bar (staff should be more friendly), a small gift shop and very helpful Concierge and Bell staff. The location was terrific. Within walking distance to Columbus Circle and Central Park, Strawberry Fields, Times Square. Great local sports bar on the next block, great deli at the corner and great bar down the street. It was everything we needed. The bathroom & the vanity are a little small. It was a good value for the price and the location during the busy Christmas season.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near as bad as some reviews suggest...”
Reviews.Author: digitaljess
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews posted here, I was very apprehensive about staying at this hotel. However, in my view, many of the reviews are completely over the top. Yes, it is a little tired and could do with an update, but it's clean, tidy, well positioned, serviced by polite and helpful staff and, for the price, a good option. If you want luxury, then I am afraid you need to pay for it - if you just want somewhere clean and tidy to sleep whilst you go out and enjoy what NYC has to offer, then this hotel is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Not what i expected from a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: gino888md
Reviews.Content: I and my family stayed here during our 4 day vacation last November. The hotel was ideally located near Central Park. and walking distance to most attractions at Broadway and Times Square. However what turned out next was totally unexpected. First they gave us a room at the smoking area but during our reservation we specifically stated we wanted a non smoking room. We were later informed that the hotel is fully booked and that there are no more available rooms left. We had no choice but to get it. Secondly upon entering the room we noticed that the airconditioning unit was not working. We repeatedly called the front desk and duty manager but we were surprised to hear their explanation: Sorry sir its the time of year when all airconditioning units are being serviced for the upcoming winter season. You could just open your windows if you want your room to be cooler. They even explained that this is occuring at all their holiday inn and holiday inn express hotels in new york. That realy made our stay uncomfortable. We called the holiday inn at west 29th street and asked them if they are undergoing the same procedure. The manager there denied this and told us that their airconditioning unit was working fine and no scheduled interruption was ever made. This contradicted to what the manager of our hotel had to say thus we just decided to trasfer to a different hotel the next day and asked them to refund us of our payments for the remaining intended duration of our stay. The duty manager was apologetic and told us that night that they would just not charge us for our stay for the night. However upon check out the following day they still billed us for the room and told us that no such endorsement was made to the front desk. We were so dissapointed that we just wanted to get out of the hotel and enjoy the remaining days of our vacation that we decided to let them charge us but not after informing the manager and some of the guests at the reception of our horrific experience. Fortunately before grabbing our ride the front desk officer approached as and told us that they would just reverse the charges and apologized for their mistakes. Our conclusion: Next time never choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Peterq22
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York and the Holiday Inn was a great location and walking distance to the subway and the main shopping areas. The staff are very good and helpful in all ways, the bedroom had coffe making facilities and was more than adequate. We certainly enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we're looking for in NYC”
Reviews.Author: lost_in_the_ozone
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel and have recommended it to friends who liked it as well. Be advised that we are not the type of people who are looking for a hotel "experience" when we travel - we take the subway to and from JFK to get to midtown and when we're in NYC we walk or take transit everywhere we go. This hotel is centrally located, close to Carnegie Hall, Lincoln Center and Central Park. What we want is a clean room at a reasonable price, which is exactly what we get here. By New York standards the rooms are quite generous in size and we've never had a problem with cleanliness or rude staff. Quite the contrary. Never had a drink in the bar or eaten in the restaurant in the 24 nights we've been under the roof. There are far too many interesting and inexpensive restaurants up and down 9th Avenue. For breakfast, we like the kiosk cafe at the corner of 9th Ave and 57th St., run by Leonardo. Bagel and coffee, sit back in the little corner park and watch NYC rush by.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD FOR AN OVERNIGHT STAY”
Reviews.Author: Gerigenie
Reviews.Content: Hotel clean, comfortable, with an easy walk to Central Park and Subway. Bar dim and not welcoming and breakfast room adequate in terms of menu and service but better places locally. I actually had a three night stay initially on arrival from London and then a further one night stay after returning from a short visit to Bermuda. Although the room had all facilities, I'm not sure I would choose to stay in this hotel on another occasion if returning to New York. I have always preferred staying ''downtown'' in any case but the hotel I have previously stayed at appeared on the Bed Bug Registry so I wasn't tempted to go back there! At least the Holiday Inn Midtown does not appear on the BBR and I must say was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Sparkles8198
Reviews.Content: This was my very first trip to NYC. I love to travel, but I had no desire to visit NYC. I certainly changed my opinion after staying at the Holiday Inn Midtown. This is a great location- walking distance to central park, 5th avenue, and Times Square. I found the service to be very helpful, the lobby and the rooms were both very clean. It sits about a few blocks away from the "madness" of NYC, so be prepared to walk (or pay for a taxi). If you forget anything, there is a TJ Maxx and a Walgreens close by.

Reviews.Title: “Served our purpose”
Reviews.Author: MoMofooko
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there on one other occassion. We were only in the room for 7 hours to sleep. Room was clean. Service was good. Price to park car was reasonable. Location was good and it was easy toi get on the highway. I am very fussy - but this was fine.

Reviews.Title: “It sufficed, but that was about it.”
Reviews.Author: orange-u-tall
Reviews.Content: Manhattan can be the most daunting place to find lodging. It is very expensive, and since the city is constantly busy, the rooms really get beat up pretty quickly. Having said that, I could stay in the Holiday Inn in Midtown again. I would not be ecstatic about it, but with a great staff and great location, I could live with it. Aside from a great staff and location, the rooms really need some upgrading, especially in the bathroom. The beds were sufficient at least. In its defense, there were postings indicating that such renovations were in the process.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Simple”
Reviews.Author: DMunr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights while in New York for a basketball game. We were so busy enjoying the city all we did was sleep at the hotel. Comfortable beds with a choice of pillow firmness. Close to Columbus Circle subway station. Perfect for someone who only wants a good night's rest.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For...”
Reviews.Author: JV14
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected by a colleague that I was travelling with, most likely due to the low corporate rate. I read up on the hotel here, on the tripadvisor site, and was apprehensive. I decided to keep an open mind about the property and see what happened. The first room that I was given in Tower A smelled like a cigar bar. The front desk staff insisted that it was a no smoking room, but was more than happy to provide me with an alternate room. My second room smelled much fresher, but was a bit stuffy. I would later find out that air conditioning in this hotel (or at least this room) was seasonal. This would make for a hot, humid night of sleep on an unseasonably warm November night. Because of the rodents described in other reviews, I moved some furniture around to make sure there were no flat-mates. The vacated spaces revealed a severe lack of thorough cleaning, as it looked like some of these spaces had not received attention in several YEARS. I also noticed the bathroom mold that many of the other reviewer mentioned. While the hotel may be receiving renovations, I would not recommend this hotel. The only exception to this would be if you are cash strapped, and understand what you are getting yourself into. I will be taking better advantage of the expense privileges on my next visit to NYC. Positives - Staff was friendly, but did not have an "above and beyond" attitude - Location, location, location (Near Columbus Circle) - Affordable price for mid-town Manhattan - Rooms are sizable - Free in-room wifi internet Negatives - Hotel lobby was dated, and room was not well kept - Room was only cleaned in visible areas - Tube TV (I am a TV snob and expect all hotels, especially in NYC to have flat screen TVs) - No AC due to season - Mold on wall and ceiling of bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Let's down the Holiday Inn value for dollar rep”
Reviews.Author: ajanthony
Reviews.Content: I have several business meetings here throughout the year. It's ok for the meetings but I am not going to stay here as a guest any longer. Staff does the bare minimum to provide decent customer services, I would not go as far to say they are all that friendly-just barely cordial. They are trying to "update" the rooms but really just putting on a band-aid. Evidence of delapidated ceilings with popcorn ceiling sprayed over top. Cracks in the walls, dirty corners in the bathroom, extremely worn and outdated furniture, uneven floors. I had a tray of food from a previous guest sitting outside my room for over 24 hours hours-gross! I called housekeeping at different times and the phone just rang. This also happened when trying to call the front desk a few times. No one ever answered the phone. A huge issue for me was that there was no air in the rooms! We all know there isn't much of a breeze with open windows in NYC with so many buildings. The room was hot and stuffy and I had to request a fan from housekeeping. The last issue that just erks me is that they post charges for keeping your lugguage. I travel 3-4 months out of the year staying at a variety of hotels throughout the U.S. and abroad. This is the only hotel I have ever seen try to charge for storing guests' luggage. Are you kidding me!? Also when I left I tried to ask a bellman for help getting a taxi to the airport. There were two huge tour buses in the street blocking any view of taxis. Two bellman just kept trying to push the hotel car which is of course a considerable amount more than a flat rate taxi. This is a hotel that attracts A LOT of tourists and non-residents. We are not all proficient in hailing a cab. It just a common courtesy for hotel to assist guests in getting where they need to go...by the transportation means that the GUEST wants. I ended up wheeling my luggage up the block where I could see the street and hail my own cab. I have stayed at other Holiday Inns and have had a good experience. They are usually known for reasonable prices with clean rooms with moderate quality ammenities. This midtown nyc location does not do the brand justice. I now try to book another hotel in the area for the same cost or a little more even if it means walking a bit in the mornings to my meetings. This place is just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: achancew
Reviews.Content: I like everyone else was a little wary of staying at this hotel. However, I was overall very satisfied with this hotel. Our room was very spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and very helpful. I do agree that this hotel is in need of a renovation but this didn't bother me since it is a budget hotel. The location was great and so convenient to central park and the subway. We especially liked 9th Ave with so many good restaurants to choose from. For the money, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, AMAZING NY skyline view!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelT81
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure that to expect after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, however we were pleasantly surprised. We stayed for five nights whist on holiday in New York. We have visited NY numerous times before, this hotel being the furthest out of Times Square we've stayed. It was about a 15 minute walk from the centre of Time Square, so still convenient. The subway was a five minute walk away (Columbus Circle/59th Street). The staff in reception were friendly and welcoming. The room we had was on the 16th floor. I'd emailed the hotel to ask for a room as high as possible. We were not disappointed. The view from our room was the best we've ever had and was much better than we'd hoped for. Beautiful! The room was a good size for New York. We had a queen sized bed, with a dressing table, chair and arm chair. The bathroom was good, with a bath and shower over. Basic toiletries were provided, with more available from reception on request. The room had air conditioning. The decor was a little tired, but the reception, lifts, corridors and rooms were clean, however there was dust behind the TV and desk etc. The bed was comfortable and a selection of pillows were available. The hotel offered free wifi, that was excellent (some reviews have mentioned problematic connections, but we did not experience any problems at all). The only thing we felt was missing from the room as a safe. We've always had one in our room before and use it for passports etc. there was a sign on the door (noticed on our last day!) stating that limited safe space was available in reception for an additional fee. This is a small point, but worth considering. Overall, our experience was good. The hotel was relatively central, the room as a good size and the rates were reasonable for the room. The views were amazing - an extra star just for that! *

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: Todd C
Reviews.Content: I travel weekly down to New York and have attempted to stay at this Holiday Inn location whenever rooms are available since it is closest to where I am working. While the hotel itself is fairly shabby and run down (stains and duct tape on the carpet, etc.), my previous stays have been acceptable. Signs indicate that the hotel is being renovated, but over the last two months I have yet to see any indication of these improvements. The front desk folks are friendly, but are fairly impotent and cannot even help me make a reservation if a corporate code is being used. The last stay, however, was not acceptable. While eating in my room a mouse ran across the floor and when talking to the front desk I had to ask what they were going to do to address the issue. After moving all my stuff to another room, I was greeted by a rotten apple core on the table and a flickering TV. In the morning when getting out of the shower I realized that there were no towels in the room (I guess I need to check that in the future). Needless to say, I will no longer be staying at this hotel. As others have said, the bathrooms are moldy and have one of the strangest layouts I have ever seen making them hard to get in and out of due to the location of the door. This location does not reflect well on the Holiday Inn brand and image, which is what has prompted me to write this feedback. Unfortunately, the decent rates do not make up for the poor quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but thats all.”
Reviews.Author: irishwaterspaniel
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel of my whole trip by far. Tatty worn out rooms. Never seen a bathroom like it. Remove the door. Unless you are a small short child no way does it work. The saving grace was the fact that it was easy to get to places from. Come on Holiday Inn SPEND SOME MONEY

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom was disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Howard4
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many Holiday Inns, including this one, before. Last time I stayed here it was just fine--met all my needs. This time, however, my wife and I got a room (717) that had a bathroom such I've never seen in a Holiday Inn--mold or mildew on the bathroom ceiling, Scotch tape attempting to keep together the wallpaper seems!!! Are you kidding me? As we were staying there only one night and the hotel was full, we dealt with it. Other issues with the room--close to elevator and ice machine--lots of noise. I would not discount this hotel, as it's a good location for many things. But, as a Holiday Inn (or hany hotel), they need to address these issues, which I noted to the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, rooms abit tired”
Reviews.Author: FionaJM
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay up near Cental Park and this place is great for that. Parking is also reasonable .. well for NYC parking that is. While the room is ok size wise it is in bad need of updating, carpets worn and overall just outdated. Bed was comfortable and we were facing the inside so didn't get alot of street noise. Bathroom was ok in size and shower pressure was ok. That being said .. this hotel would have to have the NOISIEST ice machines out .. we were down the end of the hall and could hear each time the ice machine filled and whenever someone got ice. Thankfully it wasn't at 3am !! Staff were ok service wise .. nothing outstanding abit 'aloof' at times but friendly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely average hotel”
Reviews.Author: sophie_1981_1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the NYC marathon. After reading so many poor reviews, I was very nervous about what we would find when we arrived, so I was happy to see a bright lobby and receive a clean room. The bed was comfy and our room was very quiet. TV remote didn't work very well and the bathroom was outdated (even my husband commented on how old it looked) and there was mold above the shower. The only interaction I had with the staff was the bartender, which was an average experience ($9 for a mediocre glass of white wine). The location was great and we were a 10 minute walk to the subway, Central Park, Times Square and Hell's Kitchen (go to 5 Napkin Burger for a fabulous meal!). All in all, the hotel was nothing more than average - there was nothing special about staying there, but I slept well each night and enjoyed the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Matt G
Reviews.Content: We had just stayed at the Surrey Hotel for over twice the price but found the Holiday Inn much better value. Had all you need......hairdryer, free wi-fi clean rooms, king bed. Had no fridge in room though so bring your own water bottles etc. Make sure you go to "The Flame" diner on the next block. It is open 24/7 and was brilliant. Also very good value....bagels, waffles, pancakes etc plus fresh fruit. Location was good as you can use subway or the hop on hop off buses. Pretty close also to Times Sq.

Reviews.Title: “Solid two to three star (2.5 if they had it)”
Reviews.Author: BoulderBayandSantaFe
Reviews.Content: Mold behind the peeling wall paper, crumbling plaster in the shower, a rusted sprinkler head, carpet 1/8 of an inch thick that appears to be from the 1980's, a tv from 1996. Checked the mattress and it appeared to be relatively new. A nice feature is the pillows are clearly labeled with cute "soft" and "firm" tags. There is sign at the elevator stating that the hotel is undergoing renovations during the next six months, but no start or end dates are published on sign, so it may have been there for six years. Got takeout in the bar, the bartender called out my room number to a colleague, essentially announcing it to the entire bar. When I pointed it out, the response was "oh did I?" A sign taped to the counter stated there would be no heat from 630 am to 430 pm. When I asked the staff person if there were extra blankets in the rooms, she chuckled. Given that the temperature was 40 overnight, I was not. The independently owned gym is in the basement and smells like teenage sneakers. The political views of the owner were well demonstrated throughout. Lots of weights, three treadmills, two ellipticals.

Reviews.Title: “For $265/night, a small fridge would have been nice...”
Reviews.Author: Helen O
Reviews.Content: Great location but a very worn out tired old hotel - the per night charge is for the Manhattan midtown location no doubt. But seriously, I never even dreamed I would not have a small hotel fridge in my room for that price - I had to keep milk in an icebucket in the bath and keep filling it up (I was there for 4 days and bought my own food for brekkie). Still the rooms were clean which was great - bed nice and comfy, tv enjoyable - housekeeping staff polite and friendly. Staff downstairs varied in friendliness - some were proficient but not exactly warm...This Holiday Inn is in desperate need of a refurbishment but there were hundreds of guests when I was there 2 weeks ago so maybe they're just going to keep on keeping on with their current huge turnover. Still Holiday Inn, invest in some hotel fridges please - this is 2011 after all...! :-)

Reviews.Title: “If you have to stay in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: efwise
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Midtown has many things going for it. It's affordable, clean, close to transit. More importantly the staff treat this property like it's their home. Every employee I spoke to made me feel welcome in the place, like it was their place, not just a job. It seems like the staff is valued and that translated to an excellent stay for me.

Reviews.Title: “Tired & dated”
Reviews.Author: Happyshopper1955
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my son 18th-21st oct after travelling from Boston on Amtrack. View from the train as we approached "The Big Apple" at night was amazing!! Good points-Good location. Within easy walking distance of Central Park & Time Square. (Dont know whats goin on in NY at the moment- its like scaffold city! Scaffolding everywhere & not a builder in sight!) Conceirge very helpful offering advice on best tourist bus to take, where to have breakfast, getting to airport. Rooms are not bad size & have basic amenities ie. hairdryer, iron, coffee machine. Quite easy to pick a cab up outside hotel. Bad points- Hotel in serious need of a face lift! Decor particularly in rooms is very old & tired- like stepping back in time to the eighties! We found the beds to be a bit on the hard side- however in their defence we had just travelled from the La Quinta in Andover which had the most comfortable beds I had ever slept in! Warning- beware of getting ripped off! On arriving in NY at Penn Station we were approached by a "taxi driver" who offered to take us to our hotel for $30! When I said I thought that was too much he asked me how much i was willing to pay & miraculously dropped his price to $20. Not being that green, my son & I joined the official taxi rank & got to our hotel for the princely sum of $10 & that was with a generous tip! I payed for our stay at The Holiday Inn with Airmiles & cash- had I had to pay the full price with cash only I wouldn't have been too happy as I think there were better hotels for the same price. Overall I wouldn't say this is the worst hotel iv'e stayed in but given the number of hotels in NY I'd probably look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: twtudor
Reviews.Content: New York is expensive but we got a senior rate AARP on this hotel and we were very happy with it. The room was good size and the staff did an excellent job of keeping it clean. The lounge was very nice and the staff was very friendly. Only went to the restaurant once. It was pricey and over lit for a trattoria so only had soup and left. There is a pub across the street and down a block that was very good. Get use to walking, its way better than taking a cab and subway is confusing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Toria P
Reviews.Content: Great location. Easy to get to anywhere. Rooms good size. Beds comfortable. Pity breakfast was ordinary so we walked down 8th Ave to great diner where we could get good fresh fruit, croissants and a decent cup of tea

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: travelnuts58
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire, where you have to commit before you know which hotel you're getting, I may not have booked it after reading some of the reviews, but the hotel was fine not five star but it was very convenient for Time Square and Central Park. After 2 days in New York we took a cruise, the port was only a couple of blocks away realy easy, if you don't like driving in the big city. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Maxinelong
Reviews.Content: Good location good room size but bathrooms are awful this hotel need a major refurb

Reviews.Title: “"Budget" property without cooties”
Reviews.Author: Tubman74
Reviews.Content: In town on a budget & priceline bid put me here, coincidentally where my meeting was being held. The room was better than expected as far as comfort & cleanliness, but the bathroom was quite archaic. The meeting room had those thin sliding cardboard walls, & of course our neighbor was some sort of Japanese Kung-Fu festival. I didn't try the restaurant, but some colleagues were displeased w/ lunch. I did feel safe while in the hotel. The best part of the property was the quick 10' walk to Columbus Circle.

Reviews.Title: “hotel gone down hill”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey S
Reviews.Content: I stay here 3 years ago, hotel was lovely then, i returned this month, we woke up to a mice in the room, we got moved to a smaller smeller room, looking back onmy pics in the room there i a mice in the pics, id never stay here again very disappointed...

Reviews.Title: “good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: pathfinderfan
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights in oct,2011. Hotel is 15min walk from times square, 2blocks from subway. We got this hotel because even after paying for taxi couple times a day, it was still cheaper then staying right at times square. Rooms were big. Free wifi is great. There is $21 parking 5 blocks from hotel(central parking on 60thst$10ave). My only complain with this hotel is there pool hours, 10-6pm. Other wise, its great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & price!”
Reviews.Author: Jsc927
Reviews.Content: As other reviews stated, the hotel is ready to be updated....but don't let that deter you from staying here! The bedding is super clean and updated and the room and public areas are kept very clean. We had no issues with the elevators, wait time was short. Location is great to walk to Times Square and Central Park. Subway is 2 blocks away, short walk. The rooms are large, just like you would expect a normal hotel room to be. Most in NYC are tiny! Price is great too, hard to find a room under $275/nt in NYC with a location this good. I am a travel agent and would have no problem recommending this hotel to my clients. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: PAUL-1512
Reviews.Content: Having checked in went to room only to find it was occupied, fortunately no one in! Went back to reception and they apologised and we were given another room. Rooms small but then city center location so only to be expected. Room is tired and in need of updating (like corridors) but it was clean and comfortable. Great roof top pool. Location is okay with Central Park nearby and a short walk to other attractions and places. When enquiring about a taxi back to the airport (from concierge) we were advised it would be a 140 dollars which was twice as much as the ride in and were told this was the best we would get given 4 people and luggage however we flagged down a yellow cab and paid 80 dollars. Overall a very average experience but would stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms but need renovation, bad service”
Reviews.Author: strechParis
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its midtown location. However, the area around it is rather dull, no restaurants or walking destinations nearby.They refused to serve buffet breakfast and we had to look for another place to have it, which was difficult unless you want a cup of bad coffee standing by the counter in a convenience store... The hotel itself could be nice, the rooms are big, but they need serious renovation. Drinks are only in the very noisy bar, so we sat in the lobby, with our son sitting on the edge of a table to be opposite us - and somebody came to ask him not to sit there. I complained about the breakfast problem but got no apology... Very negative and disappointing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ken T
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great roof-top pool/patio---but it's seasonal so check the dates. It's also really close to central park, and has a nice bar and restaurant if you're too tired to venture out. It's in a good neighborhood, and is currently being updated. Rooms are nice, price is moderate----we'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't leave fast enough!”
Reviews.Author: Penelope G
Reviews.Content: 1) Made us pay for entire stay UP FRONT before we even stayed there. this never happens! 2) front desk was extremely unhelpful from the moment we tried to check in. 3) there was a RAT IN OUR ROOM!! front desk staff offered ZERO APOLOGIES 4) Concierge was unhelpful and had an attitude. would NOT help us out-of-towners get a cab. 5) front desk staff were EXTREMELY unfriendly and disrespectful 6) air conditioning unit was broken on the last evening 7) elevators were very small and shook ALOT as it moved there's not enough room on here to write all the negatives of our stay. for a business whose sole purpose was to provide hospitality and great customer service, we never felt less welcomed. we travel often but will NEVER return to this hotel again. we had better dealings with the NY cab drivers than the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location near Central Park”
Reviews.Author: VJMHelsinki_Finland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and the location was good, the rooms small and the service ok. Nothing special, nothing to complain about but nothing to praise either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: NanC6228
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Ample space in the room, but bathroom was a bit small. But everything clean and they keep things up well. No trouble sleeping on the bed/pillows at all. The midtown location was within easy walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, Central Park, 5th Avenue shops. Also very close to Lincoln Center attractions. We have definitely put this one on our "favorites" list.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: kilgarriff
Reviews.Content: Noisy , run down and unhelpful staff. The room was at the front of the hotel and the noise from traffic was constant. TV and facilities outdated and staff not very interested. Breakfast poor and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Lis T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not the swankiest, newest hotel but it is definitely more than comfortable enough to stay in. The room is really big and the beds are very comfortable. The place may look a bit tired and dated but it was very clean during my stay here and that is definitely my priority. The concierge desk was very helpful and was ever ready to give tips and answer any questions we have. Location was great, short walking distance to the subways and if you are up for it, we even walked all the way down to take in the sights n sounds of NYC. I admit I was a bit troubled by the reviews I read (I booked this hotel on one of those mystery hotel bookings website) but I was definitely relieved when we got there. I did not enjoy any of the facilities as I was out of the room from morning to night, but rest assured the beds are superbly comfortable especially after a long day out

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy!!”
Reviews.Author: Tammysweetie
Reviews.Content: The room is nice n clean, and the location is super. The staff is really, really helpful!! I am very impressed. Will definitely stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's affordable!”
Reviews.Author: TwoofOz
Reviews.Content: It's no secret that accommodation in New York does not come cheap. That said, this hotel is quite reasonably priced. It's a case of getting what you pay for and what we got was very satisfactory. It could do with a bit of t.l.c. but the room was clean, the staff helpful, and its location was within comfortable walking distance of Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Very Tired property”
Reviews.Author: skier003
Reviews.Content: To be fair, there are signs posted all over saying that they are rehabbing this property. But, my room was noisy, the door does not close off from the hall way. I finally got a blanket and stuffed it under the door and that helped. I needed a 2d room and got a better price than anywhere on line. That was a bit strange. However, again to be fair, the rooms are large for New York. The staff helpful and very nice. The fact that the toilet did not flush in one of the rooms, was remedied quite quickly. Thank goodness, because with all the college kids I had with me for this trip, a non flushing bathroom was not an option. The location is great and once it is brought up to snuff, with paint, new TVs and an improved lobby, it should be great.

Reviews.Title: “Right Price”
Reviews.Author: vanessaviolet
Reviews.Content: Quite a large room by New York standards. It was a good price for this location. It was a basic hotel room but most importantly, it was clean. We found the street noise a little loud on the weekend but other then that, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Deal for NYC”
Reviews.Author: DoctahJohn
Reviews.Content: I live in the UWS of Manhattan. My relatives from the Philippines were to stay in my 1-BR condo. There was no way we could all fit comfortably so I decided to stay here with my partner for a couple days. It was very affordable and in a great location. The actual rooms were nice. Nothing elaborate but more than adequate for comfort. Times Square, Broadway, restaurants and mass transit are all easily accessible from this location. I'd stay here again if I had to.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter272
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and comfortable the location was great for Central Park, 15 mins steady walk to Times Square and Broadway Shows. Breakfast in hotel was good if there are more than 4 of you ask about using hotel stretch limo instead of taxi's as it is not much more expensive and a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for NYC”
Reviews.Author: TheZimm
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at this location in the last 2 years. Overall it's OK but it definitely needs a makeover. The room (534) was OK; nice beds but it looks a bit dated. They definitely need sound proofing for the windows as street noise was very noticeable. Elevators were slow and often full as a result. The breakfast was OK. If it's not included, I'd recommend the Flame cafe at 9th Ave and w 58th St. instead On the plus side: They were much less cost per room that other hotels. They have a good setup for parking - only $27 a day It's only a 15min walk to Times Square. Staff were very nice. It has an outdoor pool but only open from 10am to 6 pm

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Unw0rldlyTraveller
Reviews.Content: Shared my room with a friend and the rooms with 2 beds were nice and big. The lobby was a huge and peaceful oasis from the city. Mostly all seemed clean and sleeping was very comfortable. My only concern with cleanliness was a food tray (with food remnants) that was in the hallway from at least morning Saturday till it finally disappeared later Sunday morning. I also felt hustled into a hotel(?) car to airport when I asked concierge to flag me a car - only $10 more but not what I asked for. Might've liked better access to subways (a couple blocks away) but it was also only a couple blocks from Central Park so really very well located. Even though the computer centre was close Sunday a.m. when I wanted to print my boarding pass they had one at the front desk that was available for such uses. Overall this was a great hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “woeful dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: gaoler1234
Reviews.Content: We are currently at this hotel, it is located close to the major downtown area, 5th Avenue Times square etc but that is where the positives end. When we checked into our room we were greeted by the strong smell of damp and mold, checking the bathroom I found an area above the toilet about 3 feet by 2 feet where the wallpaper was hanging off and the plaster under had blown, the wall was black with mold. We changed rooms and went out. When we returned about midnight we found that the entire block had no water supply to the rooms, no flushing toilet, hand washing shower or bath, nothing. Speaking to the staff on the desk I was told that the water had been switched off at 11pm until 6am, there was no mention of this when we checked in nor anything in the room. I could not move and was offered a token free breakfast. When I went back down to the desk others were being offered rooms in another block with water, not happy at all! There is a statement in the room saying if we are not happy the company will refund the part of the time that was affected, stand by for one hell of a claim! I would not stay here again if it was the last hotel in the city, I would sooner sleep in the park! I am booked for another night but will be looking for a new hotel later this morning. Total garbage......

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: natchee
Reviews.Content: Much like the other reviews on this site, what you read on here you can expect at the hotel. I stayed for one night in September 2011 and was satisfied with the stay. It's a bit dated, but the rooms are large, the lobby was huge and staff were friendly. A nice feature of the hotel was the location, which was pretty convenient. When/if the hotel ever gets a makeover, it would be even better!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: RNPapp
Reviews.Content: I guess the reason people stay in chain hotels is that you know what you'll get with minor variations. This hotel is on the tired side of the Holiday Inn brand. Kind of what you would expect of this brand in general. It's all here, just very well used. The upside is the location, which is unbeatable in this price range and the great service.

Reviews.Title: “Large room for NYC, needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: KPhD1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel and room smelt old and of stale cigarettes, despite it being a non-smoking room. The room was a good size for the city, but is long overdue for a revamp and for some reason the curtains are only there for show and do not close fully! I'm sure the apartments across from the hotel get great views of the guests! On the day of departure it was very apparent that if you wanted help you had to pay for it. I guess they no longer had to be friendly once your stay was over. We overheard one of the baggage store room staff tell a guest if "you want anything you must pay me". When I asked the man at the bell hop/ concierge desk if we could book a taxi he laughed and sharply said no, in a very arrogant and rude tone. When we were picking up our bags the staff there asked if we needed to book one, why could the man at the desk not just have taken the time to point us in that direction and be the helpful polite service he should be.

Reviews.Title: “1 night stay Sept 2011”
Reviews.Author: Fran239
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night pre-cruise. Hotel could do with refurbishment and also a better bar area, ideally with a meal service as the hotel restaurant didn't offer anything to tempt us so we went out to a local restaurant. Always a long waiting time for lifts and our room overlooked street so traffic noise quite bad. It was conveniently situated and within walking distance to Broadway and Times Square. OK for an overnight.

Reviews.Title: “It did the job....”
Reviews.Author: petizamia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty much what we expected based on the rates and reviews. The rooms are large but old. The bar/lounge was big and friendly. Staff was nice. Room service trays from neighbors sat in the hallway for three days despite mentioning to several hotel staff. Drippy faucet. Nice views. We chose this hotel solely because of location: we needed to drop our kid off to college with all her 'stuff." And it did the job. I have to hand it to the manager who did an absolutely superb job keeping all the guests informed about hurricane Irene. Every update on the loudspeaker was informative and entertaining at the same time. KUDOS! They took all precautions (checking elevators, generators, fire alarms, emergency supplies, etc. ) and we all felt safe, especially in a hotel full of friendly firefighters from all over the world in town for an athletic event (!). But when we had to stay longer than expected because our flights were cancelled, they would not honor the same rates. In fact, the new rates were 50% higher!! So we chose to move to a 4-star hotel at that same rate. Don't know if I'd go back..... maybe if they have a really good deal..... maybe.

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay Sept 2011”
Reviews.Author: PaulT090763
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel just for 2 nights before we set off on a cruise. The hotel itself was the usual good standard of Holiday inns and it was conveniently located for a 5 minute walk to Central Park and a 20 minute walk to Times square. Room was comfatable and clean The only down side was the price for drinks We ordered a glass of white wine, vodka and lemonade, with a bottle of water from the bar and they charged me $24 which I thought was a bit steep All in all good stay

Reviews.Title: “Nothing big to complain about...”
Reviews.Author: crewboi
Reviews.Content: New York City is my favorite place in the world and I travel there quite frequently. I've stayed at several different hotels on Manhattan island. This one is not one of the best, but it isn't terrible either. The room was clean and in decent repair. The staff that I spoke with were very polite and helpful. I think the price was a bit on the high side for what I've paid at much nicer hotels, but there were a few big events going on while I was there. It's also worth noting that the room was much larger than what I typically see while staying in the Big Apple. Also, unlike many of the more upscale hotels, the internet service at this hotel is free. The only real complaint I have is with the elevators. There were a few times when we had to wait a long time for the elevator to come and often times so many people were lined up that we really had to cram in. When we stopped on another floor to pick up another person I saw the other elevator across the hall was just sitting there because an employee had stuck a cart partway inside to make the elevator stay on that floor while he was doing something else. No wonder we were waiting so long for the elevators if they are doing that! I really can't say this hotel is terrible. I may or may not stay there again, but it certainly won't be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay here”
Reviews.Author: Trent C
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 5 nights and thought it was a decent clean hotel, they seem to be slowly renovating the place with new carpets etc, just a few things to gripe about though, my friend has a sleep disorder and was waiting for a much needed mask to arrive in the post, 2 days after it had arrived and after much hassles they finally located it sitting round on ground at reception, pretty sloppy i feel, also no vending machines work, one was out of stock, the other took my money without drink! had to go and get postmix from bar, no apology either, these things are fundamental things, get it right! Very close to Hells Kitchen, bars food shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: GailManning
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in Feb with my partner got 2 double beds in our room so nice extra. Hotel staff friendly and helpful breakfast nice although we only ate there once. The location is perfect it is in the middle of times square & central park 10 mins walk from both! Would definitely stay here again next time we go to new York!

Reviews.Title: “not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Juanitobosque
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week in this hotel in September. The only thing good that I have to say about this hotel is that it is reasonably well located. Negative points: For the first 4 days of our stay one of the three very small elevators was out of service. Several days, after waiting for over 10 minutes we took the stairs from the 9 th floor. We never saw anyone woking on the elevator then on the 5th day it was back in service. 2nd--on our first morning we decided to eat breakfast n the hotel--big mistake. Not only was the food in the buffet cold, but it was of poor quality. The waiters and busboys stood around chatting instead of taking care of the customers. 3rd--Our room was small and dingey. The bathtub had mold around the edges and the carpet was dirty. 4th and last, when the weather turned cold, so did our room. I called the front desk because I couldn't figure out how to turn on the heat. I was told that the hotel would not be turning on the heat for another week when summer oficially ended. If we were paying hostel rates I might have shrugged off that bit of cheapness--but at $300 per night we expectd more.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: SawtoothinAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Like a very large youth hostel. Pleasant desk staff, clean bed. But...door did not shut properly, huge gap under door, dirty carpets, falling ceiling in ancient bathroom, no curtains to block sun, battered walls and furniture. In short, a disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good service”
Reviews.Author: SRaffo
Reviews.Content: The location is very good, just a tip: don´t eat at the hotel, there are better options close.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jules_Sam
Reviews.Content: I like the Holiday Inn on the 57th street - it was close to the subway and the beginning of the Central Park (2 blocks away) on a very calm street with enough commerce nearby (small market, places for breakfast and coffee, bars, Walgreen´s etc). This is good because, after a day walking in NYC you have an excellent place to rest. The room was big, as well as the bathroom. Everything was super clean and the view from the window was charming. Staff was very helpful - they were super nice in the check-in and check-out, as well as in the help of getting a cab to the airport and storing our luggage. There was wi-fi connection in the bedroom too. The only thing I missed about it was the mini-fridge in the room.

Reviews.Title: “True review from a travel agent”
Reviews.Author: ukdwe2412
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for how long you spend in the room in New York. Its location is great its a 10 min walk to times square and 5 min walk to Central park. Rooms are spacious we had 3 people in our room and this was ample. New York is amazing, I will be back and will stay in this hotel again. I loved the hotel's bars and public areas prices are reasonable too. I have recommended this hotel to many of my clients If you would like an independent travel agents advice on this hotel please email me daniel@thetravelcentreuk.com. Enjoy New York as much as I did!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for family, groups”
Reviews.Author: SouthGaTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: This summer, I took another student group to NY and the Holiday Inn Midtown/W 57th again met our needs adequately. Although not a luxury hotel, the rooms are large (especially if you book two queens - I have been in a one queen room that was pretty small, but that's not unusual for Manhattan) and clean. After dark, the bellmen and/or security guards ask to see a hotel key to boost security, and I've never felt unsafe. It's very convenient to Central Park and Lincoln Center, and Columbus Circle's multi-line subway station; it's not far from the theatre district and lots of restaurants, delis, etc. The Morning Star diner is on the corner across the street, offering good food at good prices. Is it the Ritz - no - but it is a good basic hotel and a good value, and very convenient. I have stayed with family and with groups a number of times and never paid more than $219 a night - often less - and NOT by booking on a discount website. I am always surprised to see bad reviews but most sound due to issues with booking on Priceline, Hotwire, etc. While I have used both, there is usually fine print explaining that they guarantee a room for two people (so if you're requesting two beds for a family, you may not get it) and they can't guarantee special requests (like non-smoking); so for the deep discounts, realize that you can't expect hotel management to fix issues you were warned about up front. Just a suggestion.

Reviews.Title: “Old and not so midtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharons_10
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through priceline, and reading the reviews we were not sure if it's good or bad. The staff was nice from our first day (we stayed 4 nights) and we got a room at the 18th floor, which was good – but we didn't know the elevator is an issue by itself. The elevators in this hotel are very slow, and at the evenings we had to wait in line for a few minutes for an elevator, and the ride could be better… The hotel is very old, and need to be renewed, the room is small (like all Manhattan hotels) but it's very old, the bed is too small and it is not comfortable. The bathroom is good until you hear a noise and the water just stops… it happened to us a few times and it was not a good experience, happened in the sink every morning as well. The lobby is very small and old, but there is good Wi-Fi in the public areas and even in the rooms (for free), but in the room it is very low. Regarding its location, well it is called midtown, but it's a bit far from the center, you have to walk at least 5-7 minutes to the nearest subway station, and in the hotel area you can't find anything. We expected more, but there was a sign in the hotel saying it is being renewed in the next 6 months, we didn't find a date on this sign, but for the future guests – I hope it will be soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: kpieper876
Reviews.Content: Overall we got a good price here. The facility has access to a complete gym and a pool. It's updated. Only drawback was that we had some problems with the door lock on our room, so we had to move. Would have been a nice touch to buy us a drink or something small for our troubles.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Orna12
Reviews.Content: We have been at this hotel with our grown children (2 rooms) The rooms are big butl old one , The location is great The hotel isn't very clean Again location great!

Reviews.Title: “Old and past it as are some of the staff”
Reviews.Author: McKerien
Reviews.Content: The rest of the not good list :- My feet were black after walking on the Carpet ( yes room carpet ) for 10 mins, errrrrr!! The lifts ( Elevators for the American audience  were so small and slow and so few of them waiting 15mins to get in one was the norm!! Safety deposit was the smallest draw in reception you have ever seen. I had mistakenly clicked smoking rooms not non smoking and the unfriendly’s said no hope live with it or words similar. Then 2 hours later the nice staff swapped our rooms no problems. Asking for a place to freshen up later in the afternoon due to a late flight was like asking for one person’s small children for the unfriendly’s, “ sorry sir we have no facilities you can use after you check out”. Then again 2 hours later we were offered the use of the gymnasium changing rooms and the instructor was very pleasant helping us with towels etc. I think this place needs modernisation fast and also a overhaul of it’s staff. That’s the only tip they got from me this visit! I do not plan to stay here again the cheep hotel I got via BA was 10 times better! a couple of years ago and half the price!

Reviews.Title: “Large Room/Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: maryd5
Reviews.Content: Excellent walking & convenience to Times Square, Central Park, etc. Reception desk very helpful in case you forgot something (like me!). Complimentary toothpase and disposable tooth brush, very handy! A bit inconvenient was the fact that I was staying on the 3rd floor and ice machine was on the 4th floor? Could not regulate the air temp in the room since the dial was broke. Good value for the money, large room with comfortable bed & pillows, clean and neat w/nice bar in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good location, so-so room”
Reviews.Author: lorne s
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in Hell's Kitchen, which, for anyone who doesn't know, is a nice area just west of the theatre district, which was about a 12-minute walk away. You're three blocks south of Central Park, and if you turn the corner onto 9th Ave, you'll find a ton of nice clubs, small bars and quaint restaurants -- most of which are much better than the tourist traps around Times Square. Location, therefore, is good, unless you dig the Midtown crowds. Hotel lobby and bar/restaurant is nice enough, and staff is courteous and helpful. My only semi-gripe is the room. Adequate, but kinda small. Bathroom is thisclose to being outdated (though it was clean), and the beds were a bit tight. Again, I had no specific problem, but the lodging might be an issue for anyone who likes a little more elegance and space. Otherwise, there's a decent exercise room (weights, treadmill) and an outdoor pool on top of the building -- nice, if the weather is hot and you like the sun (no shaded areas).

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and clean but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: bcrummy
Reviews.Content: Good bang for the buck but this hotels rooms need to be upgraded. The decor is old and out of date and there are no flat screen televisions. The lobby is nice and the service was good. Parking is right outside and an overnight was only $27 which is great for manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location - great Service”
Reviews.Author: phizbin
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Holiday Inn in NYC - 5 minute walk to Columbus Circle, Rooftop Pool, and helpful staff...

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: 30226Nonna44
Reviews.Content: Well located, spacious, comfortable, not cheap but still a good value for NY.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Quite”
Reviews.Author: Nina T
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a quite part of New York closest market was in Columbus Circuit which wasn't far.Rooms where nice & roomy.Although I think it is WRONG that to have a fridge in your room you have to pay $20 per day & you dont know this till you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Room was good and very convenient!”
Reviews.Author: lslsbl12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Midtown on West 57th Street for 2 nights before our Cruise and one night upon our return. The location of this hotel is excellent. It's close to Central Park, 5th Ave, and other sights. Plus, it's only 2 or 3 blocks from the Cruise Terminal if you are planning a Cruise leaving out of Manhattan. The hotel is clean, though it is quite a bit outdated. Holiday Inn is in the process of remodeling their hotels and I don't think they have remodeled this one yet. The rooms are large and well furnished. The reception area is nice and there is a nice bar in the lobby. The restaurant in the hotel is nice and not too expensive. They don't have a complimentary breakfast at this hotel, but they have a full breakfast menu in the restaurant plus muffins and coffee you can grab and go. If you are a Priority Club member you get a free coupon for a muffin, coffee and juice. There are also a few small restaurants up the street that offer a relatively cheap breakfast as well. The hotel front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. All in all, it's not a bad hotel and the location is the best. You feel safe walking at night and it's very convenient to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Room is very small and thin walls”
Reviews.Author: starbean111
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights as the hotel where my conference is sold out so I have no choice as this is the closest hotel but I will not stay again..for me this is a motel. Rooms are too small especially the bathrooms the space between the toilet and the door is not even an inch so you have to go all the way inside the bathroom just to close the door, furnitures are so outdated and still have the boom box t.v. Nonetheless the view from my room was nice and lastly the walls are so thin that you can here everything that the people are doing in the other room. However, staff at the bar was very friendly but not so much in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: saagrawal
Reviews.Content: I was in the city with my friend on the budget trip. I stayed here for a night as we got a good deal. And I think it was good value for money. Considering the standards of other hotels in NYC, rooms here are much larger. Though furnishing was very old, lot of space made up for this. Lobby is big too. They have a pool too but I couldn't use due to short stay. I think overall its a good hotel if you get a room for $150-$200 a night

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: JiangHuZhiYuan
Reviews.Content: Price is fair and the room is pretty clean and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !! Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: madziapl88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, it was so close to everything .. Central Park, Times Square etc. For the price I have to admit this is a pretty decent hotel and I'll definitely come back to this hotel on my next trip to New York City. The front desk was really helpful and let us extend our stay by reserving the spot before it went booked. The adviser by the front desk was a great help on telling us where to go and what to visit, gave us really great pointers. Great price for a hotel with a great location !

Reviews.Title: “you'll survive!!!”
Reviews.Author: BellaMami
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ghetto the worst i've stayed in New york city i was fooled by those good reviews...i dont know bout the other rooms but the room we got #217 was not impressive at all i didnt even bother taking pictures...old furnitures and it smelled bad since its a smoking room (we had no choice). location is ok not the best...One thing that bother me also that there was someone banging on our door and runs away everytime we open it...i survived 2 nights and will never go back...The service was ok...but i suggest you spend that extra 50$ and get your self a better hotel and location like the Shereton or Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Good location 2 minutes from Central Park”
Reviews.Author: rachxx1xx
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with 2 girl friends in October last year, we stayed for 2 nights. The location is good, 2 minutes from Central Park and 10-15 minutes walk along 57th Street to the main shopping streets, Bloomingdales, etc. Times Square is also a ten minute walk away. Plenty of cafes in the vicinity, although this isnt the prettiest area of Midtown (think it's in the part that used to be Hell's Kitchen). The hotel itself is a bit dated decor wise but clean enough, the room had 2 queen beds for the three of us and a city view room and was actually pretty big, plenty of space for 3 girls' suitcases anyway. Beds were very comfy and sheets nice, no noise from the street below that I can recall, cant remember there being a TV but we werent in NY to watch TV anyway! 2 medium sized lifts are available for the higher floors. We didnt eat in the hotel as there were lots of cafes nearby so cant comment on that. Service ok, they stored our luggage for us on our last day and ordered us a nice town car back to the airport which was cheaper than the yellow cab which we got from the airport. Overall, good value for money, not a luxurious hotel but when youre in New York on holiday you really arent in your hotel a lot anyway, so great if you just want a cheap, clean base.

Reviews.Title: “Nice size room”
Reviews.Author: Michael R
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Holiday Inn during a business trip. My wife came along. Our room was big and fresh looking. The furniture was comfortable. We had a view of the city. The hotel has a wonderful restaurant and bar. We ate all three of our breakfasts there, as well as one dinner. It is reasonably priced with great tasting food. I am a member of The Priority Club and we got coupons for breakfast or drinks which gave us a discount. Housekeeping does an efficient job. Our room was spotless. We needed more hangers, at one point, and they arrived within ten minutes of our request. The front desk manager, Yudith was helpful and friendly. Thanks for a good stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here!”
Reviews.Author: Kristin L
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I booked this hotel through a discount website. The website did not give us an opportunity to indicate that we wanted a non-smoking room (I realize this isn't the hotel's fault) When we arrived at the hotel, we were given the key to a smoking room. As someone with severe respiratory issues, I could not remain in this room. When we called management to ask what could be done we were simply told "nothing". They were "booked solid" Upon further prompting they agreed to let us go from a room with two queen beds to a room with one queen bed (what happened to your booked solid status?). We would then have the option of renting a cot for 25 extra dollars a night. When we asked if they would provide the cot for free due to the inconvenience that the whole situation was already causing us, we were told BY THE MANAGER, Janet, that she couldn't help us. Not once did she say she was sorry for the situation. Just that there was nothing she could do. So her intention was not only to have us be downgraded, but to pay extra money! I would NEVER recommend this hotel to ANYONE....though I will tell you that the housekeeping staff was sweet as could be. It's too bad they have a nasty manager like Janet. This issue will be taken above her head to her general manager. She does not belong in the hospitality business and at the very least she needs some retraining in her job. Just a simple apology for the situation out of that lady, even if she truly didn't believe the hotel was at fault, would have gone a long way towards mollifying us.

Reviews.Title: “perfect New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: manhattantraveler24
Reviews.Content: We were on a week long trip to NYC and were stayin at the midtown Holiday Inn, While the rooms were not the must luxirious but the pool on the roof definsntley made up for what the rooms lacked. And the front desk offered nice size safety deposit boxes to keep our valuables again. I would definantley stay there again, the staff was helped full and they made sure there was always a town car ready when we needed it.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel...good size room”
Reviews.Author: GvilleHistoryTours
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family here on a business trip. The location and rooms were o.k. Nothing special, though the size of the room we had with 2 beds was quite spacious. The kids really liked the rooftop pool, though it's too bad they are only open until 6:00.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dor S
