Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn is a nice hotel in a perfect location, its rooms are very old and MUSTY. In one of our rooms the AC almost didn't work and there wasn't even the basic equipment (as a mini-fridge or a safe) which we expected to have in such a decent hotel in Manhattan. The (three!!) elevators were always full of people and it took them ages to come. Except for all that, the hotel was very nice, the officers were kind and the location is excellent. (p.s. free wifi available, but disconnects every few minutes, not allowing VoIP usage...)

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julie W
Reviews.Content: Still in hotel as writing this, refused entry to pool (came back early for kids to have dip b4 we left for airport) - but won't let us even sit by it as we've checked out 2hours ago (thought we were doing maid a favour!) Our room was very old, problems with plumbing - dirty water smell. Staff not very friendly, food under average. Only positive is it's close to Times Sq etc. AVOID THIS HOTEL - lots better around. Watson family, Tamworth. UK.

Reviews.Title: “Not again.”
Reviews.Author: Kees63
Reviews.Content: Rooms are poor. Beds are good. Television is 25 years old. No fridge on the room. Bathroom is too old. Free wifi. People at reception are very kind. The location is fine. But the hotel needs a complete renovation. I wouldn't go there again. There are better places on NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Really? People call about the shower EVERY TIME?”
Reviews.Author: schimmelart
Reviews.Content: Be aware - if you book on a reduced price web site, you might not get the room you want. We were a party of 6 - requested 2 rooms with 2 double beds each. Got 2 rooms with king beds. Oops. Our bad? We did get roll-aways... eventually. The room is fine - beds are fine...but we did have a little problem with the bathrooms. One room - the toilet was blocked and would not flush. Second room - the shower was impossible to turn off. Got stuck on super hot during the kid's shower - I could not make the handle budge. Finally called housekeeping who sent up a maint. man - he fixed it quickly, but said and I QUOTE - "Not the first time, not the last time." SO, I guess that means the hotel is aware of problem and doesn't FIX IT. Thanks to this incident, we were late. The ice machines are not on every floor, and not all of them work. Skip breakfast - the food is okay, but the staff is rude and has no sense of urgency - you'll see them texting in the corner - and when they do bring the food, they almost throw it at you... instead, walk over to the Europa Cafe on the next block [8th Ave] for a good breakfast and great service. The walls are T H I N. We heard all people going in and out of the doors [they slam] and the man next door was having a great time with a "rental" - they were extremely loud...or maybe it was the walls. Now the good part - the location is fabulous. Close to the subway. 57th Street is a 2 way street, so you can hail a cab in either direction. Walk to museums, the park, etc. The computers in the lobby aren't free, but you can print your boarding passes pretty cheap. The concierge can book anything for you. There is a parking lot at the hotel. The staff was helpful, except in the cafe. The thing about being in NYC is you don't want to be in your hotel room. I guess if you can sleep and shower, you're good - too bad that wasn't so easy on this trip!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing waste of good money”
Reviews.Author: tryinghar
Reviews.Content: Whilst understanding New York is expensive, I am horrified that this hotel actually gets away with ripping people off so badly. Travelers beware! Blocked toilet; filthy room - you name it, we had it. What a shame that our first (and probably last) visit to New York was spoiled by this hotel's low standards.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this friendly and efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dogberry1258
Reviews.Content: For a central location, this was good value with very helpful and obliging staff. Rooftop pool was a real bonus (though we'd have loved it to be open earlier). Rooms clean and functional. Bar expensive - don't order G&T!

Reviews.Title: “We stayed for a week while moving out of New York - just the job!”
Reviews.Author: Cratch
Reviews.Content: A great position, nothing too far. Bigger hotel than I thought, ut we were very pleasantly surprised!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine for where and what it is!”
Reviews.Author: DaveKSimmo
Reviews.Content: Nothing too flash but hey, it's clean and comfortable and who spends much time in their room whilst in NYC? Staff are friendly and helpful, the lady on the concierge desk was invaluable in helping me to decide what broadway shows to see! Good rooftop pool but should stay open past 6pm. Very close Columbus circle subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a refreshing”
Reviews.Author: Frankfett
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel during the month of June 2011. I stayed there also on a previous trip a few years back. The location is OK but not great. Parking fee is reasonable for Manhattan. The hotel room was clean but not up to today's standards for a Holiday inn in my view, no flat screen HDTV and A/C was very old and noisy. Concierge was very helpfull. The A/C in the entire hotel was going to be turned off for a few days after I had left. They were posting this in elevators. Some guests complained that they had not received prior notice of this. Will I stay there again, yes if the price is right (180$+tx or less per night).

Reviews.Title: “Better than we had expected”
Reviews.Author: condo_67
Reviews.Content: We had booked our New York trip as part of a package, at the time of booking we were happy with the Holiday Inn at 57th Street as it was in a good location, price wise it fitted within our budget and it had the bonus of a roof top pool (brochure details). Only a week or so before our visit we had reminded ourselves via Trip Advisor of our selection and we were horrified to read some of the comments - rats, bed bugs, unwelcoming staff etc. so we were not looking forward to our visit. Our experience was somewhat different to this, majority of staff were helpful (mostly they were just slow), the room was clean and large enough for a family for 5 nights in fact the room was surprisingly large for NYC. The bathroom was slightly tired but was clean and functional. The a/c worked for the time we were there, therefore ticking all of our boxes. The beds were also very comfortable after a long day in a very hot city. An added benefit was free wi-fi in the hotel and this proved extremely useful in avoiding expensive roaming fees. The only element I was surprised at was no room safe - we did use the free safety deposit boxes in reception and these were small and slightly inconvenient to use - a member of staff had to open with you as they held a 2nd key. The Holiday Inn has an odd configuration (2 towers), we were overlooking the pool on the 12th floor, the pool was great to cool off after some v hot days but were suprised by the very early closing times - check times if you intend to use. Location was also very good (for our plans) 57th & 9th Ave, close to subway (Columbus Circle), possible to walk to Times Sq etc. At the end of a long hard sightseeing day the taxi fare's to return to hotel were not overly expensive so location wise we were more than happy. Overall better than we had expected, we did not encounter any rodents or blood sucking insects during our visit - what a relief.

Reviews.Title: “A nice and quiet family hotel close to central park with spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: ociTraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at and Inn Midtown NY for 7 nights in July 2011. Starting with our check-in until our check-out it was a very good experience. The staff were friendly and helpful (except for the girl at the bar who was a bit disinterested in her job :) The room was great - very spacious, tidy and well furnished with a king sized bed. The location was Midtown Manhattan, close to central park and near the Columbus Circle subway station. West 57th street is close to Broadway theatre district (we watched Lion King and Chicago) and Time Square. We could also walk to 5th Ave, Madison Ave and Park Ave to do our shopping. The swimming pool was a welcome feature in the hot NY summer. Overall we are happy customers and will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, no frills”
Reviews.Author: sch007
Reviews.Content: Price was better than most of Manhattan, there was free wifi and attached parking. Otherwise it was not much. Claustrophobic corridors, no curtains, lousy view, not much in the way of amenities. But it was what we needed spending most of our time sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “We Have Stayed Here Twice and Just Booked Our Third”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine_0606
Reviews.Content: Our first trip was just an overnighter but it sold us for the 2nd one which was 9 days. The hotel staff is amazing super friendly. From what I understand this in the only hotel with an outdoor roof top pool! It was great snack bar, plenty of towels, and very clean. Both rooms we had were very large which is not normal for hotels in NYC. Beds were very comfortable and the rooms were clean. Parking right under the hotel but make sure to have EVERYTHING out of your car. Also if you want a luggage cart they will not let you do it yourself. Another plus there is a full gym right at the hotel that is FREE! The hotel is very close to whatever you need. Right around the corner on 9th you have blocks and blocks of restuarants try the Five Napkin Burger it was great and Q2 Thai restuarant was awesome. Holey Cream was great for desert! Moonrock diner is great for breakfast right on 57th just 1 block away. 2 blocks to the subway. Take the Staten Island Ferry for free and you get a great view of the Statue of Liberty.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: clairebear1958
Reviews.Content: We were on our second honeymoon and stayed here 2 nights. Enjoyed the experience a lot. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Holiday1043
Reviews.Content: To start off with the good things - lovely rooftop pool area, nice view from our room (one of the upper floors). Conveniently located away from the noice at Time Square, but close enough to walk there (maybe about 15 min), and only a few minute from Central Park However: did not feel totally secure- the extra lock on our door didn´t work. No room key needed for the elevators. There was no safe in the room (apparently some rooms have) but we were lucky to get the last available safe deposit (which was really small - no chance of fitting in an ipad or even small laptop) at the front desk. Obviously not enough safes for all guests. Our room was a bit run down with peeling wallpaper, but no disaster. Breakfat not included, and the small buffet was not worth the price if you want a somewhat healthy option.

Reviews.Title: “great location and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: hammeretteWelling
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days in early June and found the location great. On the edge of Central Park and easy walking distance of Times Square. We didn't eat in the hotel. the best breakfasts and snacks to be found in the Morning Star cafe just round the corner. Lots of good restaurants but we liked the Brooklyn Diner. Only problem at the hotel we found was that the only choice of pillows are medium and hard. Just so uncomfortable. If you only want to doss after sight seeing this is a reasonably priced option.

Reviews.Title: “Location was perfect...and yes a remodel would be welcome to guests”
Reviews.Author: cptravelmaven
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel really is perfect. We took the train, buses, taxi...on the weekend we even rented a car to drive up to Scarsdale. At any rate, the hotel is close to EVERYTHING. I even felt safe walking around by myself later in the evening. If you are familiar with NY it's about 4 blocks away from Columbus Circle/Central Park. We were on the 17th floor. So street noise wasn't a huge problem. But I did smell the mildew on the carpets that other reviewers mentioned. However since I had a balcony and could open the window, I could easily air the room out so it wasn't a deal breaker. They are in the process of remodeling the hotel. So on my next trip I'll consider staying there again. Restaurants are everywhere and close by. But have a breakfast meal in the hotel. Food was good. I used the dry cleaning service and the concierge. Both did a good job. Is it me or did anyone else feel like the housekeepers were stalking them so they could hurry up and clean the room? LOL Anyway I was grateful to have someone else do the cleaning for a change (and they always did a good job for the 9 days we stayed)

Reviews.Title: “Staff went the extra mile...”
Reviews.Author: Vinnysmom
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay; second time with my family. I was impressed with Tara in reservations who found me a good AARP rate and was able to hold the room I requested for me. Didn't expect such responsiveness from a big chain in a big city. Enjoyed the pool and found the room comfortable and parking fee reasonable. Look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed here twice and will be back”
Reviews.Author: princessjane13
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn 57th Street, a fantastic location to see all New York attractions, walking distance to Central Park and Times Square, plenty of shops, bars and Restaurants locally. The most polite and friendly staff you could wish for, Rooms very basic but clean, and don't forget how fantastically cheap this hotel is compared to London or other Major tourist cities. I have been lucky enough to have travelled all over the world and you learn to appreciate what you have paid and what you receive, if you want a 5 star boutique hotel, pay for one !! I visited the newly opened Dream Hotel in New York, fabulous rooftop terrace bar (very expensive) apparently guest list only at night (if you are good looking, rich or fit you are on the list) pleasant surroundings but VERY pretentious place, can't see it lasting as the cheapest bottle of wine $350, in Tesco £10, get real New York, not everyone in England is impressed by ostentatious places and rules. Thank you and goodnight..........Princess Jane !!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back here :-(”
Reviews.Author: SCVDeb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is VERY worn and needs a big time make-over. The hotel lobby looks fine; however, once you enter the elevator just take note the adventure has begun. We stayed on the 12th floor and while the linen was decent, the floors were just disgusting (new carpet needed badly) and the ice machines are located on every other floor (maybe, we had to search for a working one when we were there). The bathroom was small and in need of caulking and painting...truly this was an awful experience and if I hadn't already paid in full on Orbitz for this room using this room I would have RAN from this place!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a Significant Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: A_OKD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Mid-Town on West 57th street during the weekend of July 22 2011. In summary, this Holiday Inn underwhelmed me. The elevators were painfully slow to arrive (even at 6am on a Sunday), the hallway on my floor was dirty and had large boxes of furniture strewed throughout , the free Wi-Fi did not work and the customer service team at eHost was not able to help me, my room needed to be updated in the most urgent way and when I called Front Desk to report a faulty toilet nothing was done to correct the situation. I would not recommend this hotel to any traveler who expects a modicum of service and cleanliness from a budget hotel option.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and Miss Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Skrzypeks
Reviews.Content: For a hot sticky city in the summer, the pool and central proximity to NYC attractions were the reasons I booked here. To our family's disappointment ,the pool was closed early in the evening. The air conditioning was down Monday and Wednesday, making the room sweltering. I appreciated the room and the beds were very comfy. The double doubles were perfect for a family of four. The elevator wait and ride was primitive, small and cramped...and slow. The staff was very helpful in arranging a wee early ride to La Guardia with a car service that knew all the tricks to get us there in good time. The hotel is a good place to sleep, but not hang out.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: billndiane
Reviews.Content: Our stay was all we hoped for and more! The room was large. We had two doubles because we carried our two grandchildren (8 & ll). Beds and pillows were so-o-o-o comfy. Everything was very clean. Watch out for the step UP into the bathroom - you may have a stumped toe if you don't put the bath mat down over the threshold. We missed having at least a small refrigerator in the room. The concierge was a tremendous help in locating places and giving us perfect directions for the subway which is only two blocks away as is Central Park. Take the bicycle ride rather than the horse and buggy because you get an hour ride rather than 20 minutes and our guide got out with us on several occasions and made pictures of us together. He told of all the films that were made there and which celebrities lived in various apartments we passed. Do yourself a favor and take a taxi from JFK for only $45 and don't bother with the Etrains and subways - it can be a hassle. We enjoyed two meals at the hotel and the children ate free! You'll want to take children to Serendipity or Dylans Ice Cream and Candy - make reservations for Serendipity however! The pool on the roof was a favorite for the children too - again, really clean with ample towels and lounges. All in all - we found the folks in NYC to be extremely friendly, courteous and kind. Midtown Manhattan is definitely the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: Excalibur_11
Reviews.Content: The only good thing in this hotel is the location, accessible to all places, other than that nothing is special.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value”
Reviews.Author: Germam
Reviews.Content: Old hotel, not friendly, sade room, no decoration. Not to recommand for a touristic stay in New York

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Gary613
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from 2nd July to 7th July this year. We were in room 1046 and appart from the fact that the room could do with a spot of paint a decorating here and there it was o.k. Booking in was o.k. with one problem regarding the number of days we had prepaid to a tour operator for our stay and that was eventually sorted out in our favour by the friendly receptionist at the hotel,well done.! The location of this hotel is excellent i.e. Three bloock from Time Square. Two blocks to Central Park. a few blocks to the River Bank. The bar was very well run and I would personally like to that the Equadorian barman for is excellent manner and service. I would like also to that Michael at the front desk for the way he helped us. Gary and Kathleen Evans. South Wales.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Janekendall1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week of July and were very pleased. The rate was perfect for us considering that we refused to pay a lot for a room to sleep in. We have an 11 and 7 year old and we were able to walk to everything we wanted to see and do. Walking is a must in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “stay only if you are on a very tight budget!”
Reviews.Author: maureen029
Reviews.Content: I stayed in late June when the air con was off and it was unbearable. It appears it has happened again since so anyone who hasnt booked beware! It is as a lot of reviewers have already said, it is very tired and worn, scruffy would describe it well. We upgraded to breakfast but found out that it was only a $20 voucher which didnt cover the cost of breakfast for two so you had to put extra to the bill....The rooms are musty smelling but mine was clean and tidy. I was only staying 2 days so it was bearable. On the positve side it has a great location a couple of blocks from central park and has a small roof top pool which is great if you have kids but this closes at 6pm which is a shame. It is cheap and if you are on a really tight budget I would say it's not the worst hotel you could stay in NY I'm sure....

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: Familytravelers6_11
Reviews.Content: Was hesitant about this hotel after reading some of the previous reviews. Had none of the problems that some others mentioned. Must have completed their renovation b/c our room was fine. The bathrooms do smell musty, though. Staff was always polite and helpful. Parking was very reasonable for NYC and the attendants were extremely helpful. Pool hours are too short. Very close to Central Park. Nice neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and i"ll back”
Reviews.Author: latin2014
Reviews.Content: spent the weekend there¡ nice location pool was great specially bartender Alvaro he was amazing !!!!! rooms a bit dated but who cares ! got a great view of the fireworks! def would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “SO SO.....But no Management!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmeL70
Reviews.Content: I went on a tour of NY with a group. They had stayed here b4. When we arrived there was no air condition. The group leader had called the night b4 and was not told of this. There was notices in the elevator stating the air would b out for 3 days!!!! The manager had no conscience what so ever! He NEVER said he was sorry. Our group had 45 rooms booked and not a word of apology or trying to find us something else. We were told that we would get a fan and we could open our windows (These only opened about 3-4 inches). Called for a fan...they was out....finally we got one fan. My group of 4 had a asthmatic person with us). The bathroom had no fan...the gnats were as big as flies in the bathroom and just keep accumlating. I had to call 3 times to ask for additional towels and wash clothes!!!! Rooms were old and outdated....staff was rude. Not helpful except for one bellboy named Jimmy. He was the nicest in the hotel. I hope that Holiday Inn Management will look into the rudeness of its staff at this hotel. The only good things I can say is ....easy to get a cab and no bedbugs! Room 441-2 nights! No view!

Reviews.Title: “Made a mistake”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELER007_11
Reviews.Content: Last time I stayed in this Hotel, it was a pleasant experience. Front desk was friendly and helpful, the room was nice. BUT that was in 2009. This time the experience has not been so great. On June 26, while taking a shower, the water stopped running. Called the operator and to my shock I was informed that water will resume in about 20 minutes. With Shampoo on your head, it is unheard that in any hotel in New York, water wilol stop running. On june 27th the air conditioning did not seem to function. Called the operator and to my utter shock I was informed that the air conditioning system would start functioning not before Tuesday i.e on Ju8ne 28th. A guest expects that atleast there would be a notice or an apology but probably iy appears that Midtown Holiday Inn takes its guests for granted. I was also made to feel as if booking the hotel through a site other than Holiday Inn was not welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Found a large rat in my room!! No kidding!!”
Reviews.Author: dale5050
Reviews.Content: On the night of June 23rd I stayed at the Holiday Inn on 57th street and 10th avenue in midtown Manhattan with my wife and our three small children ages 11,10 and 8. When we initially arrived at the hotel we were happy to discover that the hotel's location was situated nicely between Central Park and Times Square. We were also initially happy with the comfortable beds and the fact that it had a pool for our children. Unfortunately things took a turn for the worse later that night. At about two in the morning I got up out of bed, flipped on the light switch and went to walk over to use the bathroom--to my shock and horror sitting on the floor in front of me was a large brown rat. Needless to say I stumbled backwards and nearly broke the mirror to the closet behind me trying to backpeddle as quickly as possible. I have heard of bed bugs and roaches in hotel rooms, but rats!? Wow! Anyway, the rat scurried by me and went under my bed probably trying to get away from me as quickly as I was trying to get away from it. What was unsettling was when I called the front desk for assistance the clerk stated,"Welcome to New York City. Rats are everywhere. Get used to it.". There was no apology or concern. In fact, she offered to send a housekeeper to come pick it up as if it was no big deal--was she nuts? I couldn't get out of that room fast enough! When I explained to her that I was not going to stay in that room again (room 1532) she suddenly became irritated as if I was ruining her night!! Wow! After some additional detail as to the size of the rat and the fact that I was not going to be able to sleep in that room again we were reluctantly changed to the 14th floor to a smokers room that smelled terrible--the bottom line is that we didn't get any sleep and we all felt terrible the next day. For the price of this room I expected at least some semblence of common courtesy from the staff--what I ended up with was feeling totally insulted. If any members of the Holiday Inn management team happen to read this review I sincerely hope that you take this review seriously and work to improve your staffs people skills. If my wife, one of my children or myself had been bitten by the rat I can guarantee you that this matter would not have been so easily dismissed! I understand that things like this can happen in a big city like New York, what I can't understand is why I was treated like I was an annoyance for bringing it to their attention!!!

Reviews.Title: “Notnthe best!”
Reviews.Author: 0414travel
Reviews.Content: Although hotel is situated in a reasonable location I would pay the extra to stay closer to 5th ave or even Times Square. Staff were extremely unhelpful to the point of just plain rude! I liked the size of the room and that we were given 2 x double beds however the curtains don't close and there is no fridge in the room. Rooms are very outdated. As per previous notes the lift is very slow and has a mind of it's own so make sure you are paying attention!! Doors to rooms slam when guests come and go so this can be very loud at night and in the morning, I personally didn't sleep well for the 5 night stay so left pretty tired. Hotel conceirge advised that there hotel airport transfer was the cheapest option at $60 includes tax and tip... Arrived at airport and the driver was annoyed he didn't get a tip! I was so pissed off with hotel by this stage I told him he was best taking this up with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nycvac22
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four nights at this hotel. We were a family with kids. The hotel was clean. The rooms were big. It has the added benefit of the rooftop pool. Kids eat free at the hotel restaurant. It is in a nice neighborhood, walking distance to everything. Definitely a good value.

Reviews.Title: “There's nothing bad to say..”
Reviews.Author: voorentje
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights in this hotel around christmas. For Manhattan standards, the room was really large, but somewhat outdated. The interior of the hotel was nicely decorated. Service at this hotel was very good and helpful. If you're not looking for a design- hotel, but want a simple, but spacious and clean room, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located, Large Rooms and Reasonably Priced for NYC, But BAD Air Conditioning and Internet!”
Reviews.Author: timeliebe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to New York City five-six times a year, and because I belong to ICI Hotel's Priority Club we generally stay at Holiday Inns. When we come down in the Winter or Fall, I often prefer to stay at this hotel as it's convenient for buses, subways, taxis and walking, being on the upper edge of Midtown Manhattan, and the rooms are pleasantly large for NYC hotels (it's a refurbished older hotel). It's also Reasonably-Priced for Midtown Manhattan business hotels with room service and an on-premises health club - rooms run from under $200/night most of the year (you're usually looking to pay double-triple that), room service is Holiday Inn-level okay (heavy on the high-cholesterol foods and red meat, with good-but-not-great preparation that takes a while to deliver), and the Health Club is full-service though more geared towards serious gym rats than business travelers. The neighborhood has a variety of restaurants, drugstores and grocery stores and even Columbus Circle Mall within a few block's walk, and is safe for foot traffic even at night - admittedly, we'd lived in NYC for a quarter-century before moving Upstate, but neither my wife nor I have any problems walking around there after dark. However, don't stay in the summertime because the hotel's AC is set to "as little as we can manage", and room are often intolerably hot for my wife and I who likes things chilly on hot days. Moreover, hotel wireless Internet is apparently a DSL connection and consumer router shared by everybody - I don't expect blistering-speed fiber optic in a hotel, but I also don't expect it to take all night to download my daily e-mails and an audio podcast or two!

Reviews.Title: “Totally fine but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: LakeIsland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for almost a week for our first trip to NYC. It was a pretty standard, comfortable room - 2 double beds, all the basics, free wi-fi which was a nice perk. The elevator was super slow and an annoyance at times. It was centrally enough located, we enjoyed going down 9th avenue for dining. Didn't find the hotel staff particularly helpful, charged to store our bags and tried to sell us the private car to the airport which is more expensive than just cabbing it. Overall it was decent, nothing special, but offered a good comfortable stay and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Was Just Alright”
Reviews.Author: Music_Is_Viva
Reviews.Content: For the most part this was a decent hotel. I just stayed one night for a quick business hotel, and it satisfied my needs. However, the rooms seem to be poorly insulated, and it was very noisy. Also, the staff seemed somewhat arrogant, and weren't the most friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Best bargain in the City”
Reviews.Author: eserotta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at th Holiday Inn every week during a three month assignment. The rooms are spacious and clean. Beds ultra comfortable. Everything was always in good repair and recent renovations could be seen throughout with new carpeting on every floor. Decent lobby bar and the staff was always helpful when asked. And the prices were unreal when I booked online. The location is excellent with lots of restaurants in the area. Best of all, less than two blocks to Columbys Circle subway. Internet was slow (but free) when i started staying there but seemed to be upgraded in March. The only nit was old CRT TVs but i believe they were planning to install flat screens.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Convenient Location - hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Win396
Reviews.Content: We were not happy with our room when we arrived. Air conditioning was very poor, peeling wallpaper in bathroom, some mold on ceiling, carpet worn. Some people got stuck in the elevators. They offered to move us, but the other room was the same. On the upside - beds were very comfortable, staff was very helpful and accommodating. They gave us two fans for our room which helped alot. You don't spend alot of time in your room in NYC, so for the price we paid, it was alright. Would I stay there again....probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Dirty Rooms.........and bed bugs too!!”
Reviews.Author: nycndc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an absolute nightmare. Worn and old furnishings with poor housekeeping. When we complained to the General manager Joe C, he was arrogant and rude!! He just brushed us of like we were bothering him. Save your money and stay somewhere else. It's the pitts.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Missy342
Reviews.Content: I had already booked this hotel and then read the reviews...some bad. We were pleasantly surprised though! Great location, large room by NY standards, nice personnel who are very informative about things to do, places to eat, etc. Don't believe the reviews by picky people, this is a nice clean hotel and in a great location! Don't know about other rooms, but we were in 1132. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and safe”
Reviews.Author: kbye
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms, and the price was great for the neighborhood. Very good restaurants were all within walking distance, as well as the subway and Broadway. The rooms were nothing special, but they were clean and the service was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Get in early or else”
Reviews.Author: grahamearls
Reviews.Content: Get to the Hotel early. Our flight was delayed and we arrived at the hotel at 11pm they had given our rooms to someone else. There were no non smoking rooms left so they gave us smoking rooms instead and they were disgusting, the smell was through everything even the pillows and blankets. We were supposed to have twin rooms. One room was at one end of the building and the other at the other end. The 5 of us ended up all sleeping in two double beds. My wife and son both had asthma attacks during the night from the smell. Our accommodation had been booked for three months and they said bad luck first in first served

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, Hotel so so”
Reviews.Author: Superfoodiemoodie
Reviews.Content: It is located in Manhattan, walking distance from Times Square. Rooms are no bad, but a little bit old. Its bar is nice and the service is ok. I know the rate I paid is worth for the place where it is located, but I still think the hotel could remodel someday.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location for the money”
Reviews.Author: Debbie8888
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel on Priceline.com for a great price. I was later told any hotel in NYC under $400 has bed bugs. We stayed one night, 5/31/11. We were very impressed. It was our first trip to NYC. It was in a great, safe area close to midtown & Central Park South. Felt comfortable walking any where even to dinner at night. The beds were very comfortable. No bed bugs! Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice. Comfy. Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: tmc88
Reviews.Content: Felt very welcome as we arrived. Rooms were comfy and were a decent size. We had a buffet breakfast at the Gotham cafe downstairs which was yum. Great service there too! Very close to central park and other areas. All within walking distance - which is what you want to do in new York to see everything. Only about a ten minute walk to time square. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, worst Holiday Inn ever”
Reviews.Author: peggykight1022
Reviews.Content: When we walked down the hallway to our room, it smelled so badly of cigarette smoke, you could hardly breathe. The room was marginally better. There was a lot of noise, all night from the outside. It was very expensive, and we didn't have time to find alternative room. The carpet was very dirty, the shower grout had mold. The air conditioner control was broken, had to put the knob back on, then it never completely cooled the room. There was a sign by the elevator saying that renovation was in progress, but there was no evidence thaqt anything was being done. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. It was very overpriced and awful.

Reviews.Title: “NYC WEEKEND”
Reviews.Author: bergsmac
Reviews.Content: this hotel was fantastic for the price. it was in walking distance to everything very quite and very clean. we would stay here again. only negative is the air conditioner in our room did not work very well. would not want this room on a hot NYC summer night. great price, great location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Surreyglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights on a business trip in this hotel, mainly because it was a last minute booking and this was one of the only hotels with rooms under $500 a night. The room was large, comfortable and the wifi worked well and was free, which was important as I spent a lot of time dealing with work emails. As my company was paying it was an acceptable place to stay, but if I had been paying myself I would have wanted a much better rate, especially as the vast majority of other guests seemed to be either backpackers or families on package rates. I guess the trick is to book well in advance. I have nothing to complain about, but nothing to rave about either. The one outstanding aspect was one of the check-in staff. A colleague was also staying here, for one night only, and had mistakenly been booked into a smoking room. At check-in the member of staff did all she could to resolve this, given there were no non-smoking rooms available and came up with a good solution that fixed the problem. I agree with several of the other recent reviews – very good in that we were able to check in straight from our flight, at around 2pm in the afternoon, which was very useful. I also waited a long time for lifts at busy times – the worst was over ten minutes to get a lift to arrive at the ninth floor to go to the lobby. The room was large and generally clean and comfortable, but a couple of areas (especially around the wardrobe) were musty.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: TrunKmonKeY1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, walking distance to many places (eg central park, times square, broadway, the subway). Rooms were clean and serviced daily, however you could hear patrons in the rooms next door. Lifts were really slow during peak times (once waited for 5 lifts before being able to get in one) The room we stayed in wasnt big, but itserved its purpose as we basically slept in the room as we were out all the time. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous trip”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkfan60
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel two hours earlier than the booking in time but were still able to book to our room which we were very relieved about after a long flight. The room was large and clean. Vending machine for drinks on each floor which was very handy. All the staff were very helpful and friendly throughout our stay and went out of their way to help, particularly when it came to checking out and arranging our transport back to the airport! Very impressed. Enjoyed a lovely breakfast every morning in the hotel resteraunt before venturing out for the day . Very fast and efficient service. Really good location, couple of blocks from central park and times square. Good budget hotel, you get what you pay for and a little bit more! We thouroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “MUSTY, OLD, AND NOT A GOOD CHOICE......”
Reviews.Author: flandkd
Reviews.Content: I am a big supporter of the Holiday Inn brand because it allows you to use a minimal number of points and $60 to stay at their hotels. This time I was on business and the hotel was to be seen to be believed. The room was quite large but all of the furniture looked like it had not been changed in 50 years... The lock on the room door was broken, the air conditioner did not work (it was unseasonably warm and, while I called for an engineer one never came), and the television was as old as the furniture, with a very limited number of channels and a wavy line going across the screen. A large flap of the carpet that normally comes up an inch or two from the floor and is attached to the wall was flopping over and hanging down for about ten feet along the wall. I checked out the following morning and had to book another hotel for my remaining two nights. When I asked to speak to the manager the person at the front desk that I was directed to told me that I should have complained earlier. I told her about having called for an engineer but she just kept repeating that I should have told someone about this.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly acceptable but uninspired stay”
Reviews.Author: RMurray847
Reviews.Content: As is the case with so many hotels in NYC, the lobby of the Holiday Inn is very nice. There's an attractive bar at the far end, high ceilings, elegant front desk, etc. And with most NYC hotels, once you get to your room, you are let down by the cramped quarters. We spent 4 nights there (myself, wife, 23 year old son & 18 year old daughter). THANK GOODNESS the room was a decent size. It actually felt mostly like a room you'd find in the midwest somewhere. Two decent sized beds and some actual room to walk around the room. A couple of small sitting areas. A cabinet with a TV. All very bland and typical...but for traveling in NYC ON A BUDGET, it was surprisingly good sized. The bathroom, on the other hand, was quite small...thank goodness the sink was on the outside, because even taking the toilet/shower space combined with the sink space...two people together would have been quite tight. Closet space (for hanging items) was okay but not super generous. I think if you were spending longer than 4 or 5 nights, you'd get a bit tired of the lack of space. We were okay overall. The hotel was not terribly noisy (we were all the way up on the 2nd floor!! That's what we get for getting a low price on Travelocity, I guess), and I think we all slept pretty well. The pillows were fine (and marked as "soft" & "firm", in case you couldn't tell for yourself). Service was fine. The concierge was very friendly and helpful. We did not avail ourselves of the food or beverage service at all. Truthfully, the biggest drawback of this modest hotel was the location. It's not terrible, but it's not great either. You're about two long blocks from the nearest subway station...although it's the station at Columbus Circle, and that has just about every line running through it. And this two block walk is not terribly interesting. It's not a bad neighborhood, but you're mostly walking by Walgreens, CVC and pet supply stores...no glamour at all! You're a longish walk to Times Square, so if that's your bag (we saw several shows) you're more than likely going to take a cab or subway most fo the time. The southwestern entrance to Cental Park is a bit closer though, so if you're planning considerable time in the Park, this is a good spot. I assume the reason we got a reasonable rate WAS the location. As I looked for hotels just a little closer to the "action", rates went up a good 20% from what we paid...so I was okay with the inconvience. In summation, staying at the Holiday Inn won't be the high point of your visit to NYC...but if you're coming there for the hotel, you've got the wrong priorities! If you want something clean, reasonable and not TOO far from the midtown action...this isn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Greatly relieved!”
Reviews.Author: sas600
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for location and tend to use Holiday Inn. Having made the booking I was horrified by the majority of reviews I read. It was therefore with some trepidation that I arrived at the hotel. However, I was very pleasantly surprised, efficient and friendly service, good size (and very clean) bedroom for Manhattan, Okay, the bathroom was dated as were some of the fixtures in the room but they were fine. (Apparently all rooms are being updated and there were signs that this is being carried out). Reception can be very busy with large groups arriving. I was able to check in and have my room at noon. A very efficient desk service for booking cab to airport etc. Excellent value .

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfortable Manhattan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: balibeachboy
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Holiday Inn on 57th St. The best selling point for this hotel is its convenient location--just two blocks from the Columbus Circle subway station and three blocks from Central Park South. Our room was fine--nothing special but no problems. The concierge was very friendly and helpful. Check-in could have been faster, considering there were two people working behind the counter and only 3 customers. The hotel has a pool on the roof, but we didn't use it this time. My general impression--a standard, no-frills Holiday Inn. If you can get a good rate, it can be a good affordable option for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: sandiego2011
Reviews.Content: The staff was quiet courteous, room was clean and housekeeping offered their services everyday. Location is great -- with Columbus circle 2 blocks away, some shops are open 24-hrs (like dunkin donuts). Although the hotel's restaurant is fine, there are plenty of restaurants (subway, boston market, europan), grocery store, pharamacies (duane reade, walgreens, cvs) within 5 minutes of walking distance. Several landmarks are within 20 minutes walking distance - Columbus Circle, Central Park, Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall. We even walked to Times Square, Plaza hotel (5th ave) although it took much more time. I was able to avoid traffic and take subway from Columbus Circle to JFK for $7.50. Concern: It was unusually cold in March 2011. Although the heating in the room was ok, there were times it still felt a little cold. But to their credit, the hotel gave us extra blankets which were heavy and quite useful.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing. Holiday inn, wake up!”
Reviews.Author: Duettist96
Reviews.Content: I came hear direct from Holiday Inn New Orleans , which was excellent despite having had poor reviews. This was NOT. When I arrived on Friday night, there was a tray of food outside a room in my corridor. It was still there 36 hours later bit someone had moved it to the lift. 6 hours after THAT it was back outside the room. You will imagine the condition. The corridor did not smell fragrant. The aircon in the room failed, and as the temperature on NYC was warm today I have not been impressed. Staff are surly and indifferent. Why? Stay at Park Central or the Salisbury. Both just off W57th, more central, cleaner and with nicer staff. Sorry - I cannot ever remember rewriting a poor review before. I will be suggesting to Virgin that they rethink this one. This is the 5or 6th time for me ver in NYC But sadly the most disappointing in terms of accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: flahagan
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms here from April 8 - 10. One room was for my brother (age 59), the other for me (67) and my adult daughter. We were in town to see my grandson perform at Lincoln Center with his college symphony that Saturday night. Originally, we had reservations to stay at the Park Central Hotel where grandson and his group were staying. But I found a really good rate at the HI at the last-minute so we changed. And boy were we glad we did! Even though these were queen smoking rooms (18th floor) and we don't smoke, there was no detectable smoke odor in either room. We were willing to put a few deodorizers around for the rate we got, but were thrilled we didn't need to do this. The other hotel looked like spring break at Daytona - the lobby was overflowing with teenage groups and I can only imagine the noise with all of them roaming the hallways at night. We loved the HI, the front desk people were always friendly, we never had to wait in line either for check-in or check-out. Loved that one of our rooms was ready when we got there at 10:30 AM. This allowed us to deposit all our luggage there and head out sightseeing. After nearly killing our legs between walking around town and the subway steps on day 1, we got a bus map/schedule from the concierge the 2nd day and really liked utilizing the buses. The north/south line ran downtown on 9th, uptown on 10th, so we just walked to or from either corner for these and never waited longer than 5 minutes. The cross-town (57th St.) bus was right there also and we used this a LOT! This really saved our legs. Our rooms were a good size, esp. for NYC, and we liked that we could open the windows. Both of our rooms had good views, with my brother's view really spectacular as he was on the rear of the building and had the whole skyline to view plus the Hudson River off to the side. The views were such a nice, unexpected bonus. The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows. The bathroom was pretty small, but everything was clean and our rooms were made up promptly. Decor looks like any standard motel room, but as we were only in it to clean up and sleep, we were happy with it. The morning we checked out, we were able to use a dedicated computer at the end of the counter to print our boarding passes (for free), which was a great convenience. We also were able to store our luggage for the day at no charge, although we did tip when we picked it up. We had planned to get a taxi back to LaGuardia, but the hotel attendant asked if we wanted a towncar for a flat rate of $40, incl. tolls and tip. Since it had cost us $45 in a taxi to get there, we jumped on this offer. The "limo" was waiting for us when we got outside, and as the traffic was horrendous on that late Sunday afternoon, it took us close to an hour to get there. We were so glad we weren't on the meter! They said we could have had the same service for our arrival - wish I'd have known that, as the car was large and comfortable. We had breakfast one AM across the street at the Morningstar Cafe, a little place where the locals come and the food and service were first-rate. Ate dinner one night on 57th btwn 8th and 9th at Reynolds Pub and highly recommend for nice atmosphere, good food and fair prices. I had a huge sirloin burger (delicious) with fries for $10.95 and couldn't even finish it all. There's a Walgreen's across the street and a nice little wine shop just down the block, btwn 8th/9th, that had some really great prices. The guy even opened our bottle for us, as we didn't have a corkscrew in our room. All of us said that if we ever get back to NYC we'd stay at this Holiday Inn again. Not the Ritz, but more than met our expectations and needs.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Okay Stay”
Reviews.Author: Canuckboy44
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here from Nov 29-Dec 4th, 2010. It was a special return trip to NYC for a milestone birthday. This was my second trip to New York but it had been 15 years. So much has changed in NYC in that time! The hotel is in midtown and is about a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square. It is a good location and we got a decent deal on Hotels.ca. It came to just over $1400 Canadian for a 5 night stay. Not bad for a hotel in that area. The room was clean and comfortable but certainly our room/wing was not newly renovated. The internet service is free but quite slow. Apparently that is a common issue though at most hotels there. The room was quite spacious for a NYC hotel. The highlights of the trip were the Tree Lighting at Rockefeller Center, Christmas Show at Radio City and Lady Liberty to name a few. The hotel served our trip well. You are not in your room for most of the day anyway so keep that in mind when booking. As long as the hotel you choose is clean and comfortable with a decent location, you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to NYC”
Reviews.Author: lovetogo1950
Reviews.Content: This hotel was on the subway ride from JFK. Easy three block walk from Columbus circle stop. Quiet rooms even overlooking the street. Short walk to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “There was a MOUSE in my room”
Reviews.Author: Transcend68
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Holiday Inn on 57th street April 10-14, 2011. Our room was less than what we expected. The bathroom had mildew on the ceiling and possibly mold. The front desk staff waas wonderful. They were helpful, friendly, and as pleasant as possible. On Wednesday evening my wife and I were listening to church on the internet, drinking a glass of wine and relaxing when I went into the restroom and as I entered I saw something moving on the floor. I moved the bathroom door and a mouse ran out of the bathroom and into the closet near the bathroom. I immediately called the manager and they had someone respond to the room in about 5 minutes. They moved us to a "better room," and gave us a breakfast voucher but the damage was done. Also, what makes them think that we would want to eat breakfast at their restaurant when we just saw a mouse in our room. The next day was our checkout and they extended it to 3 p.m. I talked to the third manager regarding this situation and her name is Janet. She was absolutely wonderfu; I told her that I did not mind paying for the days we stayed at the hotel, mildew on the ceiling and all, but that I did not feel that we should have to pay for the final night. She told me that she could not comp our room but that she could give us 50% off and take off the movie we ordered the evening before. I think that they should've taken care of our room, I know that I would've if I was the manager. I still can't believe that there was a mouse in our room. Understand that this happened at 11 p.m. so we were inconvenienced and did not get to bed until after midnight. I will never stay at this Holiday Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Paco_en
Reviews.Content: I was there with my wife from Mar 27-Apr 2 and at first I didn't know what to expect after some reviews, but when we got there it was a pleasant surprise, room was clean, and the bed was very comfortable, well at least we are the kind of people who spend all day outside and return to the hotel to get some rest, we used the safe on the main desk since there is no safe on the room, but the staff were always kind and helpful, also locations was fine, near to subway stations and central park.

Reviews.Title: “NO SMOKING ROOM ???”
Reviews.Author: bertieboy44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and it was ok until after 3 nights new guests moved in next door. Woken up at 3a.m. by the smell of cigarette smoke and loud voices coming from next door. Phoned security, who arrived and told them to keep it down. Next night same story, complained at desk in the morning and was told that they could move ME! as it was in the no smoking section of the hotel we declined and asked them to move the offenders next door. A little disappointed with the handling of the situation

Reviews.Title: “As bad as it gets”
Reviews.Author: MKMKMKMK
Reviews.Content: This has been without a doubt the worst hotel experience ever. The whole hotel reeks of stale cigarette smoke. On top of that awful nauseating smell permeates from the bathroom most likely from the rotting installations. There is no showerhead mount so the showerhead only hangs on the hose and squirts randomly in all directions, which probably contributes to the rotting. The staff is indifferent and hostile towards the guests, especially the shift manager. Carpets, furniture and TV are dated and in a need of an update. This is a hotel that gives the Holiday Inn brand a bad name.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good size room, comfortable stay and for new York, price is value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Nic10000
Reviews.Content: We could not find fault with this hotel, bar the need to update it. It is looking tired and threadbare. Great location and reasonable value for money compared to other new York hotels. clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Our family of 8 had a GREAT stay at this hotel - enjoyed it all”
Reviews.Author: SD-DiGirl
Reviews.Content: We went to NYC for my mom's 75th birthday we stayed at this hotel and walked to Times Square about .5 miles every time we went! Its close to the subway as well so location was great and not in all of the action in the midst of Times Square. It was nice, quiet, and clean. Its an older hotel and it shows here and there but it was CLEAN there were absolutely NO BED BUGS they gave our group plenty of clean towels each day. We had adjoining rooms and everything was GREAT. The restaurant was good, its also close to a couple of nice eateries and restaurants - on the adjacent blocks. Its also close to Walgreens and CVS for bottled water & snacks. Wondering if you should stay here - I would do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: Chloe_Buttsavage
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here on our first trip to New York. We had a fantastic view from our room on 17th floor, everything was perfect for our entire stay. I found the staff very friendly and helpful from the second we arrived and they even helped avert disaster when we had problems getting to the airport. Thank you so much, missing you already!

Reviews.Title: “dated but comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: antjeandjim
Reviews.Content: We did like the fairly large bedroom; the location from which you could walk to quite a few of the sights (we do like walking, I hasten to add) and the usual good American service. The bathroom was probably the low point of the stay. Very small, toilet and shower in a room, sink in the corridor before that and all pretty run down but clean. Hey ho, for two nights, it was perfectly good. We went out for breakfast and there is a great breakfast cafe around the corner. Didn't try the food in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Holiday Inn Midtown on 57th Street was awesome”
Reviews.Author: MJSB
Reviews.Content: Traveled to NYC for a conference for work . Arrived on a Monday afternoon and stayed until Thursday. The room was ready on time and very clean. The staff were always helpful and friendly. We had drinks and or ate in the Hotel Lounge for for 3 nights. The Barman remembered what we ordered for drinks after the first night! The owner walked around on several occasions and checked in with people. The location was great. It was definitely great stay - would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pefectly placed”
Reviews.Author: Nattypatty
Reviews.Content: Clean and tidy and very attentive. Large rooms and everythign you needed including free wifi. The walls weren't the thickest but who blames someone for partying in new york! Food was expensive but you don't go to new york to eat in the hotel. Breakfast wasn't included as it was expensive but it gave us the chance to explore other options...well worth it! The hotel had a pool but it wasn't open in March which was a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: global_teach
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights. Fantastic location right by the park with a great view of the Time Warner Centre from my 17th floor room. Gym and pool are free, room is perfectly adequate, the shower could use some touch-ups. My only gripe is that the TV had no remote, and came with a keyboard that seemed not to do a thing. I usually stay in hostels, but all the dorms are booked and staying here only cost a little more than a private room. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location wins every time”
Reviews.Author: JohnGMorpeth
Reviews.Content: Good location,short walk from Columbus Circle, Central Park South,many restaurants close by. Hotel bedrooms could do with refurbishment but rooms are large and beds comfortable. Staff helpful and friendly, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Generally a fine hotel, no major complaints!”
Reviews.Author: KK22_NYC
Reviews.Content: Was slightly apprehensive about staying in this hotel after reading some of the reviews on here, although i shouldn't have worried! Yes, the hotel decor is dated and could do with freshening up but the hotel itself is clean and comfortable. We had a room with two double beds and was large by NYC standards. Plenty of storage room available in the room, and having the sink outwith the bathroom actually came in pretty handy in the mornings. The staff were always very pleasant towards us and had no negative experiences, even with us seeing them at least daily for our safety deposit box. Check in/Check out was seamless and we were able to store our bags on the last day which made it much easier. The only cons to the hotel would be that i would have preferred to have had a safe located within the room and that the walls in the rooms are very thin so could hear the people on either side but didn't cause any major issues.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dippydodaa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very dated and really in need of a make over. The rooms are shabby and very cold, with tired fittings and an 80's look to them. The staff were generally unhelpful and on occasion rude. I paid staff rate for the room here which was almost nothing and i still feel robbed. The location is quite good but otherwise id avoid this place unless you really must stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great service, good location”
Reviews.Author: poppasquash
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in February. Needed a place to sleep in a central location while conducting business all over the city. The Holiday Inn fit the bill. The building shows its age on the outside, but the inside has been nicely refurbished. Lobby is nice, with bar area. Rooms were quite spacious (had 2 doubles) for NYC. Bathroom was tiny, with older fixtures, but refinished tile. Sink is separate from the toilet/shower, which is handy when two or more people are sharing a room. The only issue I had with the room was the peeling plaster on the ceiling. As I wasn't staying long, I didn't complain. It didn't effect my stay in any way, it just looked bad. Beds were very comfortable, and made with high-quality linens. Crisp white duvet covers (always a nice touch, as they are washed for each guest), and four pillows per bed, labeled with little tags "soft" or "firm". I slept very well. I didn't hear lots of noise from other rooms, or the street. (stayed 2 weeknights) Didn't check out the restaurant or rooftop pool, but heard they were decent from other guests. The staff were all VERY helpful, and there's a great concierge in the lobby for show tix, reservations, transportation, etc. Parking is expensive if you come in and out of the attached garage many times, though if you put your car in and leave it there, it's only $25 for each 24-hours. Subway is a 5 minute walk. Lots of decent coffee shops and restaurants in the area, as well. GREAT shopping in Columbus Circle, right around the corner. All in all, a great deal in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR”
Reviews.Author: rochie9928
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the holiday inn midtown for 1 night with my husband, i dont usually write reviews but felt compelled to do so on this occasion check in was fine they were very welcoming to start with. checked in around 2pm went to room first impression not bad, big enough room and the bed was very comfortable. this was really the only good thing i can say about the room. the carpets are very dated and not very clean, the bathroom was ok but to sum it up i felt dirty after the shower!!! but i thought 1 night will have to do, the staff are really not very helpful and had the attitude that they didnt want to be there, the only nicest person there was the lady on the concierge who was very helpful. when we checked out they stored our bags for the day and came back around 6pm, we were pushing for time as it was and when i handed my ticket over they could not find the keys for the cupboard and there was no ergency in there effort to find the keys, by this time i had enough and was glad to leave. I have travelled alot and stayed in all sorts of hotels but i always find if there is great service little things wont seem to matter as much, this hotel however has no customer service and once they have your money for the stay they dont bother.

Reviews.Title: “Not your worst choice, but look for better.”
Reviews.Author: Rynsjhnsn
Reviews.Content: Good location, no denying that. Room rates are okay for the location, and compared to other hotels the rooms are fairly big and clean, although a little outdated. As far as the hotel, not bad for New York. However, the staff here is sub-par. There were a few nice staff members who treated my party with respect (here on business). But on the whole they were rude and unprofessional. You can't have drinks or food in the lobby, and to sit in the lounge you have to buy a drink from the bar. The staff nearly made me dump out my Starbux coffee. I have a few more examples but they are all like this. I travel a lot for a living, and I'm not a high maintenance traveler, but I do appreciate kindness and respect. Looking for an acceptable hotel, this might be a good choice. But who wants a hotel that's just acceptable?

Reviews.Title: “Good place to start a holiday in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Don5617
Reviews.Content: This is a good place to kick off a family holiday in NYC. We spent a week there, discovering Central Park, the Hudson, museums and the northern half of Manhattan. The hotel is a bit on the tatty side in places (its under constant renovation!) but the staff are friendly and there are great places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with this discredit to the Holiday Inn Brand”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerNomad
Reviews.Content: From the lackluster greeting by the hotel reception staff, to the non-functional remote, the non-functioning bedside telephone, the first 7 minutes of my visit were not the best. The bathtub is the tiniest I've ever seen, the carpet is stained and looks like it has been in place forever, the curtains are dingy and the walls have visible dirty spots and what looks almost like mold!n The heater doesn't seem to be working at all but after one interaction with the maintenance staff already for the remote control (the fellow was very nice) I just want to go to sleep. Instead of being in the closet, the ironing board and iron are just hanging on the wall right in the middle of the room, which is just tacky. I can hear the folks next door way too well nand every time their door opens and closed I get startled because it sounds like someone is trying to get into my room. The fact that I'm a Priority Club Platinum member and conceivably my room is an "upgrade" makes me seriously wonder what the other rooms look like! I was supposed to be here for three nights, but I'm checking out tomorrow instead.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: CindyC055
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel! My eyeglasses were stolen from my room by the housekeeping staff and security is rude and does not care. The elevators are so slow and the hallway is so loud it sounds like they are in your room. The beds are very uncomfortable and hard to sleep in. I have traveled all over for business and this is the worst hotel possible. NYC has wonderful choices but this is NOT one of them. The free internet did not work half of the time!!

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, AFFORDABLE, DECENT LOCATION, NO BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: mlenio11
Reviews.Content: When you get a Holiday Inn, you pretty much know what to expect... But here is a quick review of this particular Holiday Inn. HOTEL LOCATION - Good... 15 minute walk to Times Square. It's about half a block off of a pretty crowded street... The particular street it's on is ok, but not great. CUSTOMER SERVICE - Poor / Good... Our check-in experience here was the WORST. We arrived at 10am and they said we could leave bags and check-in around noon. Soon enough the lobby was FULL of people and no one got checked-in until about 4pm because the rooms weren't ready yet. Aside from the check-in issues, the staff were helpful with maps, tips, etc. ROOMS - It was a small room but got the job done... It was your basic Holiday Inn room, plain and simple. Clean. NO bedbugs. Affordable. All in all, I'd consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: shoperopy
Reviews.Content: We had planned a four generation trip to nyc to visit the American Girl Place for my Daughters birthday we used hotwire to make the reservation which does not tell you which hotel you are booking until you pay. After we read the reviews i was worried about staying there with young children some of the reviews stated the hotel was not clean and others had problems with security issues , and unfriendly staff. I AM SO GLAD WE DID NOT CANCEL..... We had a beautiful very clean LARGE room, great comfortable beds. We had to change rooms after the first night because there was a problem with plumbing in the room above us (did not effect our room at all, but to be safe we were moved) the frount desk staff gave us free breakfast coupons for the remander of our stay. The second room was just as beautiful and clean. Overall our stay was very pleasant, kind friendly staff, beautiful clean rooms, There are signs posted in the hallway next to the elevators that state they are making many renovations to the hotel i would say they are doing a great job .I will gladly reccomend this hotel to friends and family and stay there again when we visit in the future.......Great Value.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the money - perfectly adequate.”
Reviews.Author: SouthGaTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel a number of times - on family trips and with student group tours - over the past 6-7 years, and I've found it to be perfectly adequate for my needs. And I've recommended it to friends who share my satisfaction with it. If you're looking for a fine, luxury hotel, this isn't your place. As others have said, it is dated and could use a touch-up; but for the money, it's a good deal, very convenient and perfect if you're in NYC for the city itself. Generally, you're only in the room for a few hours a day - you leave early, return late - for student groups, it's wonderful! A good value, large rooms! It's within a couple of blocks to Central Park, Lincoln Center and Subway access at Columbus Circle - several inexpensive diners in the immediate vicinity - and not too far from Times Square. I've never had an issue with security or maintenance - slept well and felt safe walking in the area, even early mornings and in the evenings. As a frequent NY visitor, I've stayed at the Waldorf, Intercontinental, Hampton Inns, other Holiday Inns - but I always check this location first when shopping for price and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in general, with one exception.”
Reviews.Author: AdamVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to have great service. All problems with the room were dealt with very quickly! The maintenace people arrive at your door within minutes of putting down the phone. Rooms are clean. Its an older building, but carpets are new and I can see other renos are happening. The only problem I had was with the dark haired bespectacled women at the concierge desk. I found her to be rude, offensive and sarcastic. Although she is knowledgeable, she needs to take a course on how to treat clients in a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the price and great location!”
Reviews.Author: jerispeer
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here in July 2010 for 6 nights in a quite spacious 2-bed room. We loved the neighborhood feel and its proximity to the theater district and a large variety of neighborhood cafes (Morningstar/Moonraker/Route 66). Have read recent reviews and am surprised because we absolutely DID NOT experience cockroaches/mice or any other "living" creature. Yes, hotel is a 1970's throwback, but is clean with spacious rooms and the service and front desk were both excellent on our visit. For $169/night, I consider this an excellent New York City deal! Walked to Russian Tea Room, Carniegie Deli, theaters. Would absolutely recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal & Location”
Reviews.Author: Pirocapl
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews about this place and thought I was going to have problems, but I was wrong. Great location (1 block from the subway station), 2 blocks from Central Park, the room was clean, the staff was very polite. Didn't eat at the hotel, so I can't say anything about the food. The parking garage is pretty expensive ($33/day). I didn't drive during my stay in NYC, though, but if you intend to go by car, make sure to look for a cheaper location unless money isn't a problem! There's a great bagel place on the corner (8th Ave) called "Lunch Box", where you can have a real nice breakfast or you can go to the Wholefoods and eat there! Sometimes you can hear the person next door but that wasn't a problem. You can't hear the noise from the street unless you open the window. I was very satisfied with this hotel and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “What a disaster - avoid and take an Express (cheaper and better)”
Reviews.Author: gobitz
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Madison Square garden HI Express, I thought this holiday inn would be even better (usually Holiday Inns are of higher quality than the Express's). However, to my disappointment it was a very ugly hotel, in a residential and pretty boring neighborhood. The hotel reminds me off the Holiday Inn in the Historic District in Philly. The next morning I found out the bathroom walls had foam/soap on them from a previous guest. When I complained to the reception, i was told: you need to move to a different room as we're going to change the carpet. So that's was their way of apologizing. Then I got to the other room, i discovered there was no safe. During my stay at least three times my keyes stopped working and I had to go down again to have them fix the keys. When I arrived in the evening, i was told again that I had to move rooms - thank g-d I was checking out the next day! The only nice thing is the TJMAXX and GAP that are very close and the hotel gives its priority club members a voucher for a muffin/toast/bagel and coffee, tea in the morning (there's no breakfast buffet - only a la carte). The other nice thing was that I received an "all american bkfst voucher" because of the bad experiences i had. It gives you an omelet or fried eggs with ham/sausages, toast, orange juice and tea. Avoid this hotel and take the HI express!!!

Reviews.Title: “DATED, BIT RUNDOWN BUT CHEAP”
Reviews.Author: tobeginwith
Reviews.Content: I would consider this more a 2.5 star hotel. It's dated (circa 1983 decor), a bit rundown (old, stained carpet in room, battered lampshades, stained curtains, no usable outlets, old tube tv) and has noisy front doors that people let slam loudly at all hours. A vacuum cleaner lived outside my room for my entire stay. Plus, there's no in-room safe, which is a standard item in most hotel rooms. When you come right down to it, it's like staying at a Super 8. Still, for the price you likely cannot get a better midtown hotel room in NYC. I paid around $100 a night (albeit it was the first week of January, low tide for hotels!) for a large room with a comfortable bed. Be sure to ask for an inner courtyard room, not street-side, as West 57th can be noisy at all hours. All in all, recommended but don't set your standards too high!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Spacious Room, in a great location with a very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ireaisling79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night and found it fantastic. The hotel staff was very friendly, efficient, and knowledgeable. The room itself was spacious, clean, and quiet. The location was perfect for me as it was accessible to Midtown, Columbus Circle, and Rockefeller Center. The cafe for breakfast in the morning was reasonably priced and very quick. The validated parking for $25 was less than what I've paid in the past and the parking was right there. I didn't have to walk down the block or a few blocks away, it was right outside the door. I would suggest this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Not clean”
Reviews.Author: Tonyyuan
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst holiday inn I've been to. The room is not clean. More importantly, the wall is so thin that I can hear what exactly the next door is doing. The price and location is good though.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS YOU WANT YOUR THINGS STOLEN!!!”
Reviews.Author: sesongbird
Reviews.Content: I had my room broken into and my cellphones and other items were stolen. The hotel security and Hotel Manager were very rude, insensitive, casual and nonchalant about the theft. They begged me NOT to call the police and would not allow me to utilize their phones to call for help. In the end, they ended up blaming me for having my items stolen and would not even compensate or refund me my money.

Reviews.Title: “unclean”
Reviews.Author: leeds67
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 days 10/12/10 to 14/12/10. on the monday morning my wife screamed and jumped on the bed she had found a large cockroach measurerning 2 to 3 inches long and about 1 inch wide (if it was this big there must have been more) she rang reception to get someone to remove it about 3 times. i went to reception to ask what was going on where the receptionist tried to pass me off with a bagel or toast for breakfast , i said no thanks we need somthing a bit more substansual than that and left the hotel for a cafe. my wife and i talked it over and we were still not happy with the money we had spent for this hotel(any hotel should be clean) so that evening i had a word with the manager and he gave me two tickets for the resturant, i ordered a new york steak this ranked as one of the worst i had ever had my wifes meal was no better. but other than this a great place to stay (not)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: poc215
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here now a few times, the most recent in December 2010. The rooms are all large with plenty of room to move around, we had 2 queen beds and the room could easily have taken a 3rd with room to spare. The beds were very comfortable with a choice of pillows. There was a TV, desk, coffee maker (with disgusting coffee provided). We just used the machine to get hot water into the jug and used our own coffee. The bathroom's are very basic and in ok condition, good shower. In previous years the hotel have always been flexible if your checking out late afternoon, this time though we were told this had changed and you need to vacate by 11am. This can make for a long day if you have a night time flight. On checking the in-room guest directory the time stated was noon, so that's when we checked out and nothing was said. Plenty of room to leave luggage and the porters will arrange cars to take you to the airport. (JFK $60). All in all a great value hotel in a great location, there's a supermarket a few blocks on W57th (morton williams) great for snacks and drinks as well as a deli counter and a hot food area if you want something. Would and most likely will stay here again, if just for the spacious rooms and comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Corbrunner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and 3 children (9, 9 and 5 y.o.) from 12/10/2010-12/12/2010. I was anxious given the mixed reviews. I thought the hotel was great. The location is perfect...short walk to Central Park. The lobby is very nice and the room was much more spacious than I expected (by NYC hotel standards). For the super picky the toilet handle had to be held down for about 20 seconds to get it to flush completely and you could occasionally hear sounds from other rooms. For the money, you can't beat this place.

Reviews.Title: “amazing time - hotel perfect”
