Reviews.Author: yorkshiregals
Reviews.Content: Can't believe some of the negative reviews on this site - some people are just serial complainers. I was nervous about our stay here due to the bad reviews - but need not have worried. Hotel is in a good location approx. 10 mins from the Rockerfella Centre also close to Central Park, the tube station is nearby and easy to use and get around. The hotel is NOT a 5 star hotel but is clean, with good sized rooms, very cumfy beds, coffee machine and good hair dryer so don't bother packing one, I would stay here again and recommend it - so that says alot for the hotel. We have travelled all over the world and stayed in various levels of accommodation and I can honestly say my friend & I were both very impressed with The holiday Inn - so if you're due to stay here, don't worry about the negative reviews, there's just no pleasingn some folk - Enjoy New York, we did.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice”
Reviews.Author: timeenchantress
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel..It was really nice ,the staff was awesome !! This wasent our first trip but there are still times when you need help getting around and they were more then happy to assist us !! They even helped us find theatre tickets .

Reviews.Title: “Mildew, noise and pigeons”
Reviews.Author: jw2626
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a business trip. It is high season in NYC and all hotels were priced sky high. I found this hotel online with a very reasonable rate. Location is not too bad....its a 20 minute walk to Times Square, Rockerfeller Center, Carnegie Hall, etc. However, the hotel itself is old, outdated, dirty and unappealing. My room had a horrible mildew smell and turning on the fan makes the room heat up to about 85. So I have the window open even though its 20 degrees outside. Then there are pigeons that have some sort of nest right on the outside wall....you can hear them rustle around. They need to tear this place down.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible unless you like mice”
Reviews.Author: Maryannelilian
Reviews.Content: If you like mice then this would be the place for you . It is a nice hotel for location and it is a nice area but IT HaS MICE I woke up at 1am to find 2 large mice nibbling at my unopened pack of chips and being 15 I woke up my dad ad he called hotel management and it toke them 1 hour to come up and by that time te mice had gone nd there repaonse was you must be seeing things cos rbis hotel does not have mice but the next night I filmed the mice so they has to belevie me . A no go

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and okay - for New York”
Reviews.Author: christycerny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really close to Central Park, but a number of blocks from 5th Avenue, Times square and most other places of interest. Most days we walked to where we wanted to go, even though Times Square is a good fifteen minute walk at a brisk pace. I would recommend using the subway or bus services for getting to the South of Manhattan for the Statue of Liberty, and the site of the WTC. The subway is much faster than the bus service although you miss out on seeing some of the sights on the way. The hotel is pretty basic and currently undergoing some renovation work although we were not disturbed by this. We were however woken during the night to find a large mouse in our room, gnawing at a packet of oats under the bedside table. My girlfriend also got an electrical shock from the tv just by switching it on! We complained the next day and were moved to another room, and given a free breakfast that day. Wow. The rooms are big and the beds are comfy, however, the toilet and shower are very dated and need to be replaced. The toilet in our second room didn't flush very well and the door handle was hanging off on the inside. We didn't bother mentioning this as we were hardly in our room. The rooms were very quiet and we rarely heard other guests although this may have been because we were so tired. The other annoying thing was at busy times you have to wait ages to get a lift as only three lifts serve eighteen floors, each with about thirty rooms. There also always seemed to be a lot of hotel staff were using the lifts to do their jobs along with the numerous workmen renovating the rooms. Breakfast was good, and huge. The staff in the breakfast room were helpful and quick, as were the bell and reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Rude front desk staff/great restuarant staff”
Reviews.Author: Tisambas
Reviews.Content: The first time that I called I should have known better. I stated that I had a reservation and they man responded, "AND???" We were given a renovated room that looked nice, but smelled smokey. It was warm out for November and our room was very, very hot. I called the front desk and they told me that the air was off and that everyone was too hot. They sent up a tiny fan. I asked the man who brought it if I could have 2 fans given the size and he said in a gruff manner, "they tell me to bring you a fan so I brought one!" and he stomped off. Our toilet would not flush so I asked the next morning for someone to fix it while we were out. We returned 12 hours later and found that we had no water in the toilet. I called the front desk and the woman snapped at me, "I did my part, I can't help it if the engineer did not do his part!" I asked if I could have a room with a workign toilet and she called me back about 20 mins later telling me that I could move. I had to wait another 45 minutes for a bell man to help me move all of my belongings. The new room was also renovated but had burn holes in the carpet. The chair's covering was also shreding over the arms, and the tiles from the wall were coming off around the bathtub. The beds were comfortable. I would not stay there again due to the rude hotel staff. Teh restaurant staff on the other hand were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Perozee
Reviews.Content: From 27th to 29th of Novmber Room 326 + Staff very freindly and helpful + Room was clean - Found mildew in bathroom (reason for low score) - Noisy b/c of street (3rd floor) and hallway + Price was right (179$ a night for 4 people) +/- A healthy walk from Time Square, Macy's, ... ( +++ for us) + Daily news included 45$ limo ride from hotel to LGA (tip included) 60$ limo ride from LGA to hotel 45$ fix fare w/Yellow cab

Reviews.Title: “ok but never again”
Reviews.Author: bexie123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn midtown NY with my mum and nan. After a long flight from Heathrow, we arrived at the hotel at 3am UK time (10pm local) to find that our room, with two double beds was not avaliable, eventhough we had paid extra and in full proir to our arrival for this particular room. They offered us a room with a king bed and a pull out as an alternative, however I felt that this was unacceptable, especially when we had paid an extra premium for this particular room in the first place. The woman behind the desk was rude and unapologetic, she said we should speak to the manager who was equally unhelpful, Yudith Fleary, who simply said that the room is not avaliable. Funnily enough, after some persistance, a room with two doubles miraculously became available, but it was being cleaned and we would have to wait 45 minutes for the room. So we opted for that and ended up waiting over an hour with 3 drinks voucher for the hotel bar as compensation. The hotel in general is in desparate need of renervation and the walls are paper thin, so if you want a peaceful nights sleep after a long day sight seeing and shopping, this hotel is definately not for you. The hotel is good value for the loaction, close to colombus circle subway, central park and a 20 minute wak to times square.

Reviews.Title: “Just a place to put your head..”
Reviews.Author: gemzii89
Reviews.Content: My first trip to New York, and I cant really complain about the hotel itself, The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable, the bedroom could of done with abit of an update, but for 4 nights it was adequate enough. We were on the 7th floor and heard no traffic noise whatsoever, so a good peaceful nights sleep. The restaurant in the hotel was nice, but just as expensive as other restaurants around anyway. The location was ok, central park being the closest attraction and about a 10-15 minute walk to times square. The staff were miserable, and probably the most unhelpful I have ever experienced. The use of lockers were free (which was great). All in all, Yes if I absolutely had too then I would stay at this hotel again..However Id probably like to find a hotel that was a little closer to where it was all happening and staff with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Average room but broken lavatory facilities!”
Reviews.Author: fiffipapiljotten
Reviews.Content: First impression was an average room with two queen size beds. Clean beds but certainly not a flawless floor. The bathroom was a mess! Mould growing, smell horrible all taps were leaking, the shower only gave very hot water and the toilet sewer was not functioning so the toilet flooded every time you tried to flush it. Personnel was nice and friendly but really the only reason to use this hotel is the location - close to Central Park and fairly close to subway. It is what you see - nothing extra to find here!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, spacious rooms, better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: LittleAngelRach
Reviews.Content: Needed a 'middle of the road' hotel to stay in New York as we were hitting the shops and sightseeing. This is central, reasonably priced, busy and clean hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean with ironing board, hair dryer, tv and keyboard and obviously a en suite. Near the lobby there is a gift shop, bar (reasonably priced), a few computers with internet access and concierge desk near reception. We used the concierge a couple of times and they were extremely helpful. We even met the owner on the day we were leaving! He's a friendly, pleasant man. The only negative thing I would say is in our room the curtains were for decoration purposes only and wouldn't close. On the window was only a net curtain and I found it hard to sleep with the lights shining in from buildings opposite. Overall it was excellent value and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Staff could be friendlier.”
Reviews.Author: Rob0203
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to US and NY, we had heard stories about NY room sizes so was pleasantly surprised, the size of the room was fine Location is a bit far away from Times Square and shopping- macy's, bloomingdales etc. you need to taxi it or subway. There is a subway just up the road so no problems with transport around the city. Front desk staff not very friendly, there was a problem with our booking (they couldn't find it), eventually we got our room, after travelling for nearly 24 hrs from Australia we really needed to crash. Overall hotel was fine, but staff need to be a bit friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: lucyupinthesky
Reviews.Content: We were three people and stayed in a wide smoker bedroom with two queen beds; room and bathroom were clean, with hairdrier, iron, coffee maker, tv, telephone, radio alarm and on floor ice machine (but window curtains were light and filtered a lot of light!); the staff was nice. They want only advance payment and we paid 1400 euros for 6 nights with breakfast coupon (through hotels.com). The breakfast coupon is worth 20$ per room (egg, bacon, toast and tea or coffee is about 10$ per person), the food was good. There is free (but slow) wi-fi connection in rooms and lobby + three pc in the lobby with internet and printer with fee (1 dollar for four minutes!). The restaurant is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner, there is a bar just off the lobby, a pharmacy/souvenir shop open until 10p and a pool on the rooftop that we didn't visit. One block away there is a deli open 24h. The hosts were quite all American or Japanese. It is located two block eastward (5 minutes) from columbus circus subway and central park and 15 minutes on foot to fifth avenue (tiffany, abercrombie, apple, etc). Good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Refurb and soon”
Reviews.Author: kny666
Reviews.Content: Nice size rooms but have never seen a hotel need a refurb like this one, Sockets hanging off walls, coming back to Ny in 2012 but not here.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: vonschwind
Reviews.Content: I needed a cheap room in Manhattan for a last-minute business trip, and it was Marathon weekend, so prices were through the roof. Through Priceline, I wound up at this hotel for one night, and knowing it was only 3 stars, I was nervous. At check-in, the clerk barely spoke to me, no smile, and the lobby was mobbed with families, so my fear increased. However, once I got to the room, all was fantastic. Big sunny windows (view not special, but the light was great). HUGE space-- way above average for NYC. Bathroom and toiletries great, all very comfortable. During the day, the family in the adjacent room were very loud, and I could hear every word of their conversation, but there was no noise at night (maybe they had left or gone to bed early). The location was further west than I had hoped (my business was all on the Upper East Side), but still decent-- only a block and a half from a subway entrance, and I walked most places. The price was absurd, but I think that was a factor of the Marathon, plus New York in general, but at least I had a place, and it was very comfortable. Not sure why this doesn't qualify for at least 3.5 stars, since it seemed nicer in some ways than 4-star places I've used in NYC on past visits. At check-out, the clerk assisting me was very friendly, making up for the cold reception on the previous day.

Reviews.Title: “A little off the beaten path but we all liked it!”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth57Elkridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for its proximity to the theatre on 53rd Street and Central Park. This hotel probably has not been updated since the 1970's but we choose it for where it was. Yes, it wasn't the most modern place, but we had a nice stay and there are a lot of good things here: spacious rooms with much space between beds and other furniture, excellent concierge, convenient bar located within steps of the reception desk, Gotham Cafe breakfast. It was easy to get to our show and we were able to get to Central Park easily through beautiful Columbus Circle. Did not have to take any cabs and plenty of people on the streets at night. Lots of great ethnic restaurants nearby on 9th. For what we paid and what we received, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: lisamarie3858
Reviews.Content: Myself and my mum stayed in this hotel in august, for 2 weeks. It's in a great location for central park, times square, basically everything you want to see in New York is in walking distance! The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the guy at the information desk... he was amazing!! The hotel likes to get a copy of your creadit for any extra charges you may have, but I don't have a card. they made no big deal about it and said it was fine (not like some other US hotels i've stayed in) The rooms were lovely, spacious, very clean rooms and bathrooms. The swimming pool on the roof, incredible. Just what you need in the city heat! I saw some reviews about how terrible this place was, seriously people it's fantastic. I have absolutely no complaints about this hotel and will totally be back next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: DianeP49
Reviews.Content: We used our Holiday Inn points to stay here, so, of course it was a great value for us to stay here. The location was very good, so we were able to walk to many of the local sites like Times Square, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall. We were just a few blocks away from Columbus Circle, Central Park and the Plaza Hotel. The room was very clean and very spacious for NYC. We had desk to work at, and a comfortable chair to sit in while watching tv....not that we did a lot of either! Our bed was very comfortable, but after walking all day, we could have slept on a bed of nails. We were on the 18th floor (the top floor) so street noise was no problem. In fact, the street was a pretty quiet one as NY streets go. We found some great bars and restaurants right around the hotel. Kennedy's, right down the street, is a very nice Irish pub. Around the corner, is a great "Cheers" bar called Linkin Park---$3 drafts, great burgers, great wings. We walked the 6 or 7 blocks to the Carnigie Deli, which is a "must-do" for any NYC visitor. We had a coffeemaker in our room, always a plus....also had free wi-fi. The hotel restaurant, Gotham Cafe, was a bit over-priced for average food......I was charged $5 for a small glass of cranberry juice. The lobby bar was also over-priced, charging $4.60 for a diet coke. And, the mixed drinks were very weak, not a good pour at all! They do have a great concierge service. The woman we worked with was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. All in all, we enjoyed our stay there and would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: SydneyKate08
Reviews.Content: They say you get what you pay for and that is very true with the Holiday Inn on 57th. We stayed here for a week in April 2010 and while we loved the location and that we could walk anywhere we wanted with ease, the hotel is old, run down and the staff are the rudest we've ever come across in our years of travelling. If you want a cheap(ish) hotel in a good location, this is the place, but don't expect anything too fancy or clean. Check out more details and photos at my blog http://excellentadventure.posterous.com/

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location!!”
Reviews.Author: RomaGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is situated in Midtown Manhattan it was very quiet and comfortable. The central location was ideal for the various toutist locations eg Central Park, Rockefeller Centre, St Pat's, and subway station Columbus Circle, to easily access other New York locations.. Staff in the hotel were very firendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Crowthorne4
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok. We got a good rate and knew we would not be spending much time in the hotel so went for the economy Holiday Inn. The room was a reasonable size with coffee machine and two queen beds. The whole place was tired and needed refurbishment. There was a plaster on the wall of the bathroom that a previous "guest" had kindly left us. It was never cleaned off during our visit which says a lot! Its position was ok, depends what you want but I would probably aim for closer to Times Sq next time though you could walk it in 20 minutes or so.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Fine”
Reviews.Author: legendaryviano
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel, in view of many of the reviews on this website. We stayed for four nights at the end of September / beginning of October as a prelude to a tour of New England. The hotel was booked for us by the tour company so was not chosen by us. When i consulted this website I was horrified by some of the comments made about it, and we arrived there with some trepidation. We need not have worried at all. The hotel is being refurbished at present, and I feel sure that the public areas will benefit from this. There are at present apology notices prominently displayed. The rooms however are spotlessly clean with large and very comfortable beds. The hotel is ideally situated, in a safe and pleasant area, and is very accessible by public transport. It is in easy walking distance of Broadway, 5th Avenue, Central Park. and the Lincoln Centre, and their are excellent restaurants within easy walking distance. The breakfast was fine, and promptly and politely served. All the staff were helpful and friendly This was not the best hotel that we stayed in on our 14 day tour, but it certainly deserves better reviews than than many on this site. If you are booked in here by your tour company, please don't worry..

Reviews.Title: “Darkly lit, damp, and overpriced again”
Reviews.Author: XRD
Reviews.Content: It's >70F out, raining, and the room air conditioners are off? Mngmnt cited a state law, yet the lobby is air conditioned. The rooms ($150 two years ago) are now $280/nt. I sort of expected air conditioning. I also believe this HI is showing it's age since my last visit and review a few years ago.The common areas like hallways, etc. are missing baseboards, carpet is pretty dirty, and the elevators were on the fritz yesterday. The bathrooms are darkly lit, but you still can't beat the location. Regardless, I'll be looking for another $280/nt hotel when I return next month.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Limnull
Reviews.Content: Really uninspired stay at the Holiday Inn. For about $50 more a night, I could've stayed at the W and avoided: * Hearing every conversation in the room next door, thanks to paper thin walls * The flies, mosquitoes, and moths that roamed my room * The mysterious non-mosquito bites I woke up with this morning * The cigarette smoke that filled the hall Not going to stay here again. It was cheap(ish), and it showed.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, large room”
Reviews.Author: MNfast11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and didn't have any major issues with the hotel. We were on the 4th floor and both my friend and I slept well and never heard any other guests. The room was pretty large for just the two of us. The hotel was in a quieter neighborhood, which was nice. Closest subway station we used was Columbus Circle which was 2-3 blocks away, but we walked down to Times Sq. most of the time. Overall, it was a fine hotel that suited our needs fine.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT LEAVE ANY MONEY OR VALUABLES IN THE ROOMS!”
Reviews.Author: howardhughes456
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated, the breakfast is good but several of my students had their stay spoilt because they complained of large sums of money ($800.00 altogether )and electronic items having disappeared in their rooms. We reported the thefts to the security who said he was going to check who had entered the rooms and he concluded that my own students had, which made the students themselves potential culprits! I was very interested to read the review of another guest who also complained of some items having been stolen in his room. I think the management should take this problem very seriously. Having paid for the rooms we expect them to be safer than down in the street!I have come to the conclusion that there must be thieves operating in this hotel and they had better catch them if they want to keep their clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Just Correct”
Reviews.Author: Ahhnn
Reviews.Content: the room was not too small and quite silent, since we were looking backwards. The linen was white and clean, with a selection of pillows. The overall decoration is not beautiful, but if you dont have too much expectations, it is bearable. However the hallways had an unpleasant air freshener fragrance. And I would have loved to enjoy the pool, but it was only open on 'office hours'. So that was inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly OK if you don't have high expectations”
Reviews.Author: gsl33
Reviews.Content: This hotel is housed in an very large, unattractive building, and is showing its age, as soon as you walk into the lobby you know what you are in for: shabby (un)chic, average service, average facilities, and average rooms. It also helps to know that this hotel is frequented by tour groups, especially from Eastern Europe, and this will give you an idea of the overall standard to expect. Rooms Quite large for NYC, and are what you would expect - serviceable, with private facilities - but showing their age. Additionally, as mentioned by previous reviewers, the air conditioning is very loud, and in my room, condensation from the air con was so extreme that it saturated the nearby carpet on a daily basis. To their credit, the staff were concerned, and tried to fix the problem, but unfortunately to no avail. Also note that there are no safes in the room, and only a limited number of safety deposit boxes at reception – there was nothing available on any day of my 9 day stay, so I had to carry around all my valuables whilst sightseeing (not ideal). It was also inconvenient when I used the hotel pool, as I had to take my valuables poolside and keep a constant look out when swimming. As mentioned by other reviewers, there are ice machines in the hotel, but not on every floor, and if you are unlucky enough to have one outside your room (as I was !) you’ll get noise all night long - not only of the very loud ice maker itself, but also from the slamming of the fire stairs doors as people go up and down to use the machines. Be warned ! That said, there are two big bonuses with this hotel: 1 - location 2 – rooftop pool Location in midtown Manhattan is within easy walking distance to Central Park South / Columbus Circle, 5th Avenue, and several subway lines. Additionally, the street outside the hotel is reasonably quiet for central Manhattan, and there are numerous eating places close by (Broadway / Times Square is about 10 minute’s walk south of the hotel). Very convenient location. The other plus with this hotel is the rooftop pool, and it’s a real treat to be up there swimming with a view of the skyline, but be warned that it does get very crowded, and it can be difficult to find somewhere to sit, let alone find a reclining lounge chair. The other negative is that, bizarrely, the hotel closed the pool every day at 6.00pm, which is just when you want to use it the most, after a hot day of sightseeing !!! All in all, I can’t say that this hotel is great value for money, but you are going to pay through the nose for any half decent hotel in Manhattan (especially in Midtown) and the hotel itself is quite serviceable, just set your expectations to that of a typical Holiday Inn – don’t expect too much, and that’s just what you get !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Views, Easy Stay”
Reviews.Author: zeefla
Reviews.Content: Room was big enough for the two of us, we had a nice view of the city from our window and the bed was really comfortable. We were a bit afraid of bed bugs raiding the city, but this hotel did NOT have any...very comforting to know that. The only set back at this hotel, no local TV stations, just all cable stations...which was tough to watch Sunday night football in the room. The bar did have the game downstairs. Service was friendly in all aspects. Location is near Columbus Circle and Central Park. Really was a great location in midtown. The hotel is in the middle of fixing up, so, some wallpaper torn off the wall in the hallways, but it didn't really matter to us as long as it was quiet, which it was.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: zusan7
Reviews.Content: Very tired when landed, and upon getting out of lift to go to our room we could instantly smell damp, they were in the middle of renovations we were told. The workers took the old wallpaper off the corridor on our level and the wall was just full of mold, and they just covered it up again with new wallpaper, very botchy.. and smelly, and no safe in rooms, but quiet and we weren't in much, close to everything and good restaurants near by...

Reviews.Title: “Fair enough”
Reviews.Author: oaviram
Reviews.Content: We stayes for 5 nights, in a two double bed room (2 adults and 2 chldren). The air condition wasn't working and after a small argument - we switched rooms. Hotel was under renovation so the coridors looked like in an eastern europe hotel after the war. Room was big and comfi The subway station is a block a way. there are some resturants in the area. Central park is 2 minutes away, but times square is quite far. However - paying 390$ a night is a bit expensive...

Reviews.Title: “Expectations met at the Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: kitty206
Reviews.Content: There's something to be said for the consistency of Holiday Inns: a large, clean room, and with the expected amenities. But to also pair it with a good location, is more of a plus, so I'm actually adding a star. Central Park and Columbus Circle are just a few blocks away--which is great, transportation-wise. Good access to the subway and taxis abound in Columbus Circle--though, finding a cab right outside the hotel was never a problem. Free Wi-Fi was also great to have. The hallways are showing their wear and ice and vending machines aren't on every floor. After reading some of the reviews, I was worried about the rooms, but the one we were in was recently renovated and just fine. Air conditioning was a little loud. Housekeeping staff was great, keeping rooms clean and towels and linens stocked. No complimentary breakfast here, but there are plenty of places to eat within walking distance. This was also one of the few trips where I'd actually want use of a room safe, but here there are none. Safety deposit boxes are listed as being available from the Front Desk, but I'm reading that they might not always be available. Front desk, baggage (note they charge a nominal amount per bag to hold luggage), housekeeping and concierge staff were all good, no problems. All in all, nice stay in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: bobncar
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Midtown the week of September 24th. Booked with Priceline but only saved about $20/night. Selected this hotel because I wanted to be within walking distance of the theater district as well as the meeting place for the Sex and the City (near the Plaza Hotel) and only needed a place to shower, dress and rest my head. For my purposes this hotel worked very well. We bussed into Port Authority and took a cab to the hotel - only cost $4 plus tip and very quick trip. Initially they were going to put us in a smoking room stating that since we booked with a 3rd party we would get what was left and the hotel was pretty full. When I explained that I didn't want my pregnant daughter to be in a smoking room they immediately responded and found us a non-smoking one. When we got to our room we found the air conditioning turned all the way up but the room was warm. On our way out to the theater we stopped at the desk and complained about the air conditioning. After we retuned from the theater and were in our PJ's we noticed there was a message on our phone stating that they were unable to fix the air conditioning but they would be willing to change our room. Since we were ready for bed we stayed where we were and they changed our room the next day. The second room was better but still not as cool as it should have been with the air conditioner on max. On our way to the theater the next night we asked the concierge for a suggestion for somewhere to go for appetizers and drinks prior to our show. He sent us to the Glass House, 2 streets over from the theater. It has a modern upscale look and both drinks and appetizers were good. Like the fact that he said " Here's where I'll send you" rather than giving us a list of places to have to think about. On the way out, the bus boy in the lobby was very helpful with our bags. .This hotel was adequate for our needs, having all the basics as well as comfortable beds. It's not fancy and has areas that are being renovated but nothing major. No refrigerator in the room and an ice machine is not on every floor (had to go one floor down). Overall I would say this Hotel is in a good location unless you want to be right in the heart of the theater district where you will pay much more. Staff was responsive. I would stay there again as I would rather spend more money doing and dining than on a fancy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay as long as you don't mind losing your possessions.”
Reviews.Author: JohnnusMackinnus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Dec 2009, first arrival thoughts were that the décor and overall feel of the place was a little late 70s, which was a little disappointing as the rooms aren't super cheap or anything, The room was fine, small but functional, bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean and functional. No safe in the room though, turns out that;s quite important at this hotel. The only major gripe i really had with the hotel was that on the last day of my stay, things went missing from my room, a brand new pair of Nike shoes & various electrical items from the bathroom (shaver, toothbrush, nose hair trimmer, etc.) now the mentality of someone who wants a second hand electric toothbrush or nose hair trimmer escapes me, but nonetheless I was not happy. Very glad I had taken my laptop out with me and my digital SLR too & that I never leave my passport in my room. I went downstairs to the lobby and went to reception to report the theft, they seemed completely uninterested and sent me over to a chap at another desk whom they said was security. This seemed to be the guy responsible for keeping the riff raff out at night, and had the air of a nightclub bouncer. I told him what happened, he seemed incredulous that anyone would want to steal things from my room and asked if I was sure I hadn't just misplaced them, and said he couldn't really do anything about it until his boss came back, that night 12 hours later. He also incredulously claimed that housekeeping may have thought I was leaving a day early and thus threw all my possessions away. The way he said this seems like he may have told people that before and had them buy it, he actually said, "you didn't leave your new shoes anywhere near the bin did you? as they might have thought you wanted to throw them out." I informed him I did not, that they were in a new Nike box and as I was leaving in 4 hours there was not really a lot I could do as he seemed quite unwilling to help. All of the things he said seemed like tried and tested ways to get out of actually doing anything about the theft. He gave me a telephone number to call and check what the status was and see about compensation, or finding out who entered the room (all electronic key locks should have a list of people who have entered available) I called back on the evening I was asked to (stayed up until 4am UK time to be able to) and was told that the head of security was out and couldn't speak to me. 6 further calls at various times when I was told he would be available, to the number given, reception and finally messages on his voice-mail all went unreturned. I am not impressed at all with the way I was treated by the Holiday Inn staff, and would never stay with them again. Have told all my friends to avoid like the plague and would say the same to anyone else thinking of staying there, there are far far better places in Manhattan for the same price or less. Ruined the trip tbh. John

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at The Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: love022
Reviews.Content: The hotel smelled a bit molly,no bath robes were in the room, no refridgerator, no safty deposit box and when we were trying to rest we can hear when toilets were being flushed from the rooms beside us or above us, and the AC was too noisey. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very spaceous, we only ate BKF at the hotel and it was great I had the pancakes every morning. We will be back and do recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: jools025
Reviews.Content: hotel was clean, queen size bed which was amazing and made for us every day, room cleaned every day, staff friendly and helpful if needed, coffee and tea was available every day, perfect place loved it and will definatly book to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Not great, wouldn't go back. b Clean room, breakfast expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Melat104
Reviews.Content: Not easy to get to from JFK with luggage. First room was a bit grotty. The door had been broken down at some point and all the locks were broken. Settling down to sleep and we were told we had to move rooms. No explanation. Wallpaper in new hallway was falling off which made it feel unkempt. Rooms were big, no safe in the room, but safety deposit available. There for two nights but the room never felt like home. A few nice eateries nearby, corner shop too. Central park close. Tube/metro not far away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room for the price.”
Reviews.Author: OttawaTraveler_10
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for four days through Hotwire and had a very good experience. We arrived half an hour before check-in, and our room was ready (granted it was a weekday). The staff were very polite at the front desk. The room was modern, clean, and the air conditioning worked great, even though it was 80 degrees out for the first two days we were there. The cleaning staff were very friendly, and kept the room very clean during our stay. The location was fantastic - near Carnegie Hall, the subway, and easy walking distance to Central Park. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: mandyjaynev
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel with Virgin and then checked out trip advisor and got rather worried as some people were making negative comments about the Holiday Inn at West 57th Street. We decided that there's no pleasing some people and we should make our own judgement. Location - great for Columbus Circle Subway station (less than 10 mins away), 12 min walk from Central Park and 15 mins from Times Square. Room - this was large, clean (spotless mattress, bedding, pillows etc), aircon was very efficient, bathroom clean and had towels changed daily. I asked for an extra pillow and within 10 minutes it was in our room. To be honest though, New York is such a busy place and if, like most people you are there for a few days (or 6 days like us) then the hotel is just a base, rather than somewhere you spend very much time in. The rooftop swimming pool is nice, but only opens 10am - 6pm so if you are out all day then there's no option to use it. The gift shop is useful for bits and pieces. We didn't eat in the restaurant as there are plenty of places to eat. We used the Brooklyn Diner just down the road, and often went to the kiosk just inside Central Park and brought coffee and croissants from there and ate 'Al Fresco'. We stayed in the North Tower of the hotel and we noticed that in the South Tower, decorating work was deing done an it generally looked a bit 'worn' . There were notices apologising for the work in progress though. I would definitely recommend to friends. If you are looking for top class luxuxy, this is not a luxury hotel, but we found it to be clean, comfy and the staff were very welcoming. As for noise from other guests - we were so tired at the end of each day, that we were not disturbed by any door banging as we fell straight off to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Fair price and good location”
Reviews.Author: Dave4422
Reviews.Content: I stayed with three friends for two night at the Holiday Inn. Although we booked a non-smoking room, we got a smoking room. We tried to change the room, but apparently no other room was available. Otherwise, we were very happy with the accommodation. The price for the rooms seemed very reasonable (especially for Manhattan). The hotel is situated close to Central Park and Columbus Circle, where you find all public transport you need.

Reviews.Title: “Large, spacious room, good location”
Reviews.Author: Whareroa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in August 2010. Our room was large for NYC standards, clean and in a great midtown location. Air conditioning unit in our room was quite noisy. Overall, it's a comfortable place to return to after a busy day sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: alphacentaurus
Reviews.Content: I was happy with my stay in New York City. The hotel was comfortable, clean, centrally located and at a reasonable price. I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A little Mouse without Cloggs”
Reviews.Author: eurocrawler
Reviews.Content: Annoyances: First the Mouse. We had a mouse in the room the front desk was called and they sent a man to look for it. He was unsucessful. He did block the outlet pipe of the air conditioner. On the mouse's second apperance we called the front desk and they sent the man again, there was a small hole in the wall which he blocked and put some poison in. On the mouse's third apperance he scuttled out under the room door into the hallway and we blocked the door with a towel. I have to say that this was the only sighting of said mouse for the rest of the stay. I will also add that on each occasion that we called the front desk they DID offer to change the room and that we could call down and change the room if we changed our minds. The televison remote control was not working, we told the desk and there was a new one when we returned that evening. The Upside. Now the rest of the stay. We arrived before check in time and the room was ready we asked for a smoking room and got one. We found the air conditioning fine it was cold there is more roar from opening the room window in Manhattan. There is a manned bell hop desk for those security concerns that many people have. As the flight was in the evening we left our luggage in the luggage room which is locked and your are given a ticket for the bell hop arranged a town car to take us to the airport for a flat $75 which was far cheaper than the fixed rate taxi after add on's from Liberty Airport. It has been described a tired, yeah well its a bit tatty in places, but its in the midtown area so nearly everthing that is on the tourist trail is nearby failing that the Columbus Circle Subway Station takes you to the parts not nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, great location & rooftop pool.”
Reviews.Author: smithers58
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in two rooms -the rooms were some of the biggest we have ever stayed in - two double beds and space to walk around each with the usual other desk, table etc. The a/c was great in one room, just adequate in the other and it was 100 degrees outside. One of three elevators was faulty all the time and the doors would not open when it reached the ground floor - for someone who is claustrophobic it was a nightmare! The bar was completely overpriced a($8 for a very small glass of average wine) and boring -only three people in it one night. Free ice on the corridor and ice buckets in the room was great. There was a rooftop pool which was brill - we all enjoyed the cooling off and the fantastic view. The hotel (57th st & 9th Av)is only two blocks south from 59th st subway and quiet by NY standard at night time. Morning Star Diner up the road on the corner is great for breakfast - just like being on a NY film set! All in all, a great place to stay in mid NY.

Reviews.Title: “beat expectation”
Reviews.Author: billsterbill
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel with very low expectations and high trepidation. After reading the previous reviews and getting the hotel on Priceline i was nervous. I called in advance and found that i had a double bed smoking room. i argued for a non smoking room. i was assigned a wheelchair non smoking king bed. When i arrived, i found the staff to be very good, very responsive. I got nervous again when i saw "pardon our appearance signs everywhere. when we got to our floor i was horrified as the wall paper was pealing and a prminent smell of glue. Turns out they had just replaced the carpet in the whole wing and had to remove wall paper. The room was huge, new wallpaper, clean bathrooms all updated. i was very very pleased. Really beat my lowered expectations. Best part was that i was travelling with an infant and i had a very late flight. I went to check out and they offered 11. then they offered me 2 if i joined the club for free.. then when i went back to the manager she gave me 3 and then when i told her that i thought the hotel was better than what i saw on Trip Advisor, she gave me 5pm.. i have never gotten that late! Really beat my expectation..

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for rooms with Queen bed. They...”
Reviews.Author: AdTrosa
Reviews.Content: Watch out for rooms with Queen bed. They are situated next to the elevators and you hear them all night. I got a room like that although I asked for a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could do with a bit of an update.”
Reviews.Author: Holiday-Lady25
Reviews.Content: The hotel had everything but was starting to look tiried and in need of an update. It seemed in a good location that meant you could reach all the major areas withing the city. The food was good and was brought to quick and hot. All staff were friendly and happy to help you.

Reviews.Title: “okay, thats all.”
Reviews.Author: laurose
Reviews.Content: i'm seventeen and went with my college as a summer residential for 5 days, we travelled with continental airline, the flight was delayed and a simple 7 and a half out flight turned into a ten hour flight due to the ash cloud in iceland, when we eventually landed we was all so excited yet exhausted, we was in the big city, when we got to the hotel we all expected a bit more, most of the staff were friendly and helpful, some of them was really rude, there wasn't much seating in the reception area and when we sat on the steps etc waiting to meet our tutors we was told we wasn't allowed to sit there and we wasn't allowed to wait around in the reception area, the rooms we're very minimal, small TV, uncomfy beds, small bathroom not a good view, however it didn't really ruin it as we was rarely in the room, the phones there were ridiculous, and the $5 phone cards, they lasted for an amount of 2 minutes approximately, wouldn't recommend them, the hotel is quiet central to times square, bloomingdales, fast food resturants, and the pier, which was excellent as we went on the circle line cruise, i would recommend this hotel but all i would say is you get what you pay for, if you know you'll spend a lot of time in the hotel spend more on a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: mummmmmm
Reviews.Content: There were 5 of us staying for 3 nights. I asked for 2 rooms, non smoking, connecting rooms and as quiet as possible. I’m pleased to say I got all I asked for. Quick and efficient check in and out. Very pleasant staff. As said many times the lifts are old but work. The corridor to our room was a bit grim. But the rooms were great. Good size, clean and comfortable. We weren’t expecting a view but to our left we could see the sky scraper which looked great at night. The best bit was we didn’t over look a road so nice and quiet. Good air con but the internet was so slow it wasn’t worth using. We had breakfast in the hotel both days and it was good. Location was great. We could walk to Central Park, Times Square and Rockefeller centre ect. We felt very safe at all times of day. We didn’t want to walk too far in the evening because we were tired and had a 10 year old who didn’t want to go too far. The restaurant close by were great. Georgios Country Grill (9th) – tasty burger and pizza, good local feel, 5 ate for less than $70. Kennedys on 57th – Irish bar with restaurant at the back. More of a restaurant with good food and service. Ralphs Italian on the corner of 9th and 56th. Very good food. Bistro style but posher than the others and more expensive but we had a great meal and a lovely evening. I’m glad we stuck to this area to eat and there were more restaurants to try.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: strawberrycity
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor is an invaluable resource at our internet fingertips but most hotels get some stinking reviews and, with the Holiday Inn Midtown 57th Street being no exception, I arrived at the hotel on our first night in the USA feeling a little apprehensive. The lobby was busy busy but no problem with that and the check in staff member was friendly. The lifts were a bit rubbish though. The corridor to our room on the 7th floor was in need of refurb and smelt a little damp so my heart rate did rise a little on the way to the double room but, to great relief all round, it was absolutely fine. The room was spacious, clean and quiet, The a/c was good if a little noisy but hey with NY having temps of 103 degrees - cold but noisy air is fine! The bedding was stylish and the beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was okay too - with a family of four we preferred the basin being outside the bath and loo area. The location of the hotel is a plus point and we made good use of the subway at Columbus Circle. There are plenty of places to eat in the locale too. All in all, the Holiday Inn 57th Street is a good solid hotel - not staggeringly wonderful but, with Manhattan hotel rates, it's certainly bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Needs Updating.”
Reviews.Author: smile2000star
Reviews.Content: PROS: This hotel is in a great location. It is very close to a Subway stop and Times Square is a mear 20-25 minute walk away. The rooms are very spacious. CONS: The hotel itself, however is nothing special. It is very run down and needs much improvement. There are stains in the carpet and mildew on the ceiling. We requested a non-smoking room but there weren't any available. So our room smelled of smoke. Also, the pool was busy with private functions so we were unable to use it. We were also unable to get a corkscrew or wine glasses in our room (which are things that you cannot bring in your carry-on bag) The desk staff was very unhelpful, some of them didn't even speak good English. Find the stairs, the elevators take forever. OVERALL: Stay here to be close to everything, but don't expect luxury or anything special.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Ryan.W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pure Holiday Inn and you'll know what that means if you're a Priority Club member. Sure there were some problems: our hotel corridor was being painted and thus the strong smell, the elevators are small european-style, the bar was lame. But on the flip side it is a secure, well-located hotel in a nice neighborhood with a comfortable bed. The hotel staff does a great job considering the bombardment of humanity they handle in any given day. Tip: the south tower is quieter.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!! RUN”
Reviews.Author: netgeek
Reviews.Content: First off I would like to say that I am a fair reviewer. If you look at my other reviews you'll notice that I am fairly generous. However, I need to be brutally honest about this hotel. I cannot believe it is affiliated with the Holiday Inn!! I was assigned this hotel through priceline. When I arrived I was informed that I was in a smoking room (despite having called in earlier requesting a nonsmoking room). I asked if there could be a switch to a non-smoking room and was RUDELY told by the manager and front desk clerk that it would not be possible. There were no non-smoking rooms available. In addition, I would need to wait for a smoking room to be become available. I come back two hours later to check in. A really nice guy helped me this time and offered me a non-smoking room right away. I was very gracious for this. When I arrived, the room was in a rough condition. There was writing on the wall, the mirrors were dirty and the bathroom was DISGUSTING!!! The bathroom smelled like pee, there was grime everywhere and I believe there were urine stains in the corner. I would compare it to a public restroom. It was that bad. The room was configured so that the sink/mirror were outside of the actual bathroom. There were towels hanging and I noticed one of them had blood stains (looked fairly fresh on them). I was so disgusted. I think the one good thing about this place is the room size. It was huge for Manhattan. Until significant action is taken I strongly suggest that the Holiday Inn chain reconsider this hotel's affilitation with them and STRONGLY ENCOURAGE YOU TO STAY AWAY FROM THIS PROPERTY.

Reviews.Title: “HOTWIRE CUSTOMERS BEWARE...”
Reviews.Author: hbfam
Reviews.Content: You will not be guaranteed a non-smoking room. The AC is practically non-existent and the rooms are in serious need of a facelift. I agree with some of the review in terms of being a great location and you probably won't spend much time in your room if you are sightseeing, but you do have to sleep in it and it won't be comfortable during a hot, humid summer night. This hotel caters to a lot of European customers and they are almost always fully booked (according to one of the managers). I apologize in advance if I offend anybody, but based on personal experience I have to say that Europeans are not as picky about their hotel accomodations as Americans. After several conversations with the manager, they did comp us are parking, but if wasn't much of a discount. It was actually cheaper to book directly through the Holiday Inn than it was through Hotwire so she essentially gave us their deal. I wouldn't not recommend this hotel to anyone on a family vacation. It was not relaxing to come back to after a long day of tourism. Do yourself a favor and spend a few extra bucks. And don't trust Hotwire in large vacation destination cities. Hotwire customers will always be second class citizens compared to people who book directly with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: jwoodie6
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'd like to say that the service was undoubtidly unfriendly. The people were cold and impersonnable, and treated us like morons. Secondly, the lack of a/c in the rooms made it hard to get a decent night's sleep, and when it would turn on...it clanked the entire night. The beds were comforatble, the room was reletively clean. There is a pool, but it is only open from 10am-6pm. Which, unless you have kids, is very inconvenient. Most people are out and about in the city between those hours. There is also a rooftop bar next to the pool, which is another stupid reason for the hours...who drinks at 10 in the morning? I called and asked for 4 wine glasses and had to call 4 different services before someone would respond. When i finally got an answer, i was told i had to leave a deposit for the glasses, for which i convinved the guy to let it slide. Upon arriving at our room there was a tray of food left on the floor in the hallway, - it hadnt been picked up in over a day and a half. I had to call someone to come pick it up. ew. The bathrooms are very small, and the decor need to be seriously updated. Overall, i would not stay there again. Too unfriendly and outdated. It also had an overwhelming hotel smell...like old smell. Upon leaving, the parking attendant tried to overcharge us. He charged us 30 dollars a day when we were quoted 25 online. He was not friendly. Didnt feel good about leaving my car there.

Reviews.Title: “Total '80s Throwback...and Not in a Good Way”
Reviews.Author: Nanci_Dru
Reviews.Content: I was here on business and did not choose this hotel. For the price my employer paid, I could have gotten a much better hotel in a better location, but the conference I was attending was at the hotel. The decor is a hodge podge of partially renovated areas and areas that were last updated circa 1980. The photos on the Holiday Inn web site don't lie. That is actually what the hotel looks like inside. At the risk of sounding like a snob, I personally have not seen anything like that since I was a little girl in the 1980s. Most hotel brands, even budget ones, have insisted on consistency and providing a clean, basic place to stay. This was the exception. The lobby bar had been renovated, but the rest of the lobby had not. The lobby had a weird smell like an overpowering air freshener. Stafff...The staff was OK. Check in was easy but the lady did not tell me to go to the back set of elevators, so I went to the wrong elevator bank and consequently my room was not where I would have thought and I had to come back down the elevator. Check out was easy. Bellstaff was so-so. One man helped me check my bag, but no one opened the door, and one man had to get off his cell phone to help me get a cab and assist other guests. As the bellman who did help me pointed out, most of the staff is lazy and just stands around talking. They did a good job of setting up the conference though the projector was not working at first and they actually got one of the cafe employees to try to fix it. Some staff members, particularl housekeeping, were friendly and I do want to give them credit. Cleanliness and upkeep -- The hotel was gross. The women's restroom, though tastefully redone, was a disaster. None of the soap dispensers worked, the garbage had not been emptied so there were paper towels all over the floor, and water was all over the basins and floor. And one of the toilets was not flushing. Rather than clean it up, someone just put out a "Caution - Slippery Floor" sign. When I arrived at my room, there was a room service tray out front. I was almost scared someone would still be in my room when I opened the door! The tray and accompanying food were not removed until mid-morning the next day. The door to the supply closet on the floor was left wide open, as the latch didn't work, and vacuums were left in the hallway the entire time. The room itself was comfortable enough and of a decent size. It had an old tube TV. The TV got bad reception, made a static noise, and had gray lines running through it. There were toiletries -- several bars of soap and some Bath and Body Works products. There was a coffee maker but no mini-fridge. There were soda machines and ice machines. The safe did not work. The bed was comfortable. Water pressure was good as was temperature. The a/c worked and was a noisy window unit. The room was horrifically outdated and dingy. The worst thing was an enormous (3-4') bubble on the ceiling where there must have been a leak. The paint was chipping and the ceiling was brown in spots. It needed to be taken down and replaced. Instead, it had just been painted over. It looked like it might cave in. There was also a rather large hole (about 2' wide) in one of the ceilings in the hallway. The location was OK. The neighborhood is residential but it's within 3 blocks of Columbus Circle. All in all, for the price paid, I could have stayed in a 4-star hotel. With some minor changes, this could be a 3-star hotel, but as it currently is, I would really say it's only 2 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “close to subway, Central Park and theatre district.”
Reviews.Author: trav-lersmore
Reviews.Content: Take eye covers if you wake up early with the sun, as the curtains are nylon only so you cannot block out the lights at all. Room clean, bed comfy, everything so no problems really.

Reviews.Title: “Almost No AC at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LBiship
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the best thing about this hotel was the size of the rooms (king or double; single queen is very small) and the beds were comfortable outside of that I don’t have much positive to say. The hotel overall is in desperate need of a facelift however I expect that is why the rates are a little lower than others in the neighborhood. The worst part was being there during a heat wave with little or basically no air conditioning. It blows slightly but does not cool off the room or remove any of the humidity. Everything in the room was sticky and the ice melted in a matter of minutes due to the heat. We were attending a convention at the Sheraton and missed the convention rate deadline so we stayed here; also smoking rooms are getting harder to find and I quite honestly get tired of standing on the street corner in major cities when I want to have a cigarette so we booked at the Holiday Inn. Upon arrival I checked in which took a while as there was only one person behind the desk and a line of people. The lobby was very hot and stuffy. After checking in I noted they had booked me in a non smoking room. I went back down to the lobby; waited in line again. The only answer I received was yes you did reserve a smoking room but we are sold out of them right now. Just that nothing else. No apologies; just non smoking is all we have right now. They said they would t have a smoking room the next day b y 11:00. This room was a king and as I stated earlier a good size however the air conditioning was not working so I requested a fan; set it on the AC unit in hopes that it would help. It did not. The internet is so slow it’s not worth the effort so I had to use my air card. The next morning we went down for the new room however none were cleaned. We were given a free drink coupon but were not in the mood to for alcohol that early in the day so we set in the hot and stuffy lobby and waited. Finally at 1:00 we were told our room should be ready soon; we elected to go back to our room and wait. And waited we did until about 3:00 PM. We packed up all our stuff and moved to the new room however they had given up a queen instead of the promised double. We went back to the front desk and they gave us two more coupons and the correct room however by this time we had lost a good portion of day and were unable to do some of the things we planned. The AC was no better in this room as well. I didn’t mind the small bathrooms, the peeling wallpaper and outdated décor however limited AC during a heat wave was miserable. I tossed and turned every night we were there and my sinuses were horrible. I was never so relieved to leave a hotel and get in my car (which has great AC).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Basic Room”
Reviews.Author: scywilliams
Reviews.Content: I wanted 4 people in one room. Almost impossible to find in NYC without paying really big money. I was leary after reading some of the reviews, but for the price I had to take the chance. It is nothing fancy or elaborate. The room we stayed in looked as old as it was, but nothing leaked or was broken. Very clean and beds were really comfortable. Our room was backed up to 56th street and was surprisingly quiet. Also had heard about all the small rooms in NYC. This one was plenty big for 4 of us and our luggage. Definitely a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Manahttan!”
Reviews.Author: mycousinbrynnie
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times over the past few years, always with family and have always had a great time. Great value for Manhattan and you can always find deals for this hotel online. Rooms are surprisingly large and comfy and always very clean. Friendly and helpful staff. Would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great safe location”
Reviews.Author: stevieaNeath
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and was really pleased. Room for four was massive, clean and had fabulous comfy beds. Bell staff really friendly, didnt eat in hotel because of prices, and bar prices were high but found it to be the same all over New York, No problems with some of the things other people had reviewed such as bed bugs, lifts were really quick. Would definitely stay here again. Would have liked the pool to have stayed open later than 6.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: crowleyjones
Reviews.Content: I thought, given prices in N.Y. City, that this was a good buy. The room was just fine and the location was great. We walked everywhere, but could have easiIy gotten busses. Breakfast in the hotel was ok. Maybe it was as well priced as would have been found elsewhere, but it would be fun to find someplace else to get something more interesting. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive - No Microwave, fridge, parking facility”
Reviews.Author: Ohiotraveller14
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 2 night stay. Before booking, I had called & asked them if they had parking since it was my first time in NYC. The Gentleman on the otherside said they have hotel parking for $25 a night. Felt it wasn't too bad & drove for 12 hrs and reached the hotel. Was shocked to find there was no hotel parking. Had to park the car at a garage where they give discount for staying in this hotel for $30 a night. Room was a bit cramped, but no complaints since thats common in NYC. Had specifically asked for fridge & Microwave, but none to be found. When called the front desk, get a reply saying when I called before my reservation, call might have landed in the call center & they don't know about the facilities...Pathetic answer. On the positive side, nice location, walkable to a subway & Empire State Building. Lot of Restaurants nearby. I would prefer atleast a microwave/parking facility esp for the amount of money I spend for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Struggling to find something positive to say”
Reviews.Author: travelingjen10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dump..don't waste your time staying here. I had a business conference here so I didn't have a choice. My stay started when I was checked into a room with the a/c barely working onthe 17th floor. Thankfully, I was switched to the 11th floor. Later during my stay the elevators broke down and I had to walk down 11 flights of stairs with no communication from the staff the the elevators were out of order. The rooms and hotel are DISGUSTING! The room was grimy and old. My alarm clock didn't work..I'm not sure that it was plugged in because I couldn't stand to think about reaching behind the night stand for the cord. The front desk & restaurant staff is unfriendly and curt. The carpeting is old and needs to be replaced. The door latch on my room was barely attached to the wall. I went to purchase a bottle of water in the vending machine-pressed water and got 2 cans of Sprite, when I brought them to the front, she just laughed. She did give me 2 replacement bottles and 2 drink coupons for the bar. *Wow, I found something positive to say* Overall, the hotel is a run down dump that desperately needs some updating. One more positive thing is the location-close to Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Sharon_BRA
Reviews.Content: I got to the Holiday Inn Midtown - NYC, after staying in two other Holiday Inn Express in Canada. This one not being "express" I actually expected a better hotel and got the opposite. The staff was nice and attentive, the hotel itself is huge but compared to its "brothers" it was a little poorer and more expensive. I know it has a pool, conference room and various amenities but I'm the kind of traveler that would decline all that for renovated and spacious rooms. I was told to expect smaller rooms in NYC but the only complaint in size for the room I have is about the bathroom which is ridiculously tiny. The room was kind of old, needing new wallpaper and carpet (not a disaster, mind you, but I think it's about time they change it before it gets bad). The rate did not include breakfast, so I chose to eat out in a restaurant half block from there (The Morning Star, I'll review it soon, but recommend it if you're staying here). It did include wireless internet which was a little slower than I expected so I believe if you're in a business trip it might get to your nerves. Aside from that, I would recommend this hotel if you're planning a trip to New York City. They do have a great location, very close to Columbus Circle (access to subway), many useful stores close by, walking distance from the Central Park and various attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible smell in the room. Not the 3 star experience that I am used to.”
Reviews.Author: StBarts521
Reviews.Content: The room had a terrible musty smell that pretty much made us sick. The vent in the bathroom had an inch of dust hanging from it. I think the smell in the room orginated in the heating and cooling vents. These rooms need to be properly cleaned and fumigated before they are fit to stay in. Do yourself a favor and pick another hotel. The location was not bad, but I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “i was happy with the hotel”
Reviews.Author: porkster1960
Reviews.Content: all tho we enjoyed our stay at the holiday inn.if there was a down side for me the drinks in the bar was well over priced at 11 dollars for a can of fosters and the bar staff were not very friendly but all in all not a bad hotel,paul aldridge ,england

Reviews.Title: “Get a room with a view of the rooftop pool (and the river, etc)”
Reviews.Author: NorthVanDMo
Reviews.Content: We booked our 5 night stay months in advance and got a very good rate. We were thrilled with the location of our room - on the 16th floor, looking south, towards the rooftop pool on the hotel's lower tower. Even though the room was basic and no frills, the view was wonderful! We could watch the sunset over the Hudson and look at the rooftops and towers to the south. I have to admit that we might not have enjoyed our stay if we were on a lower floor staring into windows of buildings across the street. If your focus is on the room, you will not be impressed. But who goes to NYC to sit in a hotel room? The location of this hotel is ideal! It is close to everything - but on a relatively quiet street. At the end of the block is 9th Ave with a huge selection of reasonably priced restaurants, cafes and snack options. We were approximately 2 blocks from Columbus Circle, Central Park and and the subway stop. We were happy with our maid service: our room was tidied up every day when we came back from our travels. The rooftop pool is quite nice and has beverage service and a large deck for sun tanning. Unfortunately, the pool hours do not make sense: what is the point of closing a pool at 6 pm on a hot summer night? Isn't the idea to offer a place for travelers (and their kids) to chill out after a day on the town? Even though we love swimming - we only made it back to the hotel in time for a dip twice. The lobby of the hotel was always buzzing with tourists and staff. Not the type of place you would want to lounge. Instead, take your book or newspaper to a local cafe. By the way, the hotel offered a complementary New York Post delivered to the room. A trashy tabloid - but it was a lot of fun to read about local scandals and check the weather forecast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: California26
Reviews.Content: I stayed for six nights and was very satisfied. The location on 57th St. is great, surrounded by bus lines in all directions. The aging furniture is acceptable, especially as it's so difficult to find a reasonably priced hotel in Manhattan. It's a trade-off I'm happy to make. The room was clean and well-tended during my stay, which matters more. I liked the coffee maker, free wifi (which was excellent throughout my stay), iron, and hair dryer. I missed the in-room safe that most Holiday Inns have. The front desk staff, belloys, and housekeepers were all very polite and helpful. I saw no evidence at all of bedbugs, as others have complained. The hotel seems to be very busy with tourists and tourist groups, and I felt safe travelling alone here.

Reviews.Title: “Good NYC bargain”
Reviews.Author: rfriend
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days, while rooms are dated, they were clean, comfortable and very quiet. A great bargain probably because a little off the beaten path being off 9th Ave. Service was very good (maybe management has read some of the reviews). Don't bother eating at hotel, better and much cheaper restaurants in the neighborhood. Did check for bedbugs as that has become a concern in every nyc hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: famw2girls
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and the room was very clean. We had requested a non-smoking room when we booked on-line but none was available when we arrived. The hallway had a VERY strong smoke smell which was very unpleasant but the room wasn't too bad. The pool hours were unpractical: 10:oo am - 6 pm. Prices for food were (of course) very high but we went outside of the hotel for our meals. Great shopping nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff-Very old rooms”
Reviews.Author: ironworker2006
Reviews.Content: I checked in late night and manager and front desk was very friendly...But rooms are very old...not clean..i mean it is obvious that they tried to clean but furniture cannot be clean enough after a certain age and those were very old...rate was acceptable for NYC...

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction NOT guaranteed”
Reviews.Author: Lizbonita
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is good and the beds are clean and comfy but that's about all the positive things I have to say about this hotel. When I checked in, the woman working at the desk (who by the way wasn't the friendliest person), told me that because I booked my hotel on Priceline, I wouldn't have the power to choose a smoking or a non-smoking room. I was traveling with my Mom and both her and I are somewhat allergic to smoke. My Mom has asthma as well. But because it was the last room, we took it any way. When we got to the floor, we smelled the smoke immediately. The room wasn't as bad but at night, my Mom's asthma got worse and she didn't sleep a wink. The following day, we asked the manager to move us to another room, but no luck. I understand that it was a busy time, but I didn't feel as if they were sympathetic enough about our situation, nor were they willing to look into other options for us. In the end, we did finally get to move to a non-smoking room, but it was on our 4th and last night. If we didn't continuously bug the staff, I don't think we would've gotten the room at all. Overall, I didn't feel comfy at the hotel. The washroom is small, dated and doesn't appear clean. The hotel staff wasn't friendly and accomodating. I paid $150/night (a discounted price on Priceline) and I don't feel it was worth the amount at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious room, good value”
Reviews.Author: spanish_af
Reviews.Content: The room was large, the view from the window was super! (8th floor), the lobby was nice, total was $208 (prepaid online). Had breakfast in the morning - was very fast service and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “If you're a smoker, you should stay here..if not..stay away.”
Reviews.Author: lostislandgirl
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through a third party bidding company, I didn't get a great price deal, but I did win..or so I thought. When we were checking in, I mentioned that we wanted a non-smoking room, and they first said.."no, you booked a smoking room and that is what you got"..I replied that I didn't because I've never smoked and I would never book a smoking room. They then said, well you booked through a third party and they didn't give you a choice because that is what they are trying to sell off. Huh? Then as the hotel, why can't you change it? Even after speaking to the manager, they could not or would not change us. We were stuck in a filthy smokey room for two days. The smoke is in the carpet and drapes, and with the entire floor of smokers, you wake up smelling the smoke, as it comes under the door. Both the Hotel and third party seller were deceitful.

Reviews.Title: “I'm covered with bed bug bites after staying here.”
Reviews.Author: jenniferbrinley
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Day Inn does a large volume of business with people from all over the world. After staying at this hotel on a recent business trip, I returned home covered with bed bug bites. I've called the hotel several times and have been unable to speak with a manager. I'm still waiting for "the executive office" to call me back. When I googled "Holiday Inn and bed bugs" the Holiday Inn on West 57th popped up as number one in the search engine. I'm not the first person to complain about this, and I'm hoping none of the bugs traveled home with me. If you choose to stay here, inspect your room for bed bugs and take precautions.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds and linen, perfect location, very helpful concierge, bad front desk staff attitude”
Reviews.Author: Denise-Hermanus
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7day stay at this hotel in NYC. The room was lovely, spacious and the bed most comfortable. Housekeeping was great and friendly, fresh towels every day even though we hung ours up. The gentleman concierge was extremely friendly and helpful, supplying us with maps, directions, tickets etc. Coffee too in the room was delicious! The location is ideal, just a couple of blocks from Central Park and subway. We were on the 15th floor because I asked to be in the north tower and high up, so our bathroom was modern and actually the best we had had on our 3 week tour. What we didn't like was the snooty lady on the front desk, when we arrived to check in for the week, no smile or word of welcome, just the word "Yes?" Another problem for us was the doors slamming during the night, we think its as a result of the strong spring on the doors and guests just walk into their rooms and don't hold the door - just let it slam shut. Fortunately being on the 15th floor we were only disturbed by this a couple of times during the night. We also had an occasion where we had to pick out the cleaning guy who was vacuuming the room next door early one morning and allowing the door to bang continuously but after we spoke to him, there was no further problem. We discovered a super restaurant down 57th towards the river just past 11th Avenue on the right hand side called Hudson Eatery and where we had our dinner most evenings. New, clean, excellent service and very good value for money. Try the cob salad - to die for !! NYC was everything we expected and more - wonderful memories. Would stay at at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable beds, pleasant housekeeping staff, ideal location,rude poor people skill reception staff”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth042010
Reviews.Content: Hotel reception staff need to be educated in the meaning of customer people skills.After all hotel guests at the end of the day pay their wages. We were pt in a smoking disabled room at first. We flatly refused, also threaten to walk out & go else where.Two room moves & finally a more acceptable room. The hotel duty managers are most helpful & pleasant however the rude female reception staffer who so poorly checked us into the disabled guest room needs to be sacked. She looked down her nose & refused to accept our priority member card stating " that wont help you here"I reinforced the hotelis a member of the intercontinental group so please scan the card.Upon reflection our stay was ok but the hotel needs a total revamp, smelling carpet, shabby guest areas, filthy walls need painting & limit smoking to outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FleurS2
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn in Midtown is a great hotel. You can walk to Central Park and lot's of other famous attractions. The service is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in south tower ,moldy room smell”
Reviews.Author: sunnet
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from May 3rd until May 6th. The hotel seemed fine and the A/C is on so the room was not hot. We opened the door and the smell was terrible , like a moldy smell. The room was large and the beds comfortable. Once you were in the room you didn't notice the smell. You can hear the doors slamming up and down the hall. Don't stay in the south tower , (that's were we were) if they send you that way ask to be changed to the north tower. (newer) We found a great restaurant for breakfast at 9th called " The Flame" good food. Bus stops on both sides of West 57th close to hotel and the metro was two blocks up.
