If you buy a single ride it is only good for bus or for metro but not both. A day pass for $8.25 will let you ride bus or metro all day on either . The bus driver does not take bills you need coins only. NYC was a terrific place to visit lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yorkie83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Easter holidays and had our stay extended due to the volcano eruption. I have to say that at all times all the staff were extremely freindly and helpful. Once we discovered we were going to have to stay longer than planned the reception staff seemed to go out of their way to accomodate us and find rooms. I don't think they coudl have doen much more to help. The hotel itslef was clean and tidy and all the rooms we ended up using were of a high standard. I would recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect”
Reviews.Author: Alexis171
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Dec 07 and it was as you would expect of a Holiday Inn. It was clean and in a great location not far from times square. I would def recommend it for anyone looking for a good clean hotel as a base to explore NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place and would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Michelle255338
Reviews.Content: We were on our way to Kentucky and spent three nights here after flying from Australia. The reception staff were welcoming and efficient. The Christmas decor pretty and tasteful. We found the room roomy, clean and comfortable. The bed was especially cosy. The room service was very good. Breakfast in the attached restaurant was excellent as was the service there. The location suited perfectly as we walked everywhere to theatres, tour pickups and shopping and felt quite safe at all times of the day. Value for money was very good.

Reviews.Title: “don't go for a smoking room”
Reviews.Author: Popple77
Reviews.Content: we only stayed there one night and would not stay there again. The room stank of smoke and the hotel staff were not very friendly. they did not help us with our bags and we had to carry them ourselves to the taxi in the pouring rain

Reviews.Title: “I am in agreement with every negative review here”
Reviews.Author: MLBCA
Reviews.Content: No need to spend alot of time typing................I just agree with every negative review here, and the positive reviews sure don't sound like the hotel where we stayed. I stayed here in 2004 and had a beautifully remodeled room. I even complained about the room and mentioned that prior experience. I was told all the rooms were like the one we were in. Also told there was NO A/C...............No A/C?!!!! Sure..........with the hot summers???????????? Will NEVER stay there again!!!!! OK............one positive...........the bed was comfortable..................

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Joseph_Choy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a standard room over 6 nights in April. Pros: Very clean and big rooms for NYC standards. Clean toilets well stocked with the basic amenities. The bed was plush and comfortable and we have a view of street behind us. Big windows with lots of sunlight. The hotel is conveniently located near Columbus Circle Station(5 min walk away) which has a few subway lines running through it. It is located just 2 blocks south of beautiful Central Park and the north end of Mid-town district. It is easily walkable to 5th Avenue and many of the major tourist sights in Midtown. The area around the hotel is also very safe and we have no issues walking back to the hotel after midnight. But generally Manhatten is really safe for all visitors. I am not sure about Harlem though as i did not explore north of Central Park during my visit. There are a couple of convenience shops(Walgreens) around the hotel as well as restaurants for breakfast. Make sure to try out Morning Star Restaurant for breakfast on the way to Columbus Circle subway station. There is a guy in there who has a slight hunch who is really friendly who dishes out lots of tips and advice for visitors. The check-in guy Valdy is also pretty helpful and friendly. Cons: the free wireless signal is really weak and you have to pay 1USD for 4 min of internet usage in the computers located in the hotel lobby. I may be thinking too much but i think i may have been scammed for tips by the bell services. After i paid a tip to the bellboy who took out my luggage, he handed me to another guy who called a taxi for me. Is that even necesarry for 2 seperate guys to do a simple task? i ended paying a tip to the guy who hailed the cab for me as well. But overall, it was a really great experience at the hotel. Well located, safe neighbourhood, clean spacious rooms, walking distance to most midtown sights. But to get a better local experience in NYC on my next visit, i would probably find a hotel in Lower East Side or Greenwich.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for Manhattan but would stay in Queens if I was driving”
Reviews.Author: The_Wandererers
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and was able to get a room with 2 queen beds for $140 a night (a steal for prices in the area). Beware if you are driving because the cost for daily parking (like a lot of other places in the area) is an extra $30 per day. Not a lot of night life in this area of town and is several blocks walk to the nearest subway. I find that if I am staying in town with my car it is easier and cheaper to stay across the river in Queens. There parking is usually cheap/free and you can find trains even closer to your hotel making it a bit more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Lynn1412
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at this Holiday Inn as my parents had booked a package holiday here and I was to meet up and stay 4 nights with them. (They didn't arrive as they flight was cancelled form Heathrow) I booked on an advanced purchase of 775.00 dollars for the 4 nights , room only one person. After a long journey (2 flights from Mallorca) I arrived at the Hotel only to find a dirty shabby and very tired looking Hotel. Wallpaper was peeling off the walls in the corridors, paint work badly chipped, dirty worn carpets, I could go on. There are 3 very small overused lifts, with waits of up 10mins at breakfast time. resturant facitlies are canteen- like and very poor. The bar in the lobby is scruffy. I thought I would have a glass of Prosecco or Cava to sheer me up, but the bartender offered me a 1/4 bottle of Champagne instead and I thought why not? However what he gave me was undrinkable, certainly not Champagne (but it was 'made' by Johnny R Champagne) I sent it back ...bartender not happy..didn't offer me anything else. 20 min wait to talk to the concierge ..just to get a map ...the bell boys wouldn't get me one. She talked to me whilst drinking a bottle of water. The room was adequate but very tired, large by European standards but stains on carpets and armchair. Aircon unit not workingand as South facing was very warm in the room. As I was to be by myself for the next 4 days I checked out the next morning and went to stay at the Jumeriah Essex ... a different World entirely. I was told that I was not entitled to a refund as it was an advanced purchased, which I accepted as I was glad to get away and was still quite tired. However I do feel Hotels should offer the standard they advertise and the least should be clean. If these standards are not met then the advanced purchase terms and conditions should not apply. As a footnote I am a Platinum Priority cardmember and this meant absolutely nothing at this Hotel,What is the point of being a member of these loyalty cards.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location , Really good hotel that serves its purpose perfectly”
Reviews.Author: DoraNotts
Reviews.Content: If you want a basic hotel in a good location for a good price you cannot go wrong with this one. Our rooms included a double , a twin and a family room. All were perfectly adequate if alittle tired but they were clean when we arrived and cleaned every day. We had the family room which had 2 adults and 2 16 year olds in and was a good size. We all said that the beds were the most comfortable we had slept in - or maybe NY exhauseted us so much we just thought they were? Its not new and its not posh but we would most definately stop here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on Location”
Reviews.Author: KittyinKent
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days at this hotel last December for a pre-christmas shopping trip. Having read previous reports I was a little worried as to what I might find. Alas all was fine, none of the horrors I had read about. I stayed on the 16th floor, which had a lovely view. It was clean, no horrid smells but yes, the hotel does need updating. The staff were all helpful. The location of perfect. Not far to walk to anywhere, and Columbus subway only a few blocks. I would recomend this hotel to anyone, but bearing in mind other reviews are not good - you should not expect 5* accomodation at these prices.

Reviews.Title: “Never will stay here again!”
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe Holiday Inn would put their name on this building. Everyone that we talked to in the lobby thought the same thing. Air Conditioning did not work, elevators were so slow that there was a line every evening to get on them to go to our room. The rooms need updating, especially the bathrooms. Internet service was like dial up years ago. You could hear the doors of the other rooms on our floor slamming all the time too. Location was pretty good, so we were able to walk all over New York. The beds were clean and comfortable. I should have checked Tripadvisor first before booking at this hotel! We usually stay at better hotels. We were very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad...but a couple things I think everyone should know..”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyMel123
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a vacation to NYC and stayed at this hotel from Sat April 3rd-Tues April 6th. I did extensive research on line before our trip, trying to find a hotel that was not only reasonable, but was near everything we wanted to see. The location of this hotel is not too bad. If you come to NYC, you WILL be doing a lot of walking, and from this hotel, you'll be walking about 5-10 minutes to get to Central Park and about 15 minutes to Times Square. It wasnt bad at all for us. There is a nice little breakfast diner on the corner of 57th and 8th (?) (go out the front door of the hotel and turn right and you'll see it on the corner on the left side). We never ate in the hotel restaurant, so I cant comment on that. Now for the problem we had, and the reason we checked out a day early...the hotel does NOT have individual A/C units in each room. The entire building is either on air or heat, and the building apparently does not switch over to air until a date later than April. We were on the 7th floor and it was unbearably hot. We had the windows open, but then you have the issue of NY traffic noise. The staff at the hotel was incredibly nice and understanding of why we checked out a day early, but it is still a problem. Luckily, the rooms do have wi-fi, so I was able to get on the laptop and find another hotel (with air!) on 47th street (Hotel Edison). It was $20 more a night, and the rooms were a little smaller, and it was pain in the [--] to pack up and move all our stuff, but boy was it nice to have A/C for the last few days of our trip! A few other minor problems with our room...the TV never quite worked correctly. The remote would not work and you had to manually change the channels, some of which didnt come in clear. Also, there is really no place in the bathroom to place anything (shaving kit, brushes, makeup, etc). Minor problem, but again can be a pain when 3 people are sharing a bathroom. Once the A/C is turned on, I would recommend this hotel, simply for the location, the price, and the wonderful staff. One other NYC travel tip...DO take the hop on/hop off tour of the downtown loop. It is a great way to see all the areas (the Village, SOHO, Chinatown, etc), without having to use the subway or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some re-hab - stat!”
Reviews.Author: mohicans
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs to be renovated and I'm surprised that a hotel chain as large as the Holiday Inn is willing to risk their reputation by not attending to this. The elevators, carpet, decor, bathroom fixtures are all old. This hotel was sold to me through Hotwire as a 3 star hotel and it isn't even close. I have stayed in other 3 star Manhattan hotels that were nicer, better located and cheaper than this. The room was clean, mostly - except that one day we came home to a bunch of bits & pieces on the floor that needed to be vacuumed, (we didn't put them there) and clearly the staff forgot to run the machine through the room and left their own mess. I have to give some credit to the bed - we did sleep well. I also give full marks to the concierge who was very helpful. We did not use room service. The television is HORRIBLE - the regular stations fade in and fade out to the point where you get so angry that you decide to buy a movie - which, I suppose is what they want you to do. The location isn't great for the theatre district - its a pretty long walk if the weather is too hot, too cold or too rainy - but a little too short to justify a cab. I've stayed in 6 Manhattan hotels and this was the worst one. Good hotels at a reasonable price to exist there - but this one needs to make some improvements before it can be counted in that group.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: madabsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night on Apr. 2, 2010. The elevators were horrible. You had to go up just to go back down again! They were tiny I could fit no more than 4 people (difficult for us because we had a stroller with us). There was a tray of room service trash (which included food) left in the hallway. The tray was there when we checked in at 2:00 and was still there when we left the next day. The air conditioner in our room didn't work. The buffet breakfast wasd horrible and expensive. Next time I will pay the extra money to stay at a nicer hotel in a more convenient area. I am not a hotel snob and it doesn't take much to please me but this place truly was horrible. Stay somewhere else....this place is the pits!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good staff, good stay.”
Reviews.Author: Volumptiousfunn
Reviews.Content: I stayed very recently (march26-april2). I had an incredibly amazing stay at this hotel. The staff was kind, house keeping came everyday and gave us fresh clean towels and soap everyday. It's conviniently close to times square, 5th ave shopping, Columbus subway station, and many fine restaurants. I would recend this hotel to anyone an for anyone. It's kid, teen, adult and senior friendly. Although the gift shop was a bit pricey it was worth it. I had an amazing time and if any ody gets the chance to meet a guy named Leo who works in the gift shop say hi because he's super sweet and made my stay even better ;)

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Midtown NYC”
Reviews.Author: MartijnG3
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located at about 10-15 minutes walk from both Times Square and Central Park. Rooms are quite big for a NYC hotel and we had enough space for our luggage and to walk around. Hotel has a large restaurant (breakfast not included) which serves all kinds of food. Off cours it is cheaper if you eat in local restaurants. With a swimming pool on the roof (for free) this hotel can really be recommended to city trip people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: beege1011
Reviews.Content: A couple friends and I just stayed in New York City last week (March 22-24th, 2010) for Spring Break. The Holiday Inn Midtown-57th street beat our expectations. The rooms themselves are larger then similar standard hotel rooms in New York and had a great view (at least ours did on the 16th floor). Other then that are pretty average, though neat and clean. The selling point for this hotel is location, location, location. Lincoln Center, Central Park, and Times Square are all within short walking distance. Not to mention, the Columbus Circle subway station which serves 5 different train lines is literally 2 blocks from the hotel. We would strongly recommend this hotel to our friends and family, and anyone looking to travel to New York City and stay in a great location for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: kaycatCannock
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly adequate, nothing special as such, but clean and functional. The bedrooms were a good size and fine for us and our 2 teenage daughters. The hotel is located in a good position and we could walk to Times Square and 5th Ave easily. The restaurant served a lovely breakfast, we didn't eat any other meals there so I have no idea what dinner was like. We found the bar very expensive,but we recommend Blue Moon beer! I would have no hesitation in going back if we are lucky enough to visit NYC again!

Reviews.Title: “No Internet - wireless doesn't work from rooms”
Reviews.Author: mattsydney20
Reviews.Content: As a business traveller i was shocked the wireless internet from the rooms didn't work properly. It was ultra slow and i asked the staff about this. The explaination was that the wireless ... which worked at 6kbps (like dial up) was unreliable because there were too many connections and the signal strength was low. If find this completely unacceptable as this is New York and the Internet should work here!! I mean common guys!!! If your a business person forget about doing work from your rooms - its just too slow. When i went to the lobby i was told i would have to buy a drink to use internet from the bar - which is unacceptable to. Also the service at the desk is shocking - the girl at the desk literally mocked me as i went back to ask about the lifts (they have lifts for odd rooms and different ones for even ones). She was signing to herself and i went back to ask again as i couldnt understand the lifts and she looked at me as if i was a moron. The attitude is unaccepable and someone needs a firm work with the staff to tune it down a bit Overall dont stay here if you want to use internet from your room.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Good NYC Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Billzilla66
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Midtown for two nights. I had been to NYC three other times previously (I have stayed in a bed and breakfast in Staten Island and a European hotel in Greenwich Village), and this has been the best place I have stayed at so far. Check in and check out was a breeze, the staff was very courteous and professional. They allowed me to store my luggage on site until it was time to check in and until my bus departed at midnight. The hotel was very clean and easy to find my way around. The elevators showed signs of aging, but the ran smoothly and were quiet. My room was on the 17th floor (there are only 18 floors in this hotel), and concidering there was road work being done directly in front of the hotel I was glad as the sound was not a problem. My room was more spacious than I would have thought for a NYC hotel, and the bed was very comfortable. The housekeepers kept my room clean and well stocked of shampoos, conditioners, and coffee. The free USA Today was a nice touch too. I didn't watch much TV while I was there, but I can tell you the TV does have cable and in-house movies and other programs such as the internet. The only thing I could complain about was the bar tender at the hotel lobby bar. He prefered to chat on his cell phone and play with his computer, so he kept his back to the patrons and was not very attentive. Be warned: two Manhattans in the lobby bar costs $27.60! OUCH! All in all it was a very good stay and I will probably use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard Holiday Inn, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: GLCM87
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here about 4 or 5 times in the past few years and never had any problems. Each room I have had has been clean and comfortable, the biggest plus being the size. For New york City the rooms are a fantastic size, great if you have a lot of luggage or a lot of shopping! The rooms are nothing fancy, a little worn maybe but clean. There is a gift shop, bar and restaurant downstairs which are all very average. The hotel has a great location on 57th, 2 blocks down from central park and very close walking distance to Times Square etc. I have also been out at night and come back very late and the area still seems to be safe as well. Overall its not going to win any awards for style but it's comfortable and quiet. I would recommend it to someone not wanting to pay a fortiune for somewhere to stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Garry24
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us, we arrived the day before the blizzard which dumped 19 hours of snow on New York City so the fact you could walk quite easily into the main areas was a boon. Staff were friendly, rooms were very clean and spacious ( i found the cleaning staff to be a treat so would recommend a decent tip!) and as everyone appears to comment, there's a decent food outlet close by. On 8th ave about 3 blocks down on the right, there's a bar called Barcelona Bar which is very good.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: shugs2766
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Holiday Inn during our 5 night trip, we were supposed to stay at another hotel but when we arrived it worse the absolute pits. We checked out 1 hour after checking in. So we arrived at Holiday Inn on the off hance that they would have a room. The reception staff were fantastic, nothing was too much trouble. Romm was great, very big, evn if the view was not gret as it overlooked other hotels rooms. The location is fantastic, we walked into the centre of New York every day and it took around 15 mins, but saw plenty on route, we even walked to Liberty Ferry one day and it took 2 and a half hours, not sure I would walk that distance again! All in all great hotel, nice breakfast, good location, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “ny city hotel”
Reviews.Author: AngelaS27
Reviews.Content: Don't need a fancy place if your touring NY, we spent so little time in the hotel that the room was unremarkable. Clean and nice bar area. Close to subway and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect option for budget travel”
Reviews.Author: lafcomike
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for me as hotels in NYC can often be insanely expensive. The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel was within walking distance to Times Square and Central Park. A definite must stay to those cost conscious visitors to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “it is close to the subway and was cheaper than most”
Reviews.Author: s72810f
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for the fact it was in midtown and near the subway. the online photos make it look like a 4 star place but really it is like a 2.5 star for the room and a 5 star for there service. you wont find a cheaper hotel at the time with your own bathroom (some hotels where cheaper but had shared community bathrooms) this was a brand name hotel with a NY price. coming from Daytona Beach area we can find killer rooms for 69.00 a night. NY was all in the 200.00 plus range with tax. but remember that your will be there only to shower and sleep and for that with the subway 2 blocks a way it was worth the money. There is a really nice dinner across the street on the right as you exit the front of the hotel, and a great pizza place it seemed on every street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a Fantastic area......”
Reviews.Author: andreamca1980
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure the staff where very friendly & helpful, rooms very clean and spacious (cleaned every day) hotel bar a bit expensive but very quiet & relaxing, food in hotel was very good although we only ate once. Route 66 cafe on 9th ave between 56th & 57th street very good for money. Very short walk to Central Park and around 20mins walk to Times Square, stayed for 1 week and will definately be retuning soon.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: flyingarmbar
Reviews.Content: I had read a great many reviews on TripAdvisor in my search for a hotel in the Manhattan area for a week's holiday and immediately noticed that common complaints about NYC hotels were unclean rooms, bad housekeeping, rude staff, overchagring, bed bugs etc which alarmed me. Reading the negative comments regarding the Holiday Inn MidTown 57th, I wasnt sure what to expect however after my week there I would recommend this hotel based on: Points Springing to Mind: 1) Hotel was in a decent location, can walk to most places within 10-15 minutes (e.g. Times Square/5th Avenue etc). 2) Hotel and my room (841) was generally clean and well kept. Housekeeping changed towels and soap daily. Running hot water throughout and good shower. 3) Large room, could easily accommodate 2-3 people. King sized bed, with a good mattress and pillows. 4) Breakfast was covered by a $20 voucher, which was enough for 1 person - 2 people could probably eat for that. Selection of healthy and non=healthy food (mostly unhealthy though) 5) Free wireless internet. 6) Mostly friendly and helpful staff. 7) Free gym though a little small but good selection of equipment and friendly staff. (swimming pool shut due to season) Minor Issues: 1) The furnishings are a little old but not so much to cause discomfort e.g. TV in my room was not a flat screen. 2) Dinner in hotel's cafe/restaurant was overpriced and food wasnt that great but plenty of restuarants/fast food/supermarkets and delis within walking distance to ensure large affordable variety. 3) Noise could be an issue for some people e.g. slamming doors in the middle of the night but its to be expected. 4) One of Cafe staff/waiters was a little unprofessional but all others were friendly and efficient. Overall, a reasonably priced hotel with adequate to good facilities in a location which allows you to explore NYC but not be mobbed by daily commuters/other tourists. Some investment to make it a little more modern would make a huge improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: slam2000
Reviews.Content: Price is reasonable. Location is good. Walk few blocks, you get to the main shopping area and Central Park. So you can save some subway and Taxi fee there. Room is fairly clean. Will consider go back if I visit NYC again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Kind Staff. Couldn't have been nicer!”
Reviews.Author: mary_mary99
Reviews.Content: Nice place- very clean rooms, I can't say enough about the staff! Wonderful and kind. Very impressed! Will definitely stay there again and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price.”
Reviews.Author: mgprr
Reviews.Content: We got there early and were given a room. The front desk personnel were excellent. The room was very clean and the floors had been redone but the fixtures in the bathroom and the doors were worn. The furniture was relatively new. But for the price, it was not a problem. The only problem was the doors to the room slammed shut if you let go of them and they were very loud when people were leaving, coming in and going out. We did use room servce for breakfast one morning and it was good and reasonably priced. There is a great diner one block away called the Flame Resturant at 58 St and 9th avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round and would use again”
Reviews.Author: wolvesfc1982
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for new year and had a great time. We enjoyed everything about it. Being in new york we hardly stayed in hotel but i was pleased with it. The main pro was the way in which staff helped me and my wife with probem we had, 1st class service. Would stay there again, loved the breakfast and the bar was nice but pricey!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel of its kind in 57th Manhattan. a disgrace to Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: AL40MD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nothing short of disgrace. We stayed for two days. first Hotel appear to be Ok from outside. dont be fooled by pictures you see on internet. Room was with torn wall papers and king size bed that looked like so worn that middle of beds mid section was sunked in. The worst of all regarding this hotel is that the toilet. I had to hold down the pressure switch for more then a min. to flush even then it was poorest of most basic preparedness for any guest. 10th floor hall way was worn and requires a extensive renovation. Add to this, breakfast is nothing short of "slob on the plate" with over charged bill. NO I am not a hotel spy or other hotel owner or employee. I was just shocked to see What they call "HOTEL" exist in place like manhattan 57th street near most upscale area. Its nothing short of disgrace for holiday Inn chain. Parking fee was 25 flat but attendant is rude that when asked to inspect the car before they take the car to garage, they get easily offended ( which all should do) handled car very roughly flooring the car infront of guest. This hotel needs to be SHUT DOWN. I AM NOT KIDDING DO NOT GO THERE even they ay price is 94 dollars a night. NOT WORTH A PENNY.

Reviews.Title: “great value,great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: chrisc1502
Reviews.Content: this hotel has everything......amazing location just 5minutes alk to times square, 5mins to central park, and 5 mins to 5th ave. but is also not in the midle of it all so you can get a great nights sleep. staff were great, i realised i had forgotten my travel plug so was unable to chage my camerca and phone but they were more than willing to help and just gave me one for free. this was our first time in new york and it deffinatly helped having such a good hotel which was always close by if we needed to go back for anything. deffinatly reccomended. oh and the room was bigger than ny other holiday inn room i have ever seen, it was huge!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Lobby Restroom Are Better Than The Toilet In Our Room”
Reviews.Author: honeyloveca
Reviews.Content: The only good quality about this hotel is it's location. However, the overall experience of this hotel was unbearable. The toilet in our room wouldn't flush even when I had it serviced by the hotel staff. Had to use the hotel lobby restroom instead for the most of my 4-days stay. Bathroom towels were stained. Bed sheets were never changed, even when I requested them to be done. Overpriced breakfast even with their $20 voucher. I would not return back for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Steelers10
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went to New York City right before Christmas and stayed in this hotel. The location was great and close to major attractions like central park and times square. Its a good value and great location for your typical average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: FlagTraveler007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights in September, the last two of which resulted in my being bitten numerous times (approximately 30-50) by unknown bug/s. The incident was reported to hotel management, who had a security officer come to our room and take a report. Two mos-quito-like insects were pointed out to the officer, and he proceeded to kill them. We also showed him one set of bites. As we were about to depart on a cruise, we were unable to remain at the hotel any longer. The hotel did not offer to reimburse us for over-the-counter medical supplies, nor to reimburse us for the cost of the two nights in question. We have requested that, but they have refused to do so, even through Intercontinental Hotel Group. Nearly everyone with whom we have dealt has been rude and not at all accommodating. There was absolutely no "Customer Service."

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller088
Reviews.Content: The room itself was nice but the hotel was extremely noisy. Every door in the entire building slammed shut, so if you needed a good night sleep, you couldn't get it there. Management also not very helpful, in fact, very rude. Location was it's best point - close to subways and Central Park. I guess you get what you pay for. Having had this experience, I would spend the extra bucks and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel,clean and safe, good location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah1Bradford
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights here with my oldest son age 12, being a women with a child on her own I wanted a safe and secure hotel which this was. The cleanliness was very good as were the facilities in the rooms. The staff in the restaurant where we had breakfast, along with the door men couldn't help us enough. The staff on the reception desk were polite but not over helpfull and the staff in the gift shop were downright rude. The food was good value for money and we enjoyed our stay in New York and I would stay at this hotel again. Also the location was excellant for central park, 5th Avenue, Times Square etc.

Reviews.Title: “Walking Distance”
Reviews.Author: BenjaminP2
Reviews.Content: It was nice to be close to Times Square and Central Park...it made walking to places easy and fun. It wasn't the nicest hotel, but wasn't bad. It worked for us and I would stay there again. HOT TIP: Make sure you check with your valet on what time you need to get your car out of parking, otherwise you may end up paying full day pricing for a matter of minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel and Cheap”
Reviews.Author: heidileduc
Reviews.Content: This hotel not only had some of the largest rooms in the city for the cost but room service was wonderful, food was great, the Bar was gorgeous and had anything and everything you could want, also during the summer months there is a pool club on the roof, but if you are a guest it is free and there is a bar up there too!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: funnblnd
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled to NY for Thanksgiving week. Booked this hotel because rates were reasonable considering it was a holiday week and felt that a H. I. couldn't be all that bad. We were right. The lobby was spacious and check-in was efficient considering the number of people there. I found most of the staff to be very courteous although the conceirge staff could use some work. Our room was very clean and comfortable even though it had a "well worn" look, but after all, they are. The bathroom is very small with very little space on the vanity area, and the toilets were noisy and hard to flush. The breakfast in the Gotham was so-so, as was the service. The lounge was nice and the bar staff was great. I would stay here again. It is very centrally located and a short walk to the subway station in Columbus Circle.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, good location”
Reviews.Author: TK100
Reviews.Content: I guess it depends on what you want to do in New York - we were 3 ladies aged between 30 and 35 and wanted to go shopping, see the city & some shows while staying in a hotel that wouldn't break the bank - we got exctly what we were looking for! The room was a typical Holiday Inn room in the US - very spacious (no problem for all 3 of us + all of our suitcases & shopping) - it was clean and not noisy at all... A quick walk to central park & times square made it ideal for us.

Reviews.Title: “Large room for a NY hotel.”
Reviews.Author: celticbird13
Reviews.Content: i must admit i was more than a little concerned after reading certain reviews on here that this Hotel would be a disaster. As we we there for my husband on buisness i had no choice if i wanted to go so i went thinking the worse but hoping for the best. What i found when i arrived was far from bad and i wondered if this reviewer had even gone to this hotel and had made a mistake. To start with the foyer had no nasty smell and the decorations where very pretty and not over done for the holidays. The front desk attendant was cheerful bright and very helpful.. Our room was large by most city standards , for NYC it was huge and i was very pleasantly surprised ,King bed , very comfortable clean sheets no bed bugs what so ever , although on the small side the bathroom room was very clean plenty of clean towels and nice hot shower. Breakfast in the Gotham cafe was very good with a pleasant waiter and quick service. The only thing i can say i may agree with although it seems i have had this problem in most of the hotels i have stayed in in NY was the banging of doors in the night which is the thoughtless guests rather than anything the hotel did wrong .If i wanted to be really picky i would say the elevator was my least favorite thing over the weekend only because it stopped at every floor and guests realizing it was too full to get in would be too quick to push the button again so the door would open again and we we were a while getting down to breakfast . This is a hotel that i would recommend , it is in a good location for Central Park and only a short walk to Empire state building and Time Square .In the summer it is a big plus as it has an out door pool on the roof , i didnt get to see it but i would consider coming in the summer for that reason alone and i would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deltaphil
Reviews.Content: We have today returned from a 4 night stay in this hotel and after staying in a number of hotels in New York in the past found the Holiday Inn to be the best so far. Rooms were clean ,large and hard to find in New York, a coffee making facility in the room. The staff were very polite and helpful, dining room and food very good and a good gift shop open 7am -11.45pm. The hotel is close to the sights with good resturants close by (Moonrock being one) The only downside was when we booked a car back to JFK we were told it was $60 all in including tolls and tip but when we arrived at the terminal the driver demanded a tip as this was not included, no fault of theirs but they should keep a eye on the cars they use or book. Thanks Holiday Inn for helping us have a great trip, and we will visit you again next year. Happy Holidays to all the satff.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but take earplugs!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: clarkey58
Reviews.Content: arrived at 23;30 very helpfull check in desk staff who pointed us in the right direction,very impressed with the size of the room the king sized bed which 4 people could have slept in!!!! the only drawback which some other people have mentioned was the noise ,mainly from toilets being flushed also doors slamming at all hours . we had taken earplugs with us just in case and we were glad we did!!!! apart from the noise everything about the hotel is great , the room hoovered each day used towels were changed daily(unlike other hotels we have stayed in were the used towels were still ther the next day) every thing was just right only had one problem with a member of the check in staff who when i wanted some advice she spoke to me as if i was stupid !!!!! the location of the hotel is good not far from central park and most other places are not that far away if you like walking .we booked a car for the return journey to the airport this was done at the front desk it cost $60 including tolls and tip took just over 40 mins to jfk, much better than being stuck in the airlink van transfer for god knows how long as we were on the arrival pick up from jfk. we think that we would certainly stay here again if we go back

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Huge room, snotty concierge and front desk”
Reviews.Author: gregntommy
Reviews.Content: We are a world traveling gay couple and rarely find homophobia. Upon arrival at the hotel we were greeted by a young lady at the front desk. She asked us three times if it was correct that we wanted a king size bed. When we assured her that it was correct she sneered and looked like she was going to be ill. Maybe she was, to her defense. It was not a warm greeting. The next day we asked the concierge what time the TKTS discount broadway ticket booth in Times Square opened and he said he had no idea and walked off. That stunned the both of us. Later on in the day a different concierge was on hand and was very helpful. The room was huge, comfortable and clean. The location can't be beat. We will recommend this hotel for friends but will probably stay somewhere else on our next visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “It was like home”
Reviews.Author: f-upgirl
Reviews.Content: I really really liked that hotel, it was in a very nice place, easy to reach with any means; the service was perfect , the price is effordable and worthy and people very gentle.

Reviews.Title: “Apparently Many Folks Think They're Leona Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: ansky
Reviews.Content: I stayed this past (2009) Thanksgiving and have no complaints whatsoever. The room (king smoking on the 14th floor) was very large and comfortable and clean. My best tip? **The Roosvelt deli at the west end of the block. Cheap, friendly (!), open 24/7. I think it's safe to assume the property will be renovated as part of Holiday Inns' "makeover." When they do so, if they ask my two cents' worth, I'd bring up two things: 1) Brighter lighting, and 2) Ice machines on every floor -- currently they're staggered. Meanwhile, I must say I liked it. I travel more than I'd prefer, but I would definitely stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Accomodations....you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastballer
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad hotel by any means...it is just very basic and run down. The decor is old and drab, the location is by no means great. However, its not far from Columbus Circle, so if Central Park is your choice, you are right there. Unfortunately, I got stuck with this hotel on Hotwire. Sometimes you get good, sometimes you get bad....this time it was drab.

Reviews.Title: “Will not go back”
Reviews.Author: SDgal64
Reviews.Content: If price is all you care about, then this is the place for you. We were booked into this hotel by our company because of the price but could not wait to leave. The wifi connection was so terrible that I had to go to a local Starbucks to get any work done. The doors on the guest rooms slam so hard when they close so loudly that the walls shake. The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything around you. When you get off the elevator you are hit with the smell of old hotel. We were not impressed with anything at this hotel. The rooms were decent size and the breakfast in the restaurant was okay. We had one concierge that was great but the next one we spoke to was too busy counting money to give us the time of day.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal.”
Reviews.Author: Scout44
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was a Holiday Inn and was in an affordable price range for a short stay in NY. I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was very helpful & accommodating. The hotel was clean, quiet, and comfortable, and it was located near the places I needed to go. Its not a fancy place but was great for the price.

Reviews.Title: “More than we bargained for!”
Reviews.Author: Jacquie61
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in this hotel previously in 1991 and enjoyed the location and easy access to the areas of the city we were visiting - but what a scruffy, run-down establishment it has now become. There is a peculair smell in the lobby area and the corridors and rooms are delapidated and showing their age. Chipped paint, peeling wall-paper and frayed carpets were a feature of our room along with a major infestation of bed-bugs which bit me extensively! They did agree the room would be fumigated following my complaint but they did not appear surprised to hear about the additional room occupants! If you know what is good for you - STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: deneeb
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried after reading some of the other reviews, but this hotel turned out to be perfect for us. We were walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, etc which made life easy for us. The hotel room was clean, but a little dated. The cleaning staff were amazing! The front desk and the concierge were not overly friendly, but don't let it deter you from this hotel. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Complete rip-off”
Reviews.Author: Tripper1Birmingham
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very basic and not in a particularly convenient part of town. Our party of 12 stayed for just two nights before embarking on a cruise. One night we met in the hotel bar for a drink. The barman was asked for two Scotch & Drys. Without any comment, he poured two measures of the most expensive Whisky he could find. We were charged USD40 each for the whisky. I think he hoped that being in a large party we may not notice, but when we asked him what was the average whisky he had to admit it was USD11. His tip is included in the bill so obviously the higher he got the bill the more he received in tip. No one at the hotel was able to help us as the bar is administered separately to the hotel and the regional manager would not be visiting until after our departure. Be careful about what you order in this hotel as they are there is get as much of your cash as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as”
Reviews.Author: disauniflora
Reviews.Content: some of the other reviewers found this hotel. Frankly, after reading some of the reviews, I was very apprehensive about staying there. Arrived as the NY 40th Marathon was ending and many of the runners seemed to have chosen this hotel for its proximity to Central Park - a big bonus, particularly at this time of year - glorious Fall foliage. If you have a thing about smoking definitely stress 'non-smoking room' when booking and Tower A. Internet access is expensive $1 x 4 mins (and the system cheats when it comes to printing boarding cards!). On balance I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends - central to just about anywhere in Manhattan. If you want a really good experience with city tours, small groups, exceptional guides and drivers go for OnBoard Tours, www.newyorkpartyshuttle.com/tours - great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ScottieTO
Reviews.Content: As a first time vistor to NYC I was not sure what to expect after finding this hotel at $150 per night - which seemed a great deal compared to most other Manhattan hotels I researched. I was there for a 5 night stay with my wife and 2 young kids. On arrival staff were friendly and we were pleased with the room which was spacious enough and clean. As other reviews have highlighted, the decor is faded and a little tired, but at this price in Manhattan I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel as long as you're not looking for luxury - and if you are then pay the (significant) extra $$$'s so you won't be disappointed. On reading some reviews it seems to me that some are expecting more than what they paid for - it's a Holiday Inn at a discount price after all. In our experience, even with young kids, you'll be out exploring NYC most of your time and the hotel is for crashing in at the end of a tiring day. We did not use the restaurant at all during our stay, so I cannot comment on the service or the food. There are too many options for eating out in this city so staying in a hotel to eat did not appeal to us. The location has to be the best thing about staying in this hotel, we loved the fact that we could walk to Columbus Circle subway station in a few minutes and hop on to get anywhere in the city. Central Park is also within a short walking distance, and the Times Square and Theatre District is only a 10-15 min walk away. There are also restaurants, pubs and diners nearby when you want to stay close. The neighbourhood is pleasant and safe and not too noisy. We were out with the kids after dark many times and did not feel at all threatened here. To sum things up, this is a good value hotel situated in a great location for tourists. If I ever come back to NYC, I would definately book this hotel again. Just don't expect luxury for this price in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “don't do it”
Reviews.Author: 1freqtraveler
Reviews.Content: location is nice but goes from bad to worse once you walk through the door. staff very surly and unhelpful. tried to charge me $100 more per night than confirmed in writing. room and hallway had a very strange smell. rooms very run down. so bad that i checked out immediately and went to another hotel. intercontinental chain should be ashamed.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: ChloeHotSpringsAR
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. The rooms were clean and spacious. We stayed 5 nights and our maid brought us fresh towels and tidied the room everyday. We had breakfast coupons so we ate breakfast at the hotel. The breakfast was good, no problem w/ service. The bar was expensive, $7 for a beer and $12 for a cocktail. Did not hang out at the bar due to this. Found a great bar 1 block from hotel w/ better prices. (DJ Reynolds Irish pub) Lots of great restaurants around the corner. a diner across the street, my husband walked into the diner the morning we left and got us a cappuccino, very good. some street noise during the day, but it seems to quiet down around 10 pm. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “MUST READ Hotel is ok but not as great as portrayed”
Reviews.Author: crm1624
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at holiday Inn Midtown for 10 days. She had surgery at Sloan-kettering and was confined to the hotel for 5 days. The Pros good location for tourists, ok for us. Cleaning ladies are stars of the hotel extremely helpful and kind. Hotel meal was good. Staff all apprear professional and orderly. The Cons room has damp musty smell, Air condition off do to (season change) it was hot!! We had windows open all week at least the 6 inches they would open. Good sleep was hard to come by due to the noisy new york traffic just outside. During our stayed we saw one full grown roach run across the floor. The hotel does have a wheelchair my wife could use but customers are not allowed to take the wheelchair outside (it was useless). After my wife surgery the Dr ordered us to stay in new york an extra 3 days; However Holiday Inn was no help on extending our stay. We made resevations and move to another hotel a few blocks away. No continental breakfast. Meals were pricey and not included with rooms

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: cutecatSwansea
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the staff were very friendly and helpful. When we got to our room it was very big and clean and the beds were very comfortable however the bathroom was just ok it needed redecorating. we didn't have any meals at the hotel and the other thing is that you have to walk quite a bit to the nearest subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Faded and tired”
Reviews.Author: Topkoppite
Reviews.Content: We travelled across the USA on a tour organised by Great Rail Journeys of York between the 7th and 27th October 2009. We had 3 nights in New York at the Holiday Inn Midtown. We thought this was a hotel in big need of refurbishment – the decor was dark (greens, deep reds and browns) and faded and tired looking. While we were there a large number of new mattresses were being delivered! Our room was clean and was adequately serviced. The bathroom was ‘old fashioned’ with extensive use of plastics in the bathroom and with an erratic shower but both queen sized beds were comfortable and gave us a good nights sleep. TV reception was poor and we could clearly hear the family next door. There was no in-room safe. We didn’t eat in the hotel and the Pool was closed for the season. The concierge was helpful but on arrival it took the staff over an hour to deliver our luggage to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location But No Smiles :(”
Reviews.Author: Shejohn
Reviews.Content: This hotel wins on price and location! You can't argue that it represents good value and the rooms/bathrooms are more than adequate. However, it is greatly let down by the staff who treated us as if everything was too much trouble. We had booked 2 rooms for a family re-union each travelling from opposite ends of the world but in spite of booking some 4 months ago the hotel could not put us on the same floor. Caution to others: As we were travelling on flights from different parts of the world we arrived at significantly different times. As I had made the booking the hotel would not allow our family to check in until I arrived, in spite of them having a copy of the booking confirmation and the same surname. They were also charged for leaving their bags in the hotel until we arrived. On one occasion our room hadn't been serviced (OK, we accept anyone can make a mistake) so we went down and asked for some shampoo and coffee (one complimentary coffee is given each day), when this was finally brought to the room the person went off with the huff because we did not give a tip for something that should have been done anyway. Bell staff were also keen to push guests into unofficial overpriced "taxis" as opposed to the cheaper yellow cabs. Throughout our stay we never got a hullo or a good morning and we were given to feel that guests, far from being paying customers were just a nuisance. We did however like having a coffee machine in our room and an ice machine in the corridor. From here we moved on to Holiday Inn By the Falls in Niagara in Canada, where the difference in attitude of the helpful staff was like a breath of fresh air. Visitor's tip (and New York runs on the other sort of tip so this is the only one you’ll get for free): If you stay here, try the Morning Star Restaurant for breakfast (turn right when you come out of the hotel, cross the road and it's on the corner), it's good value and the staff are all very helpful with suggestions and ideas on where to visit (it's a shame they did not work in the hotel! I would recommend this hotel on price and location if it was not for the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, great location, incl roof pool!”
Reviews.Author: Fabulousss
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine for a holiday. The rooms are small (like all Tourist hotels) but OK. Great is the POOL at the 14th store with a view over the city. Great after a day shopping in the heatness of june!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but that's about all.”
Reviews.Author: SiteSeea
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for a week in September in a north facing room (no direct sun for most of the day) Very dark ; the room had a distinctive damp smell the entire time (even after cleaners had been through). The bathroom was particularly bad. Ended up buying deodoriser from the corner store. The room itself was tired and the hotel needs a renovation at some point. No effort was made to present towels etc in an aesthetically pleasing way. When we arrived these things were just strewn over the bath rail as if staff did not care. Other hotels pay attention to these sorts of details and are standard for rooms of a similar price. Perhaps for $300 a night that's what you get in NYC ? I will say though the concierge team were helpful and the housekeeping staff were pleasant as well . However, the porters did not acknowledge us or offer to help in any way the entire week. In fact they were more interested in leaning on their desk and talking amongst themselves. No attempt was made to help us with our luggage when we arrived. On our second day we ventured up to the pool area and were greeted by what I think were pool hands who looked like they had been dragged off the street. ( they were not wearing uniforms and could not be identified by name tags which in itself is a worry as they could have been up there to rob or harass guests) They made no attempt to acknowledge us our offer us assistance and were clearly hostile young men. We ended up leaving the pool as we felt unsafe and unwelcome . Again, in this context one would think front of house staff would at the very least smile rather than grimace at guests. Finally, while the condition of the hotel is not totally offensive it is rather tired. The porters and pool staff made me feel so uncomfortable I would not stay there again. The reception staff (except the woman who checked us in) were indifferent and reluctant to offer information on the odd occassion we made a request. I have on a previous occasions stayed at the Holiday Inn in Soho and had a far superior experience to the one I had at the mid town location for less than what I paid at Holiday Inn Midtown. In fact had I not have booked a non refundable advance purchase room (big mistake) I would have left after 1 night and gone to Soho as their rate through Expedia.com was cheaper for the week we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For Tourists”
Reviews.Author: sideswipe_uk
Reviews.Content: If your visiting New York for a week or less I would recommend this hotel, sure it's nothing special but it's reasonably priced and in a good location. If you're like me then you only want somewhere to put your head down for the night as you'll be out sightseeing etc., and this is the place for just that. The hotel is about 10-15 minute walk from Times Square and there are plenty of places to eat, on 7th & 8th Avenue, again within walking distance. Also, I would mention that this hotel seemed to be on one of the more quieter streets in New York, which does help, as New York is probably the noisiest city I've ever visited, so you'll be glad of the reduced noise.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Kmostella
Reviews.Content: It was a great location-near Central Park and a reasonable walk away from Times Square. The rooms were good-sized and it was clean & mod priced

Reviews.Title: “New York city in August”
Reviews.Author: kikineedsbeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 57th st Holiday Inn and what a great neighborhood that is in the summer. Just a quick walk away from Central Park, and Lincoln Center. A block from the subway. Overall a great trip. That hotel is nasty though, and we stayed there based on reviews from Trip Advisor, so I don't know what's going on with that. The swimming pool was saving longue chairs for "members" of the pool. Not hotel guests. We had to sit over on the "sun deck", but there were no chairs there. The pool was a scam. Just accept that there is nowhere reasonable in Manhattan with an outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “good value, clean facilities. Will stay again! NEW MATTRESSES SEPTEMBER 09”
Reviews.Author: mudsweatngears
Reviews.Content: travelled with my wife and two young kids to New York. Booked the holiday Inn becuase it was not ridiculoulsy priced like a lot of New York Hotels. VERY happy with it, clean bacthrooms, clean rooms, nice pool and for everybodies information as we left (september 8 2009) they were changing EVERY mattress in the entire north tower for a brand new one. I seem to find a lot of whingers on this site who want the Waldorf Astoria on a Holiday Inn budget, If you want the best then open your wallet. But if you want good, clean and honest accomodation that is a walk to central Park, 9th avenue restaurants, even Times square then you cant beat the Holiday Inn. and the restaurant served a very reasonably priced breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Do you like BIG cockroaches?????”
Reviews.Author: trippinfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Holiday Inn for 2 nights-- we got a good deal on the internet, and the location seemed good-- close to public transportation and a block from a PINKBERRY! :) It's an older hotel, so it was showing its age. It was very noisy, and we heard every time someone on our floor flushed a toilet. Both nights, at 4 in the morning, we were awoken by people running down the halls and screaming and yelling to each other. We would have been okay with that, however the second night our daughter woke us up screaming because a 3 inch cockroach was crawling across her face. We caught it. When we checked out, we brought it to the manager, and he was not impressed. He did not even apologize, and simply looked at the cockroach as if it was a normal occurrence, shrugged, and said, "There's nothing I can do about it," with a bored countenance. We will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “OK - if your only sleeping there!!”
Reviews.Author: DeeCot
Reviews.Content: This is a very dated hotel in need of a refurb. The rooms were clean enough - but with no air con it was pretty stuffy. We opened the windows at the few inches that they would allow and ended up covered in mosquito bites, which was pretty uncomfortable for the rest of the holiday. If you plan to be out of the hotel most of the time and will only use it to get washed/showered etc and sleep there the its ok, although it is a bit out of the way, but there is a subway a couple of blocks away. The only saving grace really was that we were just around the corner from 9th avenue which has a lot of really nice restaurants and bars where the I was told the New Yorkers eat and drink - we tried a few and they were extremely nice and prices weren't too bad either!!

Reviews.Title: “location excelent”
Reviews.Author: rosemargaretDublin
Reviews.Content: After reading all reviews of holiday inn i was not happy about going.What a great surprise i got.We booked with american holidays that could have made a difference in the accommodation we got.Our room was very spacious clean and excelent view from the 17th floor overlooking the swimming pool and the bay to the right side and new yorks skyline.We never closed our blinds once as we were fascinated with what we could see.I was very worried about people saying the smell of tobacco all over the loppy and on the corridors i dont know what part of the building they were in.The building is old but is well kept clean fresh towels every day sheets changed when we wanted.Bathroom is small but you can live with that as we did for five days.i found every one to be very helpful.I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in a handy location.”
Reviews.Author: cheshirelad01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location as the starting point for our roadtrip to Cape Cod & Boston, the hotel is a good average hotel, nothing to really shout about but a great base to explore the city from, no major issues, our room was clean & well maintained, plenty of room for our family of two adults & two children, the rest of the hotel was also clean & seemed well maintained, the only stumbling point was the elevators, only 4 elevators in a large hotel full of tourists adds up to a wait ,I know this but all the same bit of a pain at times. The rooftop pool was great & had a small bar serving drinks & simple snacks(hot dogs,ice cream e.t.c) a nice touch when the weather is hot. As I have already said one of the good points is the location, we easily walked to several places with no problem including Central Park & Times Square from the hotel, Check in/out easy & quick , maid service very good , all in all a great place to stay when visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: paulinen
Reviews.Content: I give this hotel 4 stars mainly for its value. I prepaid and got 5 nights for $135 per night which is an absolute bargain. Hotel is in an excellent area, rooms whilst old are clean and large. Had quite a few dealings with different staff and found them all very courteos and helpfull. Pool area was clean and relaxing and was one of the reasons I booked the hotel. Would stay here again if I got a good deal again

Reviews.Title: “A good deal and love the location!!”
Reviews.Author: happyglobaltraveler
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel, I was very skeptical after reading other reviews. I am a Priority member and I stayed in the Tower A twice. One time at the lower level and one time at the higher level. Yes, you can hear the slam of the door and people talking outside the hallway. The elevator was ok for us. Only one time around 11:30am when a lot of people checking out, the elevator was slow. Other times were fine. There a little places like lamp, or remote control not working, or mold on shower curtain, but that did not really bother me. I guess I am not a fussy person. The service is not friendly, but I expect that from New York City. All I care is the location and the big clean room. One time the doorman asked us if we want taxi and he got hotel limo for us to go to La Guardia and charged us $35 which I felt I got ripped off. (when we come back to the city and took taxi by meters, it was only $27). So, next time we went to JFK, we got cab ourselve. Because the location, it is very easy to get a cab on your own. You save the tip for the doorman. I would stay at this hotel again because the price is good and love the location and don't need to be crowded with other tourists in places like the hotels in Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Deboragh
Reviews.Content: We have never been to New York and went for our 25th wedding aniversary. After reading reviews on small rooms decided to go for a well known chain, the fact it had a pool on the roof helped (not that we had time to use it much but an added bonus). Very helpful staff, clean rooms and good location. Deboragh and Stuart North East of England

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: karenilena
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel back in August.....I have to say the rooms were very clean... It is not a 5 star hotel but the location is pretty central to many attractions. The staff were very courteous although the lady at the desk when we first arrived was a bit standoffish, but perhaps we were all tired from a very long trip and we were a bit hypersensitive. The cleanliness of the room made up for it though......On one instance I left a little note for the cleaners to clean the glue off from around the toilets and to my great surprise they did. The corridors and elevator leading to the rooms were not so terrific but I would give this hotel a 4 star for overall cleanliness and location.

Reviews.Title: “You are in New York! its a place to crash after a busy day!”
Reviews.Author: CardiffFlynny
Reviews.Content: We arrived after midnight and were very tired, the night receptionist was lovely very helpful he checked us in quickly and efficiently. They had double booked so put us for the first night into a top floor suite, i was quietly disapointed on seeing this as it had two rooms but only one bed and a pull out sofa bed. We looked for extra bedding and there was none apart from a sheet and a pillow already on the pull out bed. Who cares we were so tired it didnt matter! the next day we were moved to a 7th floor room and that was fine. The rooms seemed clean, they provided an ironing board, hairdrier etc normal things. There is an ice machine on the 7th floor. There is no mini bar. I am used to having a safety deposit box in the room and was disappointed to have one in the reception area, so didnt bother and kept my stuff with me. It would have been nice to have a kettle in the room, perhaps thats just a British thing, its quite sad but we bought tea bags and boiled water through the coffee maker(you have to be quite resourceful). Breakfasts were ok, you are seated on arrival in the dining room and offered orange juice and tea, coffee or chocolate. Most of the menu involved an egg in some form or another, the pancakes were nice and the french toast was lovely! They always offered just Corn flakes but there were quite a few others so just ask. Every thing was charged separately and we had a priority club card which had points accumulated on it and this provided a discount of $10 off the bill.(it normally cost around $20.00 for 2 of us each morning. The location was really good its near most of the attractions we only had one taxi and walked back every night from the Time Square area. We regretted only turning right out of the hotel every day when on the last day we discovered the amazing cafes and resturants when you turn LEFT! This hotel was practical its all you need if your priority is sightseeing and sleeping(recovering from blistered feet!). Sign up to the Priority Club card through this chain of hotels as we had accumulated enough points to benefit from 2 free nights and a discounted breakfast. (It all helps as you can spend the extra on a good show or some Comedy Club tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with my stay”
Reviews.Author: tfcfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights on my own during a trip to New York on holiday. Check in was quick, friendly and efficient. Room was clean and had quite a cosy feel to it for a place of this kind. All the cable channels were on the TV. Housekeeping was faultless. I didn't try the breakfast. Rooftop pool was a reasonable size and had a lot of sun loungers available for use (NB - pool is only available during summer months). Overall, the place felt welcoming and at about £90 per night represented decent value for NYC. I would definitely consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nightmare...just a bad dream”
Reviews.Author: a_traveller_like_you
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel strictly for its location and price point so we didn't expect much since we just wanted somewhere safe and clean to sleep in that was in a good central location. The hotel delivered...but BARELY. Stayed from August 31 to Sept 3, 2009. First the good: As mentioned the location and price were definitely acceptable. Very safe and close to the subway and points of interest like Central Park. Housekeeping was very friendly and always greeted us with a smile. The room was spacious (we were in tower B). We didn't have time to use the gym but it is very well equipped (privately owned) but free for guests. Head east to the end of the block and you'll find a fantastic diner called Morning Star Restaurant. Family owned so the service was "New York" charming (and I mean that in a very good way). Not much to see from the outside...not much from the inside but the food was perfect and the service very very friendly. I regret not remembering the two waiters names but they are really good guys. So friendly and helpful, feel free to ask them for any advice, directions or suggestions on what to do. This price was also very reasonable unlike many other flashy diners. The bed was very comfortable and the a/c worked well although despite being a little bit noisy. Now the bad: For us, customer service is very VERY important. The parking guys were okay but I was not impressed with them leaning on our car as we unloaded our bags ourselves (bell hops were no where to be seen). I guess they really didn't care since they don't work for the hotel but for a contracted parking company called Apex. On a brighter note the cost of valet parking was reasonable ($25/day) and we did get our car back quickly without any noticable scratches. We interacted with 3 different front desk people on 3 different occasions and each clerk we spoke to never offered a smile or anything that resembled warmth....in fact one of them actually stopped smiling as I approached them. They did their jobs but honestly, how hard is it to be just a little friendly? HELLO!! You are in the HOSPITALITY business! A small fridge will cost you $10/day. I discovered this when I called to request one but decided to think about it. The next day I decided to invest in the convenience of a fridge since the ice machine was not on my floor (the one above was broken but the one on the floor below was barely working). This time they inform me it would cost me $25/day. I attempted to clarify why it was $10 yesterday and today it was $25...they respond "we are sending one up now". "Well how much will it cost" I reply, to which they respond "complimentary". I still don't know what exactly happened there but this is one of those times when 2 wrongs actually do make a right... The wifi at this hotel is very VERY slow and inconsistent. There isn't a wired option and sometimes it would give you a message that too many users are connected! The bathroom....NO counter space and an interesting stench...a body order / urinal like bouquet greeted the nose upon entering the room. The entire hotel also had a unique aroma...old cigarette smoke complimented with cheap air freshener with a delicate touch of must. The decor was also very depressing and in serious need of renovations. Summary: Decide for yourself if this is the hotel you would like to stay in. As for us, in the future we will invest a little bit more money for the niceties that this hotel apparently cannot deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Non smokers beware!”
Reviews.Author: jansjournal
Reviews.Content: First time in NY and looking for a bargin 3 night 4 day break. This hotel fits the bill. Friendly helpful staff, roof top pool although we were too busy sight-seeing to see it, good location, spacious rooms which I believe are a premium in the Big Apple. If you book with EBOOKERS, who were great and efficient, remember to read the small print because even if you book a non-smoking room with them they can only request it to the hotel. YOU MUST RING THE HOTEL DIRECT TO REQUEST IT! 14th floor stinks of stale cigarettes!!!! Once in your room its not quite so bad. We couldn't change rooms as they were full and had to request new pillows as they also smelt. Didn't ruin our fantastic trip but just wanted to pass on the tip. Also dont bother with the transit bus from JFK to Manhattan. We had to wait 30 mins for a crowded stuffy mini-bus. Take a cab, it must be worth the extra few dollars. Fantastic trip. Good hotel Already saving to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: VMA79
Reviews.Content: What a lovely place to stay in New York! The location is the best, staff friendly and helpful, room was clean and spacious... The hotel is located only a couple of bloks away from Central Park and metro station is close too. You could easily walk or take a train to see spots further away. There are nice places to eat breakfast, lunch etc. close to the hotel. We didn't eat in the hotel but would have tried that too if we had had more time. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Especially the concierge who helped us with musical tickects and many other things. Our room had enough room to fit three friends in the same room easily and it was clean. The bathroom could use a little renovating but it didn't bother us. We saw the pool on top of the hotel and it looked nice and clean but we didn't have time to use it. If I ever go to New York again I'll definately stay at this same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable stay again”
Reviews.Author: Teramo48
Reviews.Content: We stayed here again for one night to attend the NY International Gift Show. The check-in staff were friendly and efficient. Our room (1140 North Tower) was large and clean. The furnishings were a little worn but acceptable. The air-conditioner worked better this time. We had to ask the front desk to turn off the message light on the phone--I couldn't get it off. I also asked them to repair the deadbolt while we went to dinner, but this repair wasn't accomplished during our stay. The concierge wasn't very helpful in finding a restaurant--we were told just to walk down 9th Ave. But overall the hotel is a great find--both for value and location.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely surprise”
Reviews.Author: nursie1Manchester
Reviews.Content: As the title says, it was a lovely surprise after reading some of the reviews on here, I was quite anxious about our trip after some peoples opinions but i needn't have worried. The hotel was clean, the rooms were large with very comfortable beds/pillows. Ideally situated in quiet streets away from the hustle and bustle, but also within a short walk too. The concierge was extremely helpful in checking our flight times and confirming with the airline that we would be travelling, he organised the transport to the airport (limo) at not much more than 2 taxis would have been for 7 of us. Food: Europan (turn left on 9th Ave)great for snacks if you have just arrived and in need of something quick, try Brooklyn Diner they do the most amazing scrambled egg and polenta. The sight seeing tour bus (circle line) was the best money we spent 2 day hop on hop off with tour guide - brilliant. I wouldnt hesitate to recommend or go back to the Holiday Inn - free safety deposit boxes too!!!! And the pool, what a bonus just what you need after a long day on your feet, shame it doesnt open a bit later though.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Midtown Surprise”
Reviews.Author: MoonTwpMan
Reviews.Content: I took my kids to Manhatten for a few days of sightseeing, and wanted to be central, with short cab or subway stops to most attractions. This hotel is very close to Columbus Circle and Central Park, and not too far from most midtown attractions like the Museum of Natural History, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Empire State Building, FAO Schwartz and Times Square (with Toys R Us). The neighborhood is mostly residential so the streets were relatively quiet. The front of the hotel is on 57th St. between 9th and 10th Avenues, and the back is on 56th St. With two blocks of rooms, all rooms are either on those two relatively quiet streets or facing the other tower, so street noise is minimized. There are some small shops and eateries around the hotel, and of course it being a Holiday Inn they have a restaurant on site, but we didn't use it at all. The brand pretty much determines it will not be a luxury facility, and as is typical of the brand, it is a popular destination for foreign tourists, so if that bothers you I wouldn't stay here. Overall though I was expecting much worse for the price. We stayed a Sunday and Monday night and paid about $128/night plus tax, which seemed pretty reasonable for the location and time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: karenpStLouis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. Everything was great...especially the price! I got the room for $119!!!! On the internet with AAA discount! This was a great rate for NYC! It is very convienent to anyplace you want to see! It was clean..Check in and check out was very quick! We got to the hotel around noon and immediately was given our room. Had a few drinks in the lounge, it was nice...only thing missing would be a free breakfast! And the rooftop pool closed at 6pm. Would be nice to stay open at least till 8 especially for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with a pool!”
Reviews.Author: dage
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our 12 year old daughter and one her best friend, 13 years old friend. We needed a hotel with a pool, even in New York, not easy to find at a reasonable price with 2 double beds! I usually prefer a 4* hotel than a 3*, but this one is a great value, especially in Midtown, close to everything. Good size room, and a outdoor pool on the 12th floor! The girls thought it was great, and so did my husband and I. The whole personnel was great, same for the front desk personnel and the concierge. Great family value.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: hayeslindsay
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews about the hotel I was a little skeptical about what I was getting myself into. But, upon arrival I was pleasantly surprised about how great the hotel actually was! The lobby is open concept and very clean & friendly, our room was ready early (no waiting), we requested a refrigerator and it was installed not 5 mins from arriving.
